On Energy Efc ent Hierarchical Cross Layer Design Joint Power Control and Routing for Ad Hoc Networks Cristina Co manic iu Vincent Poor Stevens Institute of Technology Princeton University mail co manic stevens edu poor princeton edu Abstract In this paper hierarchical cross layer design approach is proposed to increase energy efc ien cy in ad hoc networks through joint adaptation of nodes transmitting powers and routes election The design maintains the advantages of the classic OSI model while accounting for the cross coupling between layers through information sharing The proposed joint power control and routing algorithm is shown to increase sign cant ly the overall energy efc ien cy of the network at the expense of moderate increase in complexity Performance enhancement of the joint design using multiuser detection is also investigated and it is shown that the use of multiuser detection can increase the capacity of the ad hoc network sign cant ly for given level of energy consumption Keywords ad hoc networks power control routing cross layer This work was presented in part at the nd IEEE Conference on Decision and Control Maui HI December This research was supported by the National Science Foundation under Grants ANI and CR and by the New Jersey Center for Pervasive Information Technology

Ec ent Batch Update of Unique den tiers in Distributed Hash Table for Resources in Mobile Host Yoo Chung November Abstract Resources in distributed system can be den tied using den tiers based on random numbers When using distributed hash table to resolve such den tiers to network locations the straightforward approach is to store the network location directly in the hash table entry associated with an den tier When mobile host contains large number of resources this requires that all of the associated hash table entries must be updated when its network address changes We propose an alternative approach where we store host den tier in the entry associated with resource den tier and the actual network address of the host in separate host entry This can drastically reduce the time required for updating the distributed hash table when mobile host changes its network address We also investigate under which ir cum stances our approach should or should not be used We evaluate and con rm the usefulness of our approach with experiments run on top of OpenD HT

Dynamics of Localization Phenomena for Hardcore Bosons in Optical Lattices Bir ger Horst mann Ignacio Ci rac and Tommaso Ros il de Max Planck Institut fur Quan ten op tik Hans opfer mann Stra Garching Germany Institut fur The or et is che Ph sik Friedrich Schiller Universitat Max Wien Platz Jena Germany We investigate the behavior of ultra cold bosons in optical lattices with disorder potential gene ted via secondary species frozen in random cong rations The statistics of disorder is associated with the physical state in which the secondary species is prepared The resulting random potential albeit displaying algebraic correlations is found to lead to localization of all single particle states We then investigate the real time dynamics of localization for hardcore gas of mobile bosons which are brought into sudden interaction with the random potential Regardless of their initial state and for any disorder strength the mobile particles are found to reach steady state characterized by exponentially decaying diagonal correlations and by the absence of quasi condensation when the mobile particles are initially conned in tight trap and then released in the disorder potential their expansion is stopped and the steady state is exponentially localized in real space clearly revealing Anderson localization PAC numbers Lm Mn My Rn

Communication Model for Adaptive Service Provisioning in Hybrid Wireless Networks MATTHIAS RUST AND STEFFEN ROTH KU GEL Faculty of Sciences Technology and Communication University of Luxembourg Luxembourg Luxembourg Mr rust yahoo de Steffen Roth ku gel uni lu Abstract Mobile entities with wireless links are able to form mobile ad hoc network Such an infrastructure less network does not have to be administrated However self organizing principles have to be applied to deal with upcoming problems information dissemination These kinds of problems are not easy to tackle requiring complex algorithms Moreover the usefulness of pure ad hoc networks is arguably limited Hence enthusiasm for mobile ad hoc networks which could eliminate the need for any fixed infrastructure has been damped The goal is to overcome the limitations of pure ad hoc networks by augmenting them with instant Internet access via integration of MTS respectively GSM links However this raises multiple questions at the technical as well as the organizational level Motivated by characteristics of small world networks that describe an efficient network even without central or organized design this paper proposes to combine mobile ad hoc networks and infrastructure networks to form hybrid wireless networks One main objective is to investigate how this approach can reduce the costs of permanent backbone link and providing in the same way the benefits of useful information from Internet connectivity or service providers For the purpose of bridging between the different types of networks an adequate middle ware service is the focus of our investigation This paper shows our first steps forward to this middle ware by introducing the Injection Communication paradigm as principal concept Key Words Injection Communication Hybrid Wireless Network Ad hoc Network Backbone Network Infrastructure Network

Epidemic modeling in meta population systems with heterogeneous coupling pattern theory and simulations Vittoria Col izz and Alessandro Ves pig nani School of Informatics and Bio complexity Institute Indiana University Bloomington IN USA Complex Networks Lagrange Laboratory NLL Institute for Sci en tic Interchange IS Torino Italy February The spatial structure of populations is key element in the understanding of the large scale spreading of epidemics Motivated by the recent empirical evidence on the heterogeneous properties of transportation and commuting patterns among urban areas we present thorough analysis of the behavior of infectious diseases in meta population models characterized by heterogeneous connectivity and mobility patterns We derive the basic reaction diu sion equation describing the meta population system at the mechanistic level and derive nearly stage dynamics approximation for the sub population invasion dynamics The analytical description uses degree block variables that allows us to take into account arbitrary degree distribution of the meta population network We show that along with the usual single population epidemic threshold the meta population network exhibits global threshold for the sub population invasion We nd an explicit analytic expression for the invasion threshold that determines the minimum number of individuals traveling among sub populations in order to have the infection of macroscopic number of sub populations The invasion threshold is function of factors such as the basic reproductive number the infectious period and the mobility process and it is found to decrease for increasing network heterogeneity We provide extensive mechanistic numerical Monte Carlo simulations that recover the analytical ding in wide range of meta population network connectivity patterns The results can be useful in the understanding of recent data driven computational approaches to disease spreading in large transportation networks and the eec of containment measures such as travel restrictions Keywords Meta population models Epidemic spreading Complex networks

Charge transport in disordered organic solids Monte Carlo simulation study on the effects of film morphology Raj Mohan Joshi and Manora njan Singh Laser Physics Applications Division Raja Ram anna Centre for Advanced Technology Indore MP India email mukesh cat er net in Abstract The influence of ordered regions micro crystal lites and aggregates in the other wise disordered polymer host matrix on field and temperature dependence of mobility has been simulated Increase in concentration of ordered regions leads to increase in magnitude of mobility and in high field regime the saturation of the mobility occurs at lower electric field strength The influence of different mean and standard deviation of Gaussian density of states DOS of ordered regions on the field dependence of mobility was studied and found to be significant only at higher concentrations Weak influence of these parameters at low concentrations are attributed to the strong interface effects due to the difference in the standard deviation of DOS of two regions host and ordered region and shallow trapping effect by ordered regions For all the parameters of ordered regions under investigation the temperature dependence of mobility log and the slope of log Vs plot show dependence PAC Le Lg Ph Keywords Molecular ly doped polymers Disordered system Morphology Electronic transport Aggregation Monte Carlo simulation

Rethinking Information Theory for Mobile Ad Hoc Networks Jeff Andrews Ni har Jindal Martin Hae ngg Randy Berry Syed Jafar Dong ning Guo Sanjay hak kot tai Robert Heath Michael Neely Steven Weber yl in Yen er Abstract The subject of this paper is the long standing open problem of developing general capacity theory for wireless networks particularly theory capable of describing the fundamental performance limits of mobile ad hoc networks MANET MANET is peer to peer network with no pre existing infrastructure MANET are the most general wireless networks with single hop relay interference mesh and star networks comprising special cases The lack of MANET capacity theory has stunted the development and commercialization of many types of wireless networks including emergency military sensor and community mesh networks Information theory which has been vital for links and centralized networks has not been successfully applied to decentralized wireless networks Even if this was accomplished for such theory to truly characterize the limits of deployed MANET it must overcome three key roadblocks First most current capacity results rely on the allowance of unbounded delay and reliability Second spatial and timescale decomposition have not yet been developed for optimal ly modeling the spatial and temporal dynamics of wireless networks Third useful network capacity theory must integrate rather than ignore the important role of overhead messaging and feedback This paper describes some of the shifts in thinking that may be needed to overcome these roadblocks and develop more general theory that we refer to as non equilibrium information theory The Need for Network Information Theory Information theory has provided scientific foundation for the development of some of society most advanced and beloved technologies including computers cellular phones and the Internet It seems natural that technologies such as these will converge allowing ubiquitous wireless connectivity However the performance limits of the decentralized wireless networks of the future are presently not known and optimal approaches to designing these networks are known Andrews hak kot tai and Heath are with UT Austin Jindal is with Minnesota Hae ngg with Notre Dame Berry and Guo with Northwestern Neely with USC Weber with Drexel Jafar with UC Irvine Yen er with Penn State Andrews andrews ece texas edu is the corresponding author Last saved

Geographical dispersal of mobile communication networks Renaud Lamb io tte Vincent Blondel Cristobal de Kerch ove Etienne Hue ns Christophe rieur Zbigniew more da Paul Van Door en Department of Mathematical Engineering Universit catholique de Louvain avenue Georges Le maitre Louvain la Neuve Belgium Institute for Mathematical Sciences Imperial College London Princes Gate South Kensington campus SW PG UK Sociology and Economics of Networks and Services Department Orange Labs Issy les Moulin eaux France Dated October Abstract In this paper we analyze statistical properties of communication network constructed from the records of mobile phone company The network consists of million customers that have placed millions of communications phone calls and text messages over period of months and for whom we have geographical home localization information It is shown that the degree distribution in this network has power law degree distribution and that the probability that two customers are connected by link follows gravity model decreases like where is the distance between the customers We also consider the geographical extension of communication triangles and we show that communication triangles are not only composed of geographically adjacent nodes but that they may extend over large distances This last property is not captured by the existing models of geographical networks and in last section we propose new model that reproduces the observed property Our model which is based on the migration and on the local adaptation of agents is then studied analytically and the resulting predictions are con med by computer simulations PAC numbers Le Hk

In Vol No xxxx Reliability based Framework for Multi path Routing Analysis in Mobile Ad Hoc Networks Marcello Cale ff Giancarlo Ferr iu lo Luigi aura Di parti men to di Inge gner let tronic delle Telecom nica zion DIET Universit degli Studi di Napoli Federico II Napoli ITALY Lab oratorio Nazionale di Comuni ca zion Multimedia li CN IT Napoli ITALY Aut or it per le Gar anz ie elle Comuni ca zion AG COM Centro Dire zion ale Isola Torre Francesco Napoli ITALY mail addresses name surname un in it Abstract Unlike traditional routing procedures that at the best single out unique route multi path routing protocols discover pro actively several alternative routes It has been recognized that multi path routing can be more efficient than traditional one mainly for mobile ad hoc networks where route failure events are frequent Most studies in the area of multi path routing focus on heuristic methods and the performances of these strategies are commonly evaluated by numerical simulations The need of theoretical analysis motivates such paper which proposes to resort to the terminal pair routing reliability as performance metric This metric allows one to assess the performance gain due to the availability of route diversity By resorting to graph theory we propose an analytical framework to evaluate the tolerance of multi path route discovery processes against route failures for mobile ad hoc networks Moreover we derive useful bound to easily estimate the performance improvements achieved by multi path routing with respect to any traditional routing protocol Finally numerical simulation results show the effectiveness of this performance analysis Keywords MANET reliability multi path routing ad hoc graph theory overlay graph Biographical notes Marcello Cale ff was born in Bond eno Italy on October He received the Dr Eng degree summa cum laude in computer science engineering in from the University of Lecce Italy He is currently pursuing the Ph degree in electronic and telecommunications engineering with the Department of Electronic and Telecommunications Engineering DIET University of Napoli Federico II Italy His research activities lie in the area of ad hoc wireless networks protocol design In particular his current interests are focused on routing for mobile ad hoc networks Giancarlo Ferr iu lo received the La urea degree summa cum laude in electronic engineering from the Second University of Naples Italy in and the Ph degree from the University of Naples Federico II in In he spent period as Visiting Researcher in the Department of Electrical Engineering of Stanford University In the period December June he has been researcher at the Department of Electronic and Telecommunication Engineering of the University of Naples Push Pull autonomous deployment of mobile sensors for complete coverage TECHNICAL REPORT Novella Bartol in Ti zi an alamo neri Emanuele Guido Fu sco Anna lisa Mass in and Simone Silvestri Department of Computer Science pienza University of Rome Italy bartol in alamo fu sco mass in simone silvestri di uni roma it Abstract Mobile sensor networks are important for several strategic applications devoted to monitoring critical areas In such hostile scenarios sensors cannot be deployed manually and are either sent from safe location or dropped from an aircraft Mobile devices permit dynamic deployment recon gu ration that improves the coverage in terms of completeness and uniformity In this paper we propose distributed algorithm for the autonomous deployment of mobile sensors called Push Pull According to our proposal movement decisions are made by each sensor on the basis of locally available information and do not require any prior knowledge of the operating conditions or any manual tuning of key parameters We formally prove that when as uci ent number of sensors are available our approach guaran tees complete and uniform coverage Furthermore we demonstrate that the algorithm execution always terminates preventing movement oscillations Numerous simulations show that our algorithm reaches complete coverage within reasonable time with moderate energy consumption even when the target area has irregular shapes Per form ance comparisons between Push Pull and one of the most acknowledged algorithms show how the former one can cie ntl reach more uniform and complete coverage under wide range of working scenarios

Dynamical heterogeneity in glass forming ideal gas Patrick Char bonn eau Chin may Das and Daan Fr enke OM Institute for Atomic and Molecular Physics Kru isla an SJ Amsterdam The Netherlands Department of Physics and Astronomy University of Leeds Leeds LS JT UK Dated October We conduct numerical study of the dynamical behavior of system of three dimensional crosses particles that consist of three mutually perpendicular line segments of length rigidly joined at their midpoints In an earlier study van Ke tel et al Ph ys Rev Let we showed that this model has the structural properties of an ideal gas yet the dynamical properties of strong glass former In the present paper were port an extensive study of the dyna ical he te rogen ei ties that appear in this system in the regime where glassy behavior sets in On the one hand we nd that the propensity of particle to di use is determined by the structure of its local environment The local density around mobile particles is sign cant ly less than the average density but there is little clustering of mobile particles and the clusters observed tend to be small On the other hand dynamical susceptibility results indicate that large dynamical length scale develop seven at moderate densities This suggests that propensity and other mobility measures are an incomplete measure of dynamical length scales in this system PAC numbers Fs Lc Jj

Published in Sensors vol no pp Open Access at http www dpi org sensors papers pdf Wireless Sensor Actuator Network Design for Mobile Control Applications Feng Xia Yu Chu Tian Yan jun Li and You xian Sun State Key Laboratory of Industrial Control Technology Zhejiang University Hangzhou China mail xia ieee org Faculty of Information Technology Queensland University of Technology GPO Box Brisbane QLD Australia mail tian qu edu au Abstract Wireless sensor actuator networks SANs are emerging as new generation of sensor networks Serving as the backbone of control applications SANs will enable an unprecedented degree of distributed and mobile control However the unreliability of wireless communications and the real time requirements of control applications raise great challenges for SAN design With emphasis on the reliability issue this paper presents an application level design methodology for SANs in mobile control applications The solution is generic in that it is independent of the underlying platforms environment control system models and controller design To capture the link quality characteristics in terms of packet loss rate experiments are conducted on real SAN system From the experimental observations simple yet efficient method is proposed to deal with unpredictable packet loss on actuator nodes Trace based simulations give promising results which demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed approach Keywords wireless sensor actuator network sensor network control application link quality packet loss

Simulations of Large scale Wi Fi based Wireless Networks Interdisciplinary Challenges and Applications Maz iar Neko vee and Rad hik Sak sena Mobility Research Centre British Telecom Polaris Ad astral Park Mart les ham Suo lk IP RE UK Centre for Computational Science University College London Gordon Street London WC UK Abstract Wireless Fidelity Wi Fi is the fastest growing wireless technology to date In add tion to providing wire free connectivity to the Internet Wi Fi technology also enables mobile devices to connect directly to each other and form highly dynamic wireless ad hoc networks Such distributed networks can be used to perform cooperative com muni cation tasks such ad data routing and information dissemination in the absence of axed infrastructure Furthermore ad hoc grids composed of wirelessly networked portable devices are emerging as new paradigm in grid computing In this paper we review computational and algorithmic challenges of high del it simulations of such Wi Fi based wireless communication and computing networks including cal able topology maintenance mobility modelling parallel is ation and synchronisation We explore similarities and dieren ces between the simulations of these networks and simulations of interacting many particle systems such as molecular dyna ics MD simulations We show how the cell linked list algorithm which we have adapted from our MD simulations can be used to greatly improve the com put ional performance of wireless network simulators in the presence of mobility and illustrate with an example from our simulation studies of worm attacks on mobile wireless ad hoc networks Key words Wireless Computer Networks Large scale Simulations Interacting Many Particle Systems Wireless Grids PAC Pre print submitted to Else vier October

Intrusion Detection in Mobile Ad Hoc Networks Using Classic ation Algorithms katerini Mitro kot Mano lisT sag kar is and Christos Dou liger is Abstract In this paper we present the design and evaluation of intrusion detection models for MANET using supervised classic ation algorithms Spec ic ally we evaluate the performance of the MultiLayer Perce ptr on LP the Linear classier the Gaussian Mixture Model MM the Nave Bayes classier and the Support Vector Machine SV The performance of the classic ation algorithms is val ted under different tr afc conditions and mobility patterns for the Black Hole Forging Packet Dropping and Flooding attacks The results indicate that Support Vector Machines exhibit high accuracy for almost all simulated attacks and that Packet Dropping is the hardest attack to detect

On Endogenous Recon gu ration in Mobile Robotic Networks Ket an Sav la Emilio razz oli Laboratory for Information and Decision Systems Massachusetts Institute of Technology ksa la razz oli mit edu Abstract In this paper our focus is on certain applications for mobile robotic networks where recon gu ration is driven by factors intrinsic to the network rather than changes in the external environment In particular we study version of the coverage problem useful for surveillance applications where the objective is to po it ion the robots in order to minimize the average distance from random point in given environment to the closest robot This problem has been well studied for omni directional robots and it is shown that optimal cong ration for the network is centro ida lV orono icon gu ration and that the coverage cost belongs to where mis the number of robots in the network In this paper we study this problem for more realistic models of robots namely the double integrator DI model and the dieren ti al drive DD model We observe that the introduction of these motion constraints in the algorithm design problem gives rise to an interesting behavior For sparser network the optimal algorithm for these models of robots mimics that for omni directional robots We propose novel algorithms whose performances are within constant factor of the optimal asymptotically as In particular we prove that the coverage cost for the DI and DD models of robots is of order Additionally we show that as the network grows these novel al go rit hms outperform the conventional algorithm hence necessitating are cong ration in the network in order to maintain optimal quality of service

Spectrum Sharing Between Cellular and Mobile Ad Hoc Networks Transmission Capacity Trade Off Kai bin Huang Vincent Lau Yan Chen Abstract Spectrum sharing between wireless networks improves the efc ien cy of spectrum usage and there by alleviates spectrum scarcity due to growing demands for wireless broadband access To improve the usual under utilization of the cellular uplink spectrum this paper studies spectrum sharing between cellular uplink and mobile ad hoc networks These networks access either all frequency sub channels or their disjoint sub sets called spectrum underlay and spectrum overlay respectively Given these spectrum sharing methods the capacity trade off between the coexisting networks is analyzed based on the transmission capacity of network with Poisson distributed transmitters This metric is de ned as the maximum density of transmitters subject to an outage constraint for given signal to interference ratio SIR Using tools from stochastic geometry the transmission capacity trade off between the coexisting networks is analyzed where both spectrum overlay and underlay as well as successive interference cancelation SIC are considered In particular for small target outage probability the transmission capacities of the coexisting networks are proved to satisfy linear equation whose coe fci ents depend on the spectrum sharing method and whether SIC is applied This linear equation shows that spectrum overlay is more efc ent than spectrum underlay Furthermore this result also provides insight into the effects of different network parameters on transmission capacities including link diversity gains transmission distances and the base station density In particular SIC is shown to increase transmission capacities of both coexisting networks by linear factor which depends on the interference power threshold for qualifying canceled interfere rs Index Terms Spatial reuse wireless networks Poisson processes spectrum sharing interference cancellation

Characterizing the Human Mobility Pattern in Large Street Network Bin Jiang Jun jun Yin and Si jian Zhao Division of Geo ma tics Department of Technology and Built Environment University of le Sweden Email bin jiang hig se injun jun gmail com College of Resources Science and Technology Beijing Normal University China Email can zhao hotmail com Abstract Previous studies demonstrated empirically that human mobility exhibits vy flight behaviour However our knowledge of the mechanisms governing this vy flight behaviour remains limited Here we analyze over peoples moving trajectories obtained from taxicabs during six month period in large street network and illustrate that the human mobility pattern or the vy flight behaviour is mainly attributed to the underlying street network In other words the goal directed nature of human movement has little effect on the overall traffic distribution We further simulate the mobility of large number of random walkers and find that the simulated random walkers can reproduce the same human mobility pattern and the simulated mobility rate of the random walkers correlates pretty well an square up to with the observed human mobility rate Keywords vy flight random walk street networks self organized natural streets GPS trajectories

Mobility Management Framework Peter Ful opa Bene dek Kovacs and or Im rec Department of Telecommunications Budapest University of Technology Pf Hungary Department of Mathematical Analysis Budapest University of Technology gry Jozsef Hungary Abstract This paper investigates mobility management strategies from the point of view of their need of signalling and processing resources on the backbone network and load on the air interface method is proposed to model the serving network and mobile node mobility in order to be able to compare the die rent types of mobility management algorithms To obtain good description of the network we calculate descriptive parameters from given topologies Most mobility approaches derived from existing protocols are analyzed and their performances are numerically compared in various network and mobility scenarios We developed mobility management framework that is able to give general designing guidelines for the next generation mobility management on given network technology and mobility properties With our model an operator can design the network and tune the parameters to obtain the optimal implementation of course revising existing systems is also possible We present vertical handover decision method as special application of our model framework Key words mobility management modeling network graph

The Impact of Mobility on Gossip Algorithms An and Sar wat Member IEEE and Alexandros Dima is Member IEEE Abstract The in en ce of node mobility on the convergence time of averaging gossip algorithms in networks is studied It is shown that small number of fully mobile nodes can yield sign cant decrease in convergence time method is developed for deriving lower bounds on the convergence time by merging nodes according to their mobility pattern This method is used to show that if the agents have one dimensional mobility in the same direction the convergence time is improved by at most constant Upper bounds are obtained on the convergence time using techniques from the theory of Markov chains and show that simple models of mobility can dramatically accelerate gossip as long as the mobility paths sign cant ly overlap Simulations show that these bounds are still valid for more general mobility models that seem analytically intractable and further illustrate that different mobility patterns can have sign cant ly different effects on the convergence of distributed algorithms

Ph ys Rev Four state rock paper scissors games in constrained Newman Watts networks Guo Yong Zhang Yong Chen Wei Kai Qi and Shao Meng Qing Institute of Theoretical Physics Lan zhou University Lan zhou China Department of Computer Science Hubei Normal University Huang shi China Department of Industrial Systems and Engineering The Hong Kong polytechnic University Hung Hom Kowloon Hong Kong China Dated November We study the cyclic dominance of three species in two dimensional constrained Newman Watts networks with four state variant of the rock paper scissors game By limiting the maximal con nec tion distance max in Newman Watts networks with the long rang connection probability we depict more realistically the stochastic interactions among species within ecosystems When we mobility and vary the value of or max the Monte Carlo simulations show that the spiral waves grow in size and the system becomes unstable and biodiversity is lost with increasing or max These results are similar to recent results of Reichenbach et al Nature London in which they increase the mobility only without including long range interactions We compared extinctions with or without long range connections and computed spatial correlation functions and correlation length We conclude that long range connections could improve the mobility of species drastically changing their crossover to extinction and making the system more unstable PAC numbers Cc Fb The question of how biological diversity is maintained has initiated increasingly more research from multiple angles in recent decades Mathematical modeling of population dynamics is widely recognized as useful tool in the study of many interesting features of ecological systems However the enormous number of interacting species found in the Earths ecosystems is major challenge for theoretical description For this reason researchers have built many implied models to describe the evolution of ecological systems over time One of the simplest cases is of three species that have relationships analogous to the game of rock paper scissors RPS where rock smashes scissors scissors cut paper and paper wraps rock It is well studied model of population dynamics and it can be class ed in two ways three state or four state models depending on whether we consider the empty state or not It is well known that such cyclic dominance can lead to nontrivial spatial patterns as well as coexistence of all three species Recently Reichenbach and co workers studied stochastic spatial variant of the RPS game In their study they run the game with four states the three original cyclically dominating states and fourth one that denotes empty space In addition they introduced form of mobility to mimic central feature of real ecosystems animal migration bacteria run and tumble They found that mobility has critical in en ce on species diversity When mobility exceeds certain value biodiversity is jeopardized and lost In contrast below this critical threshold value spatial patterns can form and help enable stable species diversity We shall take this population model as basis to construct new version of the three species food chain in the constrained Newman Watts NW networks In the model studied by Reichenbach and co workers they consider mobile individuals of three species referred to as and arranged on spatial lattice where each individual can only interact with its nearest neighbors In this study we introduce some stochastic long range interactions between elements of the lattice The stochastic long range interactions occur when there exist long range connections in the NW networks mimicking more real ecosystem birds can so they can prey not only near their nest but also at longer distances from the nest pathogens disperse by air and water biological invasions related to human in en ce occur over long distances and the long range dispersal of plant seeds is driven by large and migratory animals ocean currents and human transportation Of course the long range interaction cannot be in nite so we limit the distance of long range interactions to That is the individuals are assigned an interaction distance For the sake of simplicity we max consider that the maximum interaction distance and the long range interaction probability are the same for max all species With Monte Carlo MC simulations we show that the maximum interaction distance and the max long range interaction probability play an important role in the coexistence of all three species We consider the four state RPS model which was described in detail in Refs Here we give recap it Corresponding author Email chen lz edu cn

On Leveraging Partial Paths in Partially Connected Networks Technical Report TR Simon Heim li cher Mer our is Kara lio poul os Han och Levy and Thr as vo los Spyro poul os Computer Engineering and Networks Laboratory ETH Zurich Switzerland Abstract Mobile wireless network research focuses on scenarios at the extremes of the network connectivity continuum where the probability of all nodes being connected is either close to unity assuming connected paths be tween all nodes mobile ad hoc networks or it is close to zero assuming no multi hop paths exist at all delay tolerant networks In this paper we argue that sizable fraction of networks lies between these extremes and is characterized by the existence of partial paths multi hop path segments that allow forwarding data closer to the destination even when no end to end path is available fundamental issue in such networks is dealing with disruptions of end to end paths Under stochastic model we compare the performance of the established end to end retransmission ignoring partial paths against forwarding mechanism that leverages partial paths to forward data closer to the destination even during is rup tion periods Perhaps surprisingly the alternative mechanism is not necessarily superior However under stochastic monotonic it condition between current vs future path length which we demonstrate to hold in typical network models we manage to prove superiority of the alter native mechanism in stochastic dominance terms We believe that this study could serve as foundation to design more ec ent data transfer protocols for partially connected networks which could potentially help reducing the gap between applications that can be supported over disc on nec ted networks and those requiring full connectivity

Defect model for the mixed mobile ion effect revisited an importance of deformation rates Vladimir Be lost ot sky Curtis Place Rockville MD Email vlad bel ero ls com ABSTRACT The progress in understanding the behavior of glassy mixed ionic conductors within the concept of the defect model for the mixed mobile ion effect Be lost ot sky Non Cry st Solids is reported It is shown that in mixed ionic conductor mixed alkali glass containing two or more types of dissimilar mobile ions of unequal size sufficient local strain arising from the size mismatch of mobile ion entering foreign site can not be in principle absorbed by the surrounding network forming matrix without its damage Primary site rearrangement occurs immediately on the time scale close to that of the ion migration process through the formation of intrinsic defects in the nearest glass network Neither an elastic relaxation below glass transition temperature nor vis co elastic or viscous behavior at or above can be expected being observed in this case because the character of the stress relaxation in wide temperature range is dictated above all by the deformation rates employed locally to the adjacent network forming matrix Since the ion migration occurs on the picosecond time scale the primary rearrangement of the glass network adjacent to an ionic site occurs at rates orders of magnitude higher than those of the critical minimum values so the matrix demonstrates brittle elastic response to the arising strain even at temperatures well above which explains among other things why mixed alkali effect is observable in glass melts PAC Fs Ji Hs Keywords mixed mobile ion effect mixed alkali effect intrinsic defects glass transition temperature ionic conductivity critical deformation rate

SUBMITTED TO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON INFORMATION THEORY Information Propagation Speed in Mobile and Delay Tolerant Networks Philippe Jacquet Bernard Mans and Georgios Rod ola is Abstract The goal of this paper is to increase our understanding of the fundamental performance limits of mobile and Delay Tolerant Networks DT Ns where end to end multi hop paths may not exist and communication routes may only be available through time and mobility We use analytical tools to derive generic theoretical upper bounds for the information propagation speed in large scale mobile and intermittently connected networks In other words we upper bound the optimal performance in terms of delay that can be achieved using any routing algorithm We then show how our analysis can be applied to spec ic mobility and graph models to obtain spec ic analytical estimates In particular in two dimensional networks when nodes move at maximum speed and their density is small the network is sparse and surely disconnected we prove that the information propagation speed is upper bounded by in the random way point model while it is upper bounded by for other mobility models random walk Brownian motion We also present simulations that con rm the validity of the bounds in these scenarios Finally we generalize our results to one dimensional and three dimensional networks

Physical Model of Wireless Network Jean Marc Kel if Orange Labs Issy Les Moulin eaux France jean marc kel if orange ft group com Abstract Using an approach developed in physics we propose new framework for the study of cellular networks The key idea of the physical network model we propose is to replace the discrete base stations BS entities by continuum of transmitters which are spatially distributed in the network This allows us to establish closed form formula of the other cell down link interference factor as function of the location of the mobile We de ne here as the ratio of outer cell received power the power received from other cells to the inner cell received power This physical model allows calculating the in en ce of interference on any mobile in cell whatever its position Results obtained with that closed form formula are close to the ones obtained by simulations using traditional hexagonal network model Since the physical model allows to establish closed form formula of the interference factor it allows to do analytical studies of wireless networks such as outage probability quality of service capacity

Multi scale mobility networks and the large scale spreading of infectious diseases Duy gu Bal can Vittoria Col izz Bruno Goncalves Hao Hu Jose Ram asco and Alessandro Ves pig nani Center for Complex Networks and Systems Research School of Informatics and Computing Indiana University Bloomington IN USA Pervasive Technology Institute Indiana University Bloomington IN USA Computational Epidemiology Laboratory Institute for Sci en tic Interchange Torino Italy and Department of Physics Indiana University Bloomington IN USA Among the realistic ingredients to be considered in the computational modeling of infectious diseases human mobility represents crucial challenge both on the theoretical side and in view of the limited availability of empirical data In order to study the interplay between small scale commuting ow and long range airline tra in shaping the patio temporal pattern of global epidemic we analyze mobility data from countries around the world and nd gravity model able to provide global description of commuting patterns up to kms ii integrate in worldwide structured meta population epidemic model time scale separation technique for evaluating the force of infection due to multi scale mobility processes in the disease dynamics Commuting ow are found on average to be one order of magnitude larger than airline ow However their introduction into the worldwide model shows that the large scale pattern of the simulated epidemic exhibits only small variations with respect to the baseline case where only airline tra is considered The presence of short range mobility increases however the synchronization of sub populations in close proximity and ect the epidemic behavior at the periphery of the airline transportation infrastructure The present approach outlines the possibility for the den it ion of layered computational approaches where die rent modeling assumptions and granular ties can be used consistently in unifying multi scale framework

Secure Wireless Routing Protocol Using Enhanced Chain Signatures Amita bh xena International University Bruch sal Germany Abstract We propose routing protocol for wireless networks Wireless routing protocols allow hosts within network to have some knowledge of the topology in order to know when to forward packet via broadcast and when to drop it Since routing protocol forms the backbone of network it is lucrative target for many attacks all of which attempt to disrupt network tra by corrupting routing tables of neighboring routers using false updates Secure routing protocols designed for wired networks such as BGP are not scalable in an ad hoc wireless environment because of two main drawbacks the need to maintain knowledge about all immediate neighbors which requires discovery protocol and the need to transmit the same update several times one for each neighbor Although information about neighbors is readily available in fairly static and wired network such information is often not updated or available in an ad hoc wireless network with mobile devices Our protocol is variant of BGP called BGP and allows single broadcast for routing updates without having the need to be aware of every neighboring router The protocol is based on novel authentication primitive called Enhanced Chain Signatures EC

Practical Rate and Route Adaptation with Efc ent Link Quality Estimation for IEEE Multi Hop Networks Jing long Zhou Vijay Rao Pr ze my saw Paw ec zak Daniel Wu and Pra sant Moh patra Abstract Accurate and fast packet delivery ratio DR estimation used in evaluating wireless link quality is prerequisite to increase the performance of multi hop and multi rate IEEE wireless networks Unfortunately contemporary DR estimation methods beacon based packet counting in Estimated Transmission Time and Expected Transmission Count metrics have unsatisfactory performance There fore in this paper we propose novel DR estimation method based on SNR roles and special broadcast packets We classify all possible link quality estimation QE sources and compare them analytically against our design showing the superiority of our approach Further investigations with the prototype implementation of our method in IEEE test beds reveal that the QE accuracy in some scenarios can be improved up to in comparison to generic beacon packet based QE The proposed method is used in novel rate adaptation process while these two methods are jointly used in the routing process Experiments in different measurement scenarios show that the advanced QE leads to better rate adaptation and route selection in the form of end to end throughput increase compared to traditional QE methods Jing long Zhou and Magnet works how mobility impacts the design of Mobile Networks Alonso Silva it an Altman ct Mero ne Deb bah Gi use ppa Alfano November Abstract In this paper we study the optimal placement and optimal number of active relay nodes through the tra density in mobile sensor ad hoc networks We consider setting in which set of mobile sensor sources is creating data and set of mobile sensor destinations receiving that data We make the assumption that the network is massively dense there are so many sources destinations and relay nodes that it is best to describe the network in terms of macroscopic parameters such as their spatial density rather than in terms of microscopic parameters such as their individual placements We focus on particular physical layer model that is characterized by the follow ing assumptions the nodes must only transport the data from the sources to the destinations and do not need to sense the data at the sources or deliver them at the destinations once the data arrive at their physical locations and ii the nodes have limited bandwidth available to them but they use it optimal ly to locally achieve the network capacity In this setting the optimal distribution of nodes induces tra density that resembles the electric displacement that will be created if we substitute the sources and destinations with positive and negative charges respectively The analogy between the two settings is very tight and have direct interpretation in wireless sensor networks

Impact of Obstacles on the Degree of Mobile Ad Hoc Connection Graphs Cedric Gael Abou Nz Frederic Guin and and Yoann Pig ne University of Le Havre LIT IS EA BP Le Havre FRANCE Abstract What is the impact of obstacles on the graphs of connections between stations in Mobile Ad hoc Networks In order to answer atleast partially this question the rst step is to de nebo than environment with obstacles and mobility model for the stations in such an environment The present paper focuses on new way of considering the mobility within environments with obstacles while keeping the core ideas of the well known Random WayPoint mobility model aR WP Based on mesh partitioning of the space we propose new model called SP for which we compute the spatial distribution of stations and analyse how the presence of obstacles impacts this distribution compared to the distribution when no obstacles are present Coupled with simple model of radio propagation and according to the density of stations in the environment we study the mean degree of the connection graphs corresponding to such mobile ad hoc networks

Eec of Electric Field on Diu sion in Disordered Materials One dimensional Hopping Transport Nena she Jans son Baran ovsk ii ster back Dvu re chen ski and Gebhard Institute of Semiconductor Physics Novosibirsk Russia Novosibirsk State University Novosibirsk Russia Graduate School of Materials Research Abo Akademi University Turku Finland Department of Physics and Center for Functional Materials Abo Akademi University Turku Finland Department of Physics and Material Sciences Center Philipps University Marburg Germany Dated October An exact analytical theory is developed for calculating the diu sion coe cie nt of charge carriers in strongly anisotropic disordered solids with one dimensional hopping transport mode for any de pen den ce of the hopping rates on space and energy So far such theory existed only for calculating the carrier mobility The dependence of the diu sion coe cie nt on the electric el evidences linear non analytic behavior at low lds for all considered models of disorder The mobility on the contrary demonstrates parabolic analytic el dependence for random barrier model being linear non analytic for random energy model For both models the Einstein relation between the diu sion coe cie nt and mobility is proven to be violated at any nite electric el The question on whether these non analytic el dependence of the transport coe ci ents and the concomitant viola tion of the Einsteins formula are due to the dimensionality of space or due to the considered models of disorder is resolved in the following paper Nena she et al ar Xiv where analytical calculations and computer simulations are carried out for two and three dimensional systems PAC numbers Ht Ee Ng Le

On Space Time Capacity Limits in Mobile and Delay Tolerant Networks Philippe Jacquet Bernard Mans and Georgios Rod ola is Abstract We investigate the fundamental capacity limits of space time journeys of information in mobile and Delay Tolerant Networks DT Ns where information is either transmitted or carried by mobile nodes using store carry forward routing We de ne the capacity of journey path in space and time from source to destination as the maximum amount of data that can be transferred from the source to the destination in the given journey Combining stochastic model conveying all possible journeys and an analysis of the durations of the nodes encounters we study the properties of journeys that maximize the space time information propagation capacity in bit meters per second More spec ic ally we provide theoretical lower and upper bounds on the information propagation speed as function of the journey capacity In the particular case of random way point like models when nodes move for distance of the order of the network domain size before changing direction we show that for relatively large journey capacities the information propagation speed is of the same order as the mobile node speed This implies that surprisingly in sparse but large scale mobile DT Ns the space time information propagation capacity in bit meters per second remains proportional to the mobile node speed and to the size of the transported data bundles when the bundles are relatively large We also verify that all our analytical bounds are accurate in several simulation scenarios

JOURNAL OF COMPUTING VOLUME ISSUE DECEMBER ISSN HTTPS SITES GOOGLE COM SITE JOURNAL OF COMPUTING Routing in Wireless Ad hoc Networks New Horizon Mano adav Vi nay Rishi wal and Arya Abstract lot of work has been done on routing protocols for mobile ad hoc networks but still standardization of them requires some more issues less addressed by the existing routing protocols In this paper new paradigm of maintaining multiple connections in ad hoc routing protocols has been highlighted which may be crucial for efficient routing in mobile ad hoc networks The problem of multiple con nec ions has been hardly worked on in ad hoc networks In this paper the solution of route maintenance if nodes are maintaining multiple con nec ions has been proposed This idea not only helps to solve the multiple connections problem but also take care of proper bandwidth dist rib tion to different connections as per different traffic types Study has been incorporated on existing AO DV with changes Simulation studies have been performed over packet delivery ratio throughput and message overheads Results show that the proposed solution for multiple connections is efficient and worth implementing in existing as well as new protocols Index Terms Wireless Ad hoc Networks Routing Multiple Connections cid

Dynamic Task Fetching Over Time Varying Wireless Channels for Mobile Computing Applications Aditya Du Dimitrios samis Nicholas Bam bos and tinder Pal Singh Abstract The processing computation and memory requirements posed by emerging mobile broadband services require adaptive memory management and pre fetching techniques at the mobile terminals for satisfactory application per form ance and sustained device battery lifetime In this work we investigate scenario where tasks with varied computational requirements are fetched by mobile device from central server over an error prone wireless link We examine the buffer dynamics at the mobile terminal and the central server under varying wireless channel connectivity and device memory congestion states as variable sizes tasks are executed on the terminal Our goal is to minimize the latency experienced by these tasks while judiciously utilizing the device buffering capability We use dynamic programming framework to model the optimal pre fetching policy We further propose pre fetching algorithm Fetch or Not FON which uses quasi static assumption on system state to make pre fetching decisions and pre fetching policy RF ON which uses randomized approximation to the optimal solution thus obviating the need for dynamic online optimization and substantially reducing the computational complexity Through performance evaluation under slow and fast fading scenarios we show that proposed algorithms come close to performance of the optimal scheme

Universal Scheduling for Networks with Arbitrary Tr afc Channels and Mobility Michael Neely Abstract We extend stochastic network optimization theory to treat networks with arbitrary sample paths for arrivals channels and mobility The network can experience unexpected link or node failures tr afc bursts and topology changes and there are no probabilistic assumptions describing these time varying events Performance of our scheduling algorithm is compared against an ideal slot look ahead policy that can make optimal decisions based on knowledge up to slots into the future We develop simple non anticipating algorithm that provides network throughput utility that is arbitrarily close to or Primary path Alternate paths better than that of the slot look ahead policy with tradeoff in the worst case queue backlog kept at any queue The same policy offers even stronger performance closely matching that of Fig primary path from to with alternative paths shown in the event of failure at no deB an ideal in nite look ahead policy when ergo dic assumptions are imposed Our analysis uses sample path version of Lyapunov drift and provides methodology for optimizing time averages take advantage of it and improve the short term throughput by in general time varying optimization problems routing many packets over the relay Index Terms Queueing analysis opportunistic scheduling These examples illustrate different types of unexpected internet routing ow control wireless networks optimization events that can be exploited to improve performance There are of course even more complex sequences of arrival channel and mobility events that if known in advance could be

Joint Impact of Path loss Shadowing and Fast Fading An Outage Formula for Wireless Networks Jean Marc Kel if Marceau Coupe chou Orange Labs Issy Les Moulin eaux France jean marc kel if orange ft group com TELECOM Paris Tech CNRS LT CI Paris France coup echo en st fr Abstract In this paper we analyse the joint impact of path loss shadowing and fast fading on wireless networks Taking into account the path loss and the shadowing we rst express the IN distribution of mobile located at given distance from its serving base station BS The moments of this distribution are easily computed using the Fenton Wilkinson method and id model that considers the cellular network as continuum of BS Then considering the joint impact of path loss shadowing and fast fading we derive an easily computable outage probability formula for mobile located at any distance from its serving BS We validate our approach by comparing all results to Monte Carlo simulations performed in traditional hexagonal network Indeed we establish that the results given by the formula are close to the ones given by Monte Carlo simulations The proposed framework is powerful tool to study performances of cellular networks OF DMA systems Wi MAX LTE

The complex network of global cargo ship movements Pablo Kalu za Andrea Kol sch Michael Gast ner and Bernd Blas ius Institute for Chemistry and Biology of the Marine Environment Carl von Ossietzky Universitat Carl von Ossietzky Str Oldenburg Germany Abstract Transportation networks play crucial role in human mobility the exchange of goods and the spread of invasive species With of world trade carried by sea the global network of merchant ships provides one of the most important modes of transportation Here we use information about the itineraries of cargo ships during the year to construct network of links between ports We show that the network has several features which set it apart from other transportation networks In particular most ships can be class ed in three categories bulk dry carriers container ships and oil tankers These three categories do not only die in the ships physical characteristics but also in their mobility patterns and networks Container ships follow regularly repeating paths whereas bulk dry carriers and oil tankers move less predictably between ports The network of all ship movements possesses heavy tailed distribution for the connectivity of ports and for the loads transported on the links with systematic dieren ces between ship types The data analyzed in this paper improve current assumptions based on gravity models of ship movements an important step towards understanding patterns of global trade and bio invasion Keywords complex network cargo ships bio invasion transportation Electronic address blas ius icbm de

REPUTATION BASED TELECOMMUNICATION NETWORK SELECTION Jean Marc Seigneur re put action com University of Geneva route de rize Ca rouge CH Switzerland Xavier it re put action com University of Geneva route de rize Ca rouge CH Switzerland ABSTRACT Nowadays mobile users can switch between different available networks for example nearby Wi Fi networks or their standard mobile operator network Soon it will be extended to other operators However unless telecommunication operators can directly benefit from allowing user to switch to another operator operators have an incentive to keep their network quality of service confidential to avoid that their users decide to switch to another network In contrast in user centric way the users should be allowed to share their observations regarding the networks that they have used In this paper we present our work in progress towards attack resistant sharing of quality of service information and network provider reputation among mobile users KEYWORDS Reputation trust quality of service telecommunication network provider

Securing Interactive Sessions Using Mobile Device through Visual Channel and Visual Inspection Cheng fang Fang Ee Chien Chang School of Computing National University of Singapore fang change comp nus edu sg Abstract Communication channel established from display to devices camera is known as visual channel and it is helpful in securing key exchange protocol In this paper we study how visual channel can be exploited by network terminal and mobile device to jointly verify information in an interactive session and how such information can be jointly presented in user friendly manner taking into account that the mobile device can only capture and display small region and the user may only want to authenticate selective regions of interests Motivated by applications in Kiosk computing and multi factor authentication we consider three security mod els the mobile device is trusted at most one of the terminal or the mobile device is dishonest and both the terminal and device are dishonest but they do not collude or communicate We give two protocols and investigate them under the above mentioned models We point out form of replay attack that renders some other straightforward implementations cumbersome to use To enhance user friendliness we propose solution using visual cues embedded into the barcodes and incorporate the framework of augmented reality for easy ver cations through visual in spec tion We give proof of concept implementation to show that our scheme is feasible in practice Keywords Visual channel protocol Sub region authentication User friendly ver cation

Information Flow in One Dimensional Vehicular Ad Hoc Networks Chi Wan Sung Kenneth hum Wing Ho Yuen Department of Electronic Engineering City University of Hong Kong Department of Computer Science Columbia University New York albert sung city edu hk ks hum gmail com andy yuen cs columbia edu Abstract We consider content distribution in vehicular ad hoc networks We assume that le is encoded using fountain code and the encoded message is cached at info stations Vehicles are allowed to download data packets from info stations which are placed along highway In addition two vehicles can exchange packets with each other when they are in proximity As long as vehicle has received enough packets from info stations or from other vehicles the original le can be recovered In this work we show that system throughput increases linearly with number of users meaning that the system exhibits linear cal ability Further more we analyze the eec of mobility on system throughput by considering both discrete and continuous velocity distributions for the vehicles In both cases system throughput is shown to decrease when the average speed of all vehicles increases In other words higher overall mobility reduces system throughput

cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid HI AR LO AT SE RV PR DI CT MO AD HO NE WO cid cid cid cid Eb tis am Amar Selma Bou mer dass and ric Renault University of Pierre and Marie Curie Paris France eb tis am amar et up mc fr NAM CEDRIC Paris France selma bou mer dass nam fr Institut Tl com Tl com Sud Paris vry France Samovar MR IN CNRS vry France eric renault it sud paris eu ABSTRACT Position based routing protocols take advantage of location information to perform stateless and efficient routing To enable position based routing node must be able to discover the location of the messages destination node This task is typically accomplished by location service Recently several location service protocols have been developed for ad hoc networks In this paper we propose novel location service called HLS Predictive Hierarchical Location Service In HLS the entire network is partitioned into hierarchy of smaller and smaller regions For each node one node in each level region of the hierarchy is chosen as its local location server When the network initializes or when node attaches the network nodes contact their local location server with their current location information ie position and velocity Then they only need to update their location server when they move away from their current region Finally nodes query their location servers and get the exact or predicted location of destination nodes

of mobile communication has dropped significantly leading to dramatic increase in mobile phone usage The widespread usage has led mobiles to emerge as strong alternative for other applications one of Put ra Sum ari School of Computer Science Universiti Sains Malaysia Penang Malaysia Sale halo mari yahoo com put ras cs us my ABSTRACT Mobile Ad Hoc Network MANET is collection of two or more devices or nodes or terminals with wireless communications and networking capability that communicate with each other without the aid of any centralized administrator also the wireless nodes that can dynamically form network to exchange information without using any existing fixed network infrastructure And its an autonomous system in which mobile hosts connected by wireless links are free to be dynamically and some time act as routers at the same time and we discuss in this paper the distinct characteristics of traditional wired networks including network configuration may change at any time there is no direction or limit the movement and so on and thus needed new optional path Agreement Routing Protocol to identify nodes for these actions communicate with each other path An ideal choice way the agreement should not only be able to find the right path and the Ad Hoc Network must be able to adapt to changing network of this type at any time and we talk in details in this paper all the information of Mobile Ad Hoc Network which include the History of ad hoc wireless ad hoc wireless mobile approaches and types of mobile ad Hoc networks and then we present more than types of the routing Ad Hoc Networks protocols have been proposed In this paper the more representative of routing protocols analysis of individual characteristics and advantages and disadvantages to collate and compare and present the all applications or the Possible Service of Ad Hoc Networks KEYWORDS Wireless Ad Hoc Networks Mobility Ad Hoc Network Routing Protocols Wireless Mobile Approaches MANET mobile ad hoc sensor network Qo Ah Hoc Applications

JOURNAL OF COMPUTING VOLUME ISSUE MARCH ISSN HTTPS SITES GOOGLE COM SITE JOURNAL OF COMPUTING Fuzzy based Navigation and Control of Non Hol ono mic Mobile Robot Raz if Rashid Elam vaz thi Mum taj Be gam Arr of iq Abstract In recent years the use of non analytical methods of computing such as fuzzy logic evolutionary computation and neural networks has demonstrated the utility and potential of these paradigms for intelligent control of mobile robot navigation In this paper theoretical model of fuzzy based controller for an autonomous mobile robot is developed The paper begins with the mathematical model of the robot that involves the kinematic model Then the fuzzy logic controller is developed and discussed in detail The proposed method is successfully tested in simulations and it compares the effectiveness of three different set of membership of functions It is shown that fuzzy logic controller with input membership of three provides better performance compared with five and seven membership functions Index Terms Non hol ono mic mobile robot kinematics model fuzzy logic controller

International Journal of Next Generation Network IJ NG Vol No March PROVED AC KET OR WARDING PP ROACH IN RD GR EH ICU LAR HOC ET WORKS USING LG OR IT HM Pr as an th Dr Dura swamy Jaya sud ha and Dr Chandra sekar Research Scholar Department of Information Technology Rang as amy College of Technology Tamilnadu India pr as an th kali annan gmail com Dean Academic Department of Computer Science Rang as amy College of Technology Tamilnadu India dr dura swamy yahoo com Research Scholar Department of MCA College of Engineering Tamilnadu India jaya su dhaka li annan yahoo com Reader Peri yar University Tamilnadu India cc sekar gmail com ABSTRACT VAN ETs Vehicular Ad hoc Networks are highly mobile wireless ad hoc networks and will play an important role in public safety communications and commercial applications Routing of data in VAN ETs is challenging task due to rapidly changing topology and high speed mobility of vehicles Position based routing protocols are becoming popular due to advancement and availability of GPS devices One of the critical issues of VAN ETs are frequent path disruptions caused by high speed mobility of vehicle that leads to broken links which results in low throughput and high overhead This paper argues the use of information on vehicles movement information position direction speed of vehicles to predict possible link breakage event prior to its occurrence So in this paper we propose Reliable Directional Greedy routing RD GR reliable position based routing approach which obtains position speed and direction of its neighboring nodes from GPS This approach incorporates potential score based strategy which calculates link stability between neighbor nodes in distributed fashion for reliable forwarding of data packet KEYWORDS Vehicular Ad Hoc Networks Position based routing dynamic topology Reliable Directional Greedy Routing Revival Mobility Model

cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid cid AYYA PP AN and KUMAR Rajiv Gandhi College of Engineering and Technology India aaa rg cet yahoo co in SRM University Chennai India kumar gmail com ABSTRACT The wide band code division multiple access CDMA based and beyond cellular mobile wireless networks are expected to provide diverse range of multimedia services to mobile users with guaranteed quality of service Qo To serve diverse quality of service requirements of these networks it necessitates new radio resource management strategies for effective utilization of network resources with coding schemes Call admission control CAC is significant component in wireless networks to guarantee quality of service requirements and also to enhance the network resilience In this paper capacity enhancement for CDMA network with convolutional coding scheme is discussed and compared with block code and without coding scheme to achieve better balance between resource utilization and quality of service provisioning The model of this network is valid for the real time RT and non real time NRT services having different data rate Simulation results demonstrate the effectiveness of the network using convolutional code in terms of capacity enhancement and Qo of the voice and video services KEYWORDS Call admission control Wide band code division multiple access Wireless networks Quality of service

JOURNAL OF TELECOMMUNICATIONS VOLUME ISSUE MARCH Flexible Authentication Technique for Ubiquitous Wireless Communication using Passport and Visa Tokens Abdullah lmu hai deb Mohammed lha be eb Ph Le and Bala Srinivasa Abstract The development of mobile devices CPU memory and storage and the introduction of mobile networks Ad Hoc Wi Fi Wi MAX and have opened new opportunities for next generation of mobile services It becomes more convenience and desirable for mobile internet users to be connected everywhere However ubiquitous mobile access connectivity faces inter operation issues between wireless network providers and wireless network technologies Although mobile users would like to get as many services as possible while they travel there is lack of technology to identify visited users in current foreign network authentication systems This challenge lies in the fact that foreign network provider does not initially have the authentication credentials of mobile user Existing approaches use roaming agreement to exchange authentication information between home network and foreign network This paper proposes roaming agreement less approach designed based on our ubiquitous mobile access model Our approach consist of two tokens Passport identification token and Visa authorisation token to provide the mobile user with flexible authentication method to access foreign network services The security analysis indicates that our proposal is more suitable for ubiquitous mobile communication especially in roaming agreement less environment Index Terms Authentication Wireless communication Protocol architecture Mobile environments cid

International Journal of Next Generation Network IJ NG Vol No March HE PACT OF ELL IT HOMING ON THE MTS ER FORM ANCE OF ORE ET WORKS Ye Ou yang and Hose in allah Ph Howe School of Technology Management Stevens Institute of Technology Hoboken NJ USA you yang stevens edu hf allah stevens edu ABSTRACT Mobile operators currently prefer optimizing their radio networks via re homing or cutting over the cell sites in or networks The core network as the parental part of radio network is inevitably impacted by the re homing in radio domain This paper introduces the cell site re homing in radio network and analyzes its impact on the performance of GSM MTS core network The possible re homing models are created and analyzed for core networks The paper concludes that appropriate re homing in radio domain using correct algorithms not only optimizes the radio network but also helps improve the Qo of the core network and saves the carriers OP EX and CAPE on their core networks KEYWORDS MTS CDMA GSM Core Network Re homing Network Optimization Network Dimension Network Plan

Interference in Lattice Networks Martin Hae ngg Abstract Lattices are important as models for the node locations in wireless networks for two main reasons When network designers have control over the placement of the nodes they often prefer regular arrangement in lattice for coverage and interference reasons If nodes are randomly distributed or mobile good channel access schemes ensure that concurrent transmitters are regularly spaced hence the locations of the transmitting nodes are well approximated by lattice In this paper we introduce general interference bounding techniques that permit the derivation of tight closed form upper and lower bounds for all lattice networks and we present and analyze optimum or near optimum channel access schemes for one dimensional square and triangular lattices Index Terms Wireless networks interference time division multiple access geometry
