EMERGENCY RESPONSE COMMUNICATIONS AND ASSOCIATED SECURITY CHALLENGES Muhammad Ibrahim hanna and Kaz Ahmed Information and Communication Technologies Asian Institute of Technology Thailand muhammad ibrahim hanna it ac th Telecommunications Asian Institute of Technology Thailand ahmed it ac th ABSTRACT The natural or man made disaster demands an efficient communication and coordination among first responder to save life and other community resources Normally the traditional communication infrastructures such as landline or cellular networks are damaged and dont provide adequate communication services to first responder for exchanging emergency related information Wireless ad hoc networks such as mobile ad hoc networks wireless sensor networks and wireless mesh networks are the promising alternatives in such type of situations The security requirements for emergency response communications include privacy data integrity authentication key management access control and availability Various ad hoc communication frameworks have been proposed for emergency response situations The majority of the proposed frameworks dont provide adequate security services for reliable and secure information exchange This paper presents survey of the proposed emergency response communication frameworks and the potential security services required by them to provide reliable and secure information exchange during emergency situations KEYWORDS Emergency response communication Mobile ad hoc networks Wireless sensor networks Wireless mesh networks Security Reliability

International Journal of Network Security Its Applications IJ NSA Vol No October Emma nou il Pan aou is George Drew Grant Millar Tipu Ram re kha and Christos Polit is Wireless Multimedia Networking WM Research Group Kingston University London United Kingdom ABSTRACT Contemporary personal computing devices are increasingly required to be portable and mobile enabling users wireless access to wired network infrastructures and services This approach to mobile computing and communication is only appropriate in situations where coherent infrastructure is available There are many situations where these requirements are not fulfilled such as developing nations rural areas natural disasters and military conflicts to name but few practical solution is to use mobile devices interconnected via wireless medium to form network known as Mobile Ad hoc Network MANET and provide the services normally found in wired networks Security in MANET is an issue of paramount importance due to the wireless nature of the communication links Additionally due to the lack of central administration security issues are different from conventional networks For the purposes of this article we have used the WM test bed to enable secure routing in MANET The use of cryptography is an efficient proven way of securing data in communications but some cryptographic algorithms are not as efficient as others and require more processing power which is detrimental to MANET In this article we have assessed different cryptographic approaches to securing the OL SR Optimised Link State Routing protocol to provide basis for research We conclude the paper with series of performance evaluation results regarding different cryptographic and hashing schemes Our findings clearly show that the most efficient combination of algorithms used for authentication and encryption are SHA Secure Hash Algorithm and AES Advanced Encryption Standard respectively Using this combination over their counterparts will lead to considerable reduction in processing time and delay on the network creating an efficient transaction moving towards satisfying resource constraints and security requirements KEYWORDS Mobile Ad hoc Network Routing Security

International Journal of Network Security Its Applications IJ NSA Vol No October Dynamic Multi Layer Signature Based Intrusion Detection System Using Mobile Agents Mu een Ud in Kam ran how aja and Aziz ah Abdul Rehman Department of Information System UTM Malaysia Mu een malik gmail com aziz har utm my Faculty of Computer Science Isra University Pakistan kam ran isra edu pk ABSTRACT Intrusion detection systems have become key component in ensuring the safety of systems and networks As networks grow in size and speed continues to increase it is crucial that efficient scalable techniques should be developed for IDS systems Signature based detection is the most extensively used threat detection technique for Intrusion Detection Systems IDS One of the foremost challenges for signature based IDS systems is how to keep up with large volume of incoming traffic when each packet needs to be compared with every signature in the database When an IDS cannot keep up with the traffic flood all it can do is to drop packets therefore may miss potential attacks This paper proposes new model called Dynamic Multi Layer Signature based IDS using Mobile Agents which can detect imminent threats with very high success rate by dynamically and automatically creating and using small and efficient multiple databases and at the same time provide mechanism to update these small signature databases at regular intervals using Mobile Agents KEYWORDS Intrusion Detection Systems Snort Mobile Agents Ag lets Snort Rules

International Journal of Network Security Its Applications IJ NSA Vol No October IS TRIBUTE RUST AN AGE MENT RAM WORK FOR TEC TING LICIOUS AC KET OP PING ODES IN BILE OC ET WORK Jay dip Sen Innovation Lab Tata Consultancy Services Ltd Bengal Intelligent Park Salt Lake Electronic Complex Kolkata India Jay dip Sen tc com ABSTRACT In multi hop mobile ad hoc network MANET mobile nodes communicate with each other forming cooperative radio network Security remains major challenge for these networks due to their features of open medium dynamically changing topologies reliance on cooperative algorithms absence of centralized monitoring points and lack of any clear lines of defense Most of the currently existing security algorithms designed for these networks are insecure in efficient and have low detection accuracy for nodes misbehaviour In this paper new approach has been proposed to bring out the complementary relationship between key distribution and misbehaviour detection for developing an integrated security solution for MANET The redundancy of routing information in ad hoc networks is utilized to develop highly reliable protocol that works even in presence of transient network partitioning and Byzantine failure of nodes The proposed mechanism is fully co operative and thus it is more robust as the vulnerabilities of the election algorithms used for choosing the subset of nodes for cooperation are absent Simulation results show the effectiveness of the proposed protocol KEYWORDS Mobile ad hoc network MANET Trust Reputation Controlled flooding Malicious packet dropping Node misbehaviour

International Journal of Wireless Mobile Networks JWM Vol No November self managing fault management mechanism for wireless sensor networks Muhammad sim and Hala Mok tar and Mad jid Merab ti School of Computing and Mathematical Sciences Liverpool John Moores University sim lj mu ac uk School of Computing and Mathematical Sciences Liverpool John Moores University Mok tar lj mu ac uk School of Computing and Mathematical Sciences Liverpool John Moores University Merab ti lj mu ac uk ABSTRACT sensor network can be described as collection of sensor nodes which co ordinate with each other to perform some specific function These sensor nodes are mainly in large numbers and are densely deployed either inside the phenomenon or very close to it They can be used for various application areas health military home Failures are inevitable in wireless sensor networks due to inhospitable environment and unattended deployment Therefore it is necessary that network failures are detected in advance and appropriate measures are taken to sustain network operation We previously proposed cellular approach for fault detection and recovery In this paper we extend the cellular approach and propose new fault management mechanism to deal with fault detection and recovery We propose hierarchical structure to properly distribute fault management tasks among sensor nodes by introducing more self managing functions The proposed failure detection and recovery algorithm has been compared with some existing related work and proven to be more energy efficient KEYWORDS Sensor Networks Fault Management Fault Detection Fault Recovery

International Journal of Wireless Mobile Networks JWM Vol No November MAC DAP TING MANET FOR ER FORM ANCE PTI MIZ ATION OF SING ROSS YER NTER ACTION Gaur av Bhat and Vive Kumar gb hati gmail com vive kdc kv haridwar org Research Scholar Supervisor Department of Computer Science Guru kul Kangri Vis hwa vidya lya Haridwar India ABSTRACT In this research we study the optimization challenges of MANET and cross layer technique to improve its performance We propose an adaptive retransmission limits algorithm for IEEE MAC to reduce the false link failures and predict the node mobility We implemented cross layer interaction between physical and MAC layers The MAC layer utilizes the physical layer information for differentiating false link failure from true link failure The MAC layer adaptively selects retransmission limit short and long based on the neighbour signal strength and sender node speed information from the physical layer The proposed approach tracks the signal strength of each node in network and while transmitting to neighbour node if its received signal strength is high and is received recently then Adaptive MAC persists in its retransmission attempts As there is high probability that neighbour node is still in transmission range and may be not responding due to some problems other then mobility In this paper we evaluate the performance of MANET and show that how our Adaptive MAC greatly improves it The simulation is done using Network Simulator NS KEYWORDS MANET IEEE MAC TCP SR Signal Strength Cross Layer Interaction

International Journal of Managing Information Technology IJ MIT Vol No November UL TI HOP AND WIDTH AN AGE MENT RO TO COL OR BILE OC ET WORKS Bin od Kumar Pattan yak Manoj Kumar Mishra lok Kumar Jag dev Manoj ran jan Nayak Sik sha Anus and han University Jag mohan Nagar Khanda giri Bhubaneswar Orissa India Postal Zip Tel Fax mail kp it er yahoo co in mail mk mishra it er yahoo com mail jag dev yahoo co in mail president so university ac in ABSTRACT An admission control scheme should play the role of coordinator for flows in data communication network to provide the guarantees as the medium is shared The nodes of wired network can monitor the medium to know the available bandwidth at any point of time But in wireless ad hoc networks node must consume the bandwidth of neighboring nodes during communication Hence the consumption of bandwidth by flow and the availability of resources to any wireless node strictly depend upon the neighboring nodes within its transmission range We present scalable and efficient admission control scheme Multi hop Bandwidth Management Protocol BMP to support the Qo requirements in multi hop ad hoc networks We simulate several options to design BMP and compare the performances of these options through mathematical analysis and simulation results and compare its effectiveness with the existing admission control schemes through extensive simulations KEYWORDS Ad hoc network admission control bandwidth Qo BMP

NEW GENERATION OF MOBILE PHONE VIRUSES AND CORRESPONDING COUNTERMEASURES Pu Wang Marta Gonz lez Ronaldo Menezes Albert szl arabs Center for Complex Network Research Department of Physics Biology and Computer Science Northeastern University Boston MA Department of Physics University of Notre Dame Notre Dame IN Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering Massachusetts Institute of Technology Cambridge MA Department of Computer Sciences Florida Institute of Technology Melbourne FL Department of Medicine Harvard Medical School and Center for Cancer Systems Biology Dana Far ber Cancer Institute Boston MA Email menezes cs fit edu Abstract The fast growing market for smart phones coupled with their almost continuous online presence makes these devices the new targets of virus writers It has been recently found that the topological spread of MM Multimedia Message Services viruses is highly restricted by the underlying fragmentation of the call graph In this paper we study MM viruses under another type of spreading behavior scanning We find that hybrid MM viruses including some level of scanning are more dangerous to the mobile community than their standard topological counterparts However the effectiveness of both scanning and topological behaviors in MM viruses can generally be limited by two controlling methods decreasing susceptible handsets market share OS it runs and ii improving monitoring capacity to limit the frequency in which MM messages can be sent by the mobile viruses

Uncovering space independent communities in spatial networks Paul Expert Tim Evans Vincent Blondel Renaud Lamb io tte Institute for Mathematical Sciences Imperial College London London SW PG Blackett Laboratory Prince Consort Road Imperial College London London SW AZ Theoretical Physics Imperial College London London SW AZ Massachusetts Institute of Technology Laboratory for Information and Decision Systems Massachusetts Avenue Cambridge MA USA si Na xy Fa cult es Universitaire Notre Dame de la Paix Namur Belgium th March Abstract Many complex systems are organized in the form of network embedded in space Important examples include the physical Internet infra tuc ture road net works ig ht connections brain functional networks and social networks The eec of space on network topology has recently come under the spotlight because of the emergence of pervasive technologies based on geo localization which constantly ll databases with peoples movements and thus reveal their trajectories and spatial behaviour Extracting patterns and regularities from the resulting massive amount of human mobility data requires the development of appropriate tools for uncover ing information in spatially embedded networks In contrast with most works that tend to apply standard network metrics to any type of network we argue in this paper for careful treatment of the constraints imposed by space on network to pol gy In particular we focus on the problem of community detection and propose modular it function adapted to spatial networks We show that it is possible to factor out the eec of space in order to reveal more clearly hidden structural simi lari ties between the nodes Methods are tested on large mobile phone network and computer generated benchmarks where the eec of space has been incorporated Published as PN AS ar Xiv Original title Beyond Space for Spatial networks

Selling Culture Implementation of Commerce and WAP based Prototypes Konstantin Za fei ri and Damiano Ga val as katerini Ball Abstract Museum stores represent integral parts of the museums that have also lot to benefit from successful presence on the web arena In addition to traditional web sites carefully designed electronic commerce commerce sites may increase the potential of museum stores offering possibilities for on line shopping and other commercial functions In parallel the recent convergence of the traditionally separate technologies of the Internet and mobile telephony has brought the concept of wireless Internet into the spotlight Within this context mobile commerce commerce is relatively new trend that represents natural extension of commerce into the wireless world commerce refers to electronic business transactions and differentiates from commerce since it involves the use of mobile devices and wireless medium rather than wired The unique characteristics of mobile computing bring forward new challenges and opportunities for museum stores This article presents the design and implementation of an commerce and an commerce museum shop application The aim is to evaluate and compare the two applications in terms of several parameters such as available technologies strengths and limitations design requirements usability interaction speed usage cost etc and also to identify ways for enhancing the potential of such applications and designing successful and profitable business models Keywords Museum shop commerce commerce wireless Internet WAP

Circadian pattern and burst in ess in mobile phone communication Hang Hyun Jo Marton Kars Jan os Kert es and Kim mo Ka ski BE CS Aalto University School of Science Box FI Institute of Physics and ME HAS Cond Mat Group ME Budapest Buda oki ut mail joh aalto fi Abstract The temporal communication patterns of human individuals are known to be in homogeneous or burst which is ree ted as the heavy tail behavior in the inter event time distribution As the cause of such burst behavior two main mechanisms have been suggested In homo gene ties due to the circadian and weekly activity patterns and in homo gene ties rooted in human task execution behavior Here we investigate the roles of these mechanisms by developing and then applying systematic de seasoning methods to remove the circadian and weekly patterns from the time series of mobile phone communication events of individuals We nd that the heavy tails in the inter event time distributions remain robustly with respect to this procedure which clearly indicates that the human task execution based mechanism is possible cause for the remaining burst in ess in temporal mobile phone communication patterns PAC numbers Tp Submitted to New Ph ys

Dengue epidemics and human mobility Bar mak Dor so Ot ero Solari Depart men to de sica Fa cult ad de Ciencia Exact as Natural es Universidad de Buenos Aires Pa bell on Ciudad Universit aria Nunez Buenos Aires Argentina Dated October Abstract In this work we explore the eec ts of human mobility on the dispersion of vector borne disease We combine an already presented stochastic model for dengue with simple representation of the daily motion of humans on schematic city of blocks with inhabitants in each block The pattern of motion of the individuals is described in terms of complex networks in which links connect die rent blocks and the link length distribution is in accordance with recent dings on human mobility It is shown that human mobility can turn out to be the main driving force of the disease dispersal PAC numbers Mn Ge Gg

International Journal of Wireless Mobile Networks JWM Vol No February ER FORM ANCE OM PARIS ON OF OUTING RO TO COLS IN BILE OC ET WORKS Manickam Guru askar Giri Dr Mani mega lai Department of Applied Sciences Seth Institute of Technology India gm gmail com Department of Computer Science The American College India Department of Information Technology National Engineering College India ABSTRACT Mobile Ad hoc Network MANET is collection of wireless mobile nodes that dynamically form network temporarily without any support of central administration Moreover Every node in MANET moves arbitrarily making the multi hop network topology to change randomly at unpredictable times There are several familiar routing protocols like DS DV AO DV SR etc which have been proposed for providing communication among all the nodes in the network This paper presents performance comparison of proactive and reactive protocols DS DV AO DV and SR based on metrics such as throughput packet delivery ratio and average end to end delay by using the NS simulator KEYWORDS MANET DS DV AO DV SR Throughput Packet Delivery Ratio Average End to End delay

Priority based Interface Selection for Overlaying Heterogeneous Networks Most afa Zaman Chowdhury and Yeong Min Jang Department of Electronics Engineering Koo km in University Seoul Korea mail mz eee jang koo km in ac kr Abstract Offering of different attractive opportunities by different wireless technologies trends the convergence of heterogeneous networks for the future wireless communication system To make seamless handover among the heterogeneous networks the optimization of the power consumption and optimal selection of interface are the challenging issues for convergence networks The access of multi interfaces simultaneously reduces the handover latency and data loss in heterogeneous handover The mobile node MN maintains one interface connection while other interface is used for handover process However it causes much battery power consumption In this paper we propose an efficient interface selection scheme including interface selection algorithms interface selection procedures considering battery power consumption and user mobility with other existing parameters for overlaying networks We also propose priority based network selection scheme according to the service types MN battery power level provision of Qo Qo in the target network and our proposed priority parameters are considered as more important parameters for our interface selection algorithm The performances of the proposed scheme are verified using numerical analysis Keywords Heterogeneous networks battery power interface selection CAC overlaying networks

International Journal of Computer Networks Communications JC NC Vol No March YNA MIC UL TIME DIA SER EIGHT IEEE LASSI FI CATION CHE ME FOR WLAN Ahmed Ri adh Reba and Sad Hanafi Department of Electrical Computer Engineering Texas University at Qatar Doha Qatar ri adh reba qatar amu edu LA MIH Laboratory University of Valenciennes Hainaut Camb rs is Lille France said hanafi un iv valenciennes fr ABSTRACT In this paper we expose dynamic traffic classification scheme to support multimedia applications such as voice and broadband video transmissions over IEEE Wireless Local Area Networks WLANs Obviously over Wi Fi link and to better serve these applications which normally have strict bounded transmission delay or minimum link rate requirement service differentiation technique can be applied to the media traffic transmitted by the same mobile node using the well known Enhanced Distributed Channel Access EDC protocol However the given EDC mode does not offer user differentiation which can be viewed as deficiency in multi access wireless networks Accordingly we propose new inter node priority access scheme for IEEE networks which is compatible with the EDC scheme The proposed scheme joins dynamic user weight to each mobile station depending on its outgoing data and therefore deploys inter node priority for the channel access to complement the existing EDC inter frame priority This provides efficient quality of service control across multiple users within the same coverage area of an access point We provide performance evaluations to compare the proposed access model with the basic EDC MAC protocol mode to elucidate the quality improvement achieved for multimedia communication over WLANs KEYWORDS Multimedia traffics Quality of Service Enhancement New user weight classes Dynamic inter node priority EDC channel access mode IEEE WLANs

International Journal of Network Security Its Applications IJ NSA Vol No March EP LI CATION TACK IT IG AT IONS FOR TA TIC WS AND BILE Manju la and Dr Chell app an Department of Computer science and Engineering Anna University Chennai India man juv yahoo com dr cc anna un iv edu ABSTRACT Security is important for many sensor network applications Wireless Sensor Networks WS are often deployed in hostile environments as static or mobile where an adversary can physically capture some of the nodes once node is captured adversary collects all the credentials like keys and identity etc the attacker can re program it and replicate the node in order to eavesdrop the transmitted messages or compromise the functionality of the network Identity theft leads to two types attack clone and sybil In particularly harmful attack against sensor networks where one or more node illegitimately claims an identity as replicas is known as the node replication attack The replication attack can be exceedingly injurious to many important functions of the sensor network such as routing resource allocation misbehavior detection etc This paper analyzes the threat posed by the replication attack and several novel techniques to detect and defend against the replication attack and analyzes their effectiveness in both static and mobile WS KEYWORDS Security Clone Sybil node replication attack static and mobile WS

An Improved Ec ent Key Distribution Mechanism for Large Scale Heterogeneous Mobile Sensor Networks Ashok Kumar Das International Institute of Information Technology Bhubaneswar Bhubaneswar India mail it kg ak das yahoo co in Due to resource constraints of the sensor nodes traditional public key cryptographic techniques are not feasible in most sensor network architectures Several symmetric key distribution mechanisms are proposed for establishing pairwise keys between sensor nodes in sensor networks but most of them are not scalable and also are not much suited for mobile sensor networks because they incur much communication as well as computational overheads Moreover these schemes are either vulnerable to small number of compromised sensor nodes or involve expensive protocols for establishing keys In this paper we introduce new scheme for establishing keys between sensor nodes with the help of additional high end sensor nodes called the auxiliary nodes Our scheme provides unconditional security against sensor node captures and high network connectivity In addition our scheme requires minimal storage requirement for storing keys mainly due to only single key before deployment in each node in the sensor network supports cie ntl addition of new nodes after initial deployment and also works for any deployment topology Keywords Mobile sensor networks Heterogeneous sensor networks Key management Pairwise keys Security

Phase transitions in contagion processes mediated by recurrent mobility patterns Duy gu Bal can and Alessandro Ves pig nani March Center for Complex Networks and Systems Research CNet School of Informatics and Computing Indiana University Bloomington IN USA Pervasive Technology Institute Indiana University Bloomington IN USA Institute for Sci en tic Interchange IS Torino Italy Human mobility and activity patterns mediate contagion on many levels including the spatial spread of infectious diseases diffusion of rumors and emergence of consensus These patterns however are often dominated by spec ic locations and recurrent ow and poorly modeled by the random diff sive dynamics generally used to study them Here we develop theoretical framework to analyze contagion within network of locations where individuals recall their geographic origins We nd phase transition between regime in which the contagion affects large fraction of the system and one in which only small fraction is affected This transition cannot be uncovered by continuous de term in is tic models due to the stochastic features of the contagion process and de nes an invasion threshold that depends on mobility parameters providing guidance for controlling con tagi on spread by constraining mobility processes We recover the threshold behavior by analyzing diffusion processes mediated by real human commuting data To whom correspondence should be addressed email alex indiana edu

Dynamical Synapses Enhance Neural Information Processing Gracefulness Accuracy and Mobility Alan Fung Michael Wong He Wang and Si Wu Department of Physics Hong Kong University of Science and Technology Hong Kong China Department of Physics Tsinghua University Beijing China Institute of Neuroscience Chinese Academy of Sciences China State Key Laboratory of Cognitive Neuroscience Learning Beijing Normal University China Abstract Experimental data have revealed that neuron al connection ecac exhibits two forms of short term plasticity namely short term depression STD and short term facilitation ST They have time constants residing between fast neural signaling and rapid learn ing and may serve as substrates for neural systems manipulating temporal information on relevant time scales The present study investigates the impact of STD and ST on the dy nam ics of continuous attractor neural networks CAN Ns and their potential roles in neural information processing We nd that STD endows the network with slow decaying plateau behaviors the network that is initially being stimulated to an active state decays to silent state very slowly on the time scale of STD rather than on the time scale of neural signaling This provides mechanism for neural systems to hold sensory memory easily and shut persistent activities gracefully With ST wend that the network can hold memory trace of external inputs in the facilitated neuron al interactions which provides way to stabilize the network response to noisy inputs leading to improved accuracy in population decoding Furthermore we nd that STD increases the mobility of the network states The increased mobility enhances the tracking performance of the network in response to time varying tim uli leading to antic ip at ive neural responses In general we nd that STD and STP tend to have opposite eec ts on network dynamics and complementary computational advantages suggesting that the brain may employ strategy of weighting them dieren ti ally depending on the computational purpose

Modular it maximization and tree clustering Novel ways to determine effective geographic borders Grady rune Thiem ann The is and Brockman Abstract Territorial subdivisions and geographic borders are essential for under standing phenomena in sociology political science history and economics They in en ce the inter region low of information and cross border trade and affect the diffusion of innovation and technology However most existing administrative bor der were determined by variety of historic and political circumstances along with some degree of arbitrariness Societies have changed drastically and it is doubt ful that currently existing borders re ect the most logical divisions Fortunately at this point in history we are in position to actually measure some aspects of the geographic structure of society through human mobility Large scale transportation systems such as trains and airlines provide data about the number of people traveling between geographic locations and many promising human mobility proxies are be ing discovered such as cellphones banknotes and various online social networks In this chapter we apply two optimization techniques to human mobility proxy bank note circulation to investigate the effective geographic borders that emerge from direct analysis of human mobility Grady Northwestern University Evanston IL rune Max Planck Institute for Dynamics and Self Organization ttingen Germany Thiem ann Max Planck Institute for Dynamics and Self Organization ttingen Germany The is Institute of Bioinformatics and Systems Biology Helmholtz Zentrum nchen German Research Center for Environmental Health Neu her berg Department of Mathematical Science Technische Universit tM nchen Garching Germany Brockman Northwestern University Evanston IL mail brockman northwestern edu

MiC Novel Micro Level Temporal Channel mpl oration for Mobile Hosts ne has ish Kumar Rai Raj ib Mall tees Pr adhan Department of Computer Science and Engineering Silicon Institute of Technology Bhubaneswar India cr satya gmail com Department of Computer Science and Engineering Indian Institute of Technology Kh arag pur India Department of Computer Science and Application Ut kal University Bhubaneswar India Abstract The exponential increase of multimedia services by the mobile users requires seamless connectivity with cost effective Quality of Service Qo provisioning For providing such on demand Qo the network needs to utilize the radio channels among the Mobile Hosts MH effectively We use vector genetic algorithm VGA for temporal mpl oration of shar able channel from the neighbouring cell to fulfill the needs of cell We propose new micro level temporal channel mpl oration mechanism MiC which promptly allocates available borrowing channel of the neighbouring cell to the needy cell The novelty of MiC is cal ability high availability and on demand allocation of the channels to the desired cells The performance of our model has been tested by simulation against standard FC scheme as well as Greedy Borrowing Heuristic In all the test cases MiC shows promising results in comparison to both the schemes Index Terms Channel allocation micro level Qo MH VGA

Exploring Human Mobility Patterns Based on Location Information of US Flights Bin Jiang and Tao Jia Department of Technology and Built Environment Division of Geo ma tics University of le SE le Sweden Email bin jiang hig se jia tao com Draft April Revision August Abstract range of early studies have been conducted to illustrate human mobility patterns using different tracking data such as dollar notes cell phones and taxicabs Here we explore human mobility patterns based on massive tracking data of US flights Both topological and geometric properties are examined in detail We found that topological properties such as traffic volume between airports and degree of connectivity of individual airports including both in and out degrees follow power law distribution but not geometric property like travel lengths The travel lengths exhibit an exponential distribution rather than power law with an exponential cutoff as previous studies illustrated We further simulated human mobility on the established topologies of airports with various moving behaviors and found that the mobility patterns are mainly attributed to the underlying binary topology of airports and have little to do with other factors such as moving behaviors and geometric distances Apart from the above findings this study adopts the head tail division rule which is regularity behind any heavy tailed distribution for extracting individual airports The adoption of this rule for data processing constitutes another major contribution of this paper Keywords scaling of geographic space head tail division rule power law geographic information agent based simulations

Secured Message Transmission in Mobile AD HOC Networks through Identification and Removal of Byzantine Failures nith Dr Akil andes war Assistant Professor Dept of Electronics and Communication Day an and Sagar College of Engineering Bangalore India nith vijaya gmail com Professor Dept of Computer Science and Engineering Son College of Technology Salem India akil rang abash yam yahoo com Abstract The emerging need for mobile ad hoc networks and secured data transmission phase is of crucial importance depending upon the environments like military In this paper new way to improve the reliability of message transmission is presented In the open collaborative MANET environment any node can maliciously or selfishly disrupt and deny communication of other nodes Dynamic changing topology makes it hard to determine the adversary nodes that affect the communication in MANET An SMT protocol provides way to secure message transmission by dispersing the message among several paths with minimal redundancy The multiple routes selected are known as APS Active Path Set This paper describes technique for fault discovery process to identify Byzantine failures which include nodes that drop modify or mis route packets in an attempt to disrupt the routing service An adaptive probing technique detects malicious link through binary search and according to the nodes behavior these links are avoided in the active path by multiplicative ly increasing their weights The proposed scheme provides secure communication even with increased number of adversaries Index Terms Byzantine Failure Secure Routing SMT Secure Message Transmission Binary Search Probing Reliability Active Path Set APS compromised intermediate node or set of compromised

Diseases spreading through individual based models with realistic mobility patterns Med us and Dor so Depart men to de sica Fa cult ad de Ciencia Exact as Natural es Universidad de Buenos Aires Pa bell on Ciudad Universit aria Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires Argentina and FIBA CONIC ET Abstract The individual based models constitute set of widely implemented tools to analyze the incidence of individuals he te rogen ei ties in the spread of an infectious disease In this work we focus our attention on human contacts he te rogen ei ties through two of the main individual based models mobile agents and complex networks models We introduce novel mobile agents model in which individuals make displacements with sizes according to truncated power law distribution based on empirical evidence about human mobility Besides we present procedure to obtain an equivalent weighted contact network from the previous mobile agents model where the weights of the links are interpreted as contact probabilities From the topological analysis of the equivalent contact networks we show that small world characteristics are related with truncated power law distribution for agent displacements Finally we show the equivalence between both approaches through some numerical experiments for the spread of an infectious disease Electronic address ad med us df ub ar Electronic address cod or so df ub ar

Tight Bounds for Black Hole Search with Scattered Agents in Synchronous Rings Jeremie Chal op in Shan tan Das Arnaud Labour el and Euripides Marko IF CNRS Aix Marseille University rue Joliot Curie Marseille France Email jeremie chal op in shan tan das arnaud labour el if un iv mrs fr Department of Computer Science and Biomedical Informatics University of Central Greece Lamia Greece Email marko uc gr Abstract We study the problem of locating particularly dangerous node the so called black hole in synchronous anonymous ring network with mobile agents black hole is harmful stationary process residing in node of the network and destroying destroys all mobile agents visiting that node without leaving any trace Unlike most previous research on the black hole search problem which employed co located team of agents we consider the more challenging scenario when the agents are identical and initially scattered within the network Moreover we solve the problem with agents that have constant sized memory and carry constant number of identical tokens which can be placed at nodes of the network In contrast the only known solutions for the case of scattered agents searching for black hole use stronger models where the agents have non constant memory can write messages in whiteboards located at nodes or are allowed to mark both the edges and nodes of the network with tokens This paper solves the problem for ring networks containing single black hole We are interested in the minimum resources number of agents and tokens necessary for locating all links incident to the black hole We present deterministic algorithms for ring topologies and provide matching lower and upper bounds for the number of agents and the number of tokens required for deterministic solutions to the black hole search problem in oriented or un oriented rings using movable or unmovable tokens Keywords Distributed Algorithms Fault Tolerance Black Hole Search Mobile Agents Anonymous Networks Identical tokens Finite State Automata

Distributed Cooperative Spectrum Sensing in Mobile Ad Hoc Networks with Cognitive Radios Richard Yu Helen Tang Min yi Huang Peter Mason and Zhi qiang Li In cognitive radio mobile ad hoc networks CR MANET secondary users can cooperatively sense the spectrum to detect the presence of primary users In this chapter we propose fully distributed and scalable cooperative spectrum sensing scheme based on recent advances in consensus algorithms In the proposed scheme the secondary users can maintain coordination based on only local information exchange without centralized common receiver We use the consensus of secondary users to make the nal decision The proposed scheme is essentially based on recent advances in consensus algorithms that have taken inspiration from complex natural phenomena including oc king of birds schooling of sh swarming of ants and hon ey bees Unlike the existing cooperative spectrum sensing schemes there is no need for centralized receiver in the proposed schemes which make them suitable in distributed CR MANET Simulation results show that the proposed consensus schemes can have sign cant lower missing detection probabilities and false alarm probabilities in CR MANET It is also demonstrated that the proposed scheme not only has proven sensitivity in detecting the primary users presence but also has robustness in choosing desirable decision threshold Richard Yu Department of Systems and Computer Engineering Carleton University Ottawa ON Canada mail richard yu carleton ca Helen Tang Defense Canada Ottawa ON Canada mail helen tang dr dc rd dc gc ca Min yi Huang School of Mathematics and Statistics Carleton University Ottawa ON Canada mail huang math carleton ca Peter Mason Defense Canada Ottawa ON Canada mail peter mason dr dc rd dc gc ca Zhi qiang Li Department of Systems and Computer Engineering Carleton University Ottawa ON Canada mail lia sce carleton ca

Mathematics National Institute of Technology Tiruchirapalli Tamil Nadu India jan aki it edu tn raman yahoo com as thi lak gmail com ABSTRACT In this paper new multi hop weighted clustering procedure is proposed for homogeneous Mobile Ad hoc networks The algorithm generates double star embedded non overlapping cluster structures where each cluster is managed by leader node and substitute for the leader node in case of failure of leader node The weight of node is linear combination of six different graph theoretic parameters which deal with the communication capability of node both in terms of quality and quantity the relative closeness relationship between network nodes and the maximum and average distance traversed by node for effective communication This paper deals with the design and analysis of the algorithm and some of the graph theoretic structural properties of the clusters obtained are also discussed KEYWORDS Homogeneous Mobile Ad hoc networks Double star Leader node Relative closeness relationship AD HOC NETWORKS BRIEF REVIEW An ad hoc wireless network is collection of two or more devices also termed as nodes equipped with wireless communications and networking capability Such devices nodes can communicate either directly or through intermediate nodes depending on the availability of the nodes within or outside the radio range An ad hoc network is self organizing and adaptive the already formed network can be de formed on the fly without the need for any central administration The nodes in an ad hoc network must be capable of identifying the connectivity with the neighbouring nodes so as to allow communication and sharing of information and services The nodes must perform routing and packet forwarding functions The topology changes continuously as the devices are not tied down to specific locations over time Hence the most important and challenging issues in mobile ad hoc network are the mobile nature of the devices cal ability and constraints on resources such as limited bandwidth limited and varying battery power etc Depending on the nature of devices the uniformity in transmission range and network architecture the network can either be homogeneous or heterogeneous The network considered in this paper is homogeneous where each node is assumed to have uniform transmission range SIGNIFICANCE OF CLUSTERING cluster is subset of nodes of network Clustering is the process of partitioning network into clusters and it is way of making ad hoc networks more scalable cal ability refers to the networks capability to facilitate efficient communication even in the presence of large number of network nodes Cluster based structures promote more efficient usage of resources in controlling large dynamic networks With cluster based control structures the physical network DOI jwm

Optimal Power Control for Concurrent Transmissions of Location aware Mobile Cognitive Radio Ad Hoc Networks Yi Song and Jiang Linda Xie Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering The University of North Carolina at Charlotte Email song xie unc edu Abstract In cognitive radio CR network CR users intend to operate over the same spectrum band licensed to legacy networks tradeoff exists between protecting the communications in legacy networks and max imi zing the throughput of CR transmissions especially when CR links are unstable due to the mobility of CR users Because of the non zero probability of false detection and implementation complexity of spectrum sensing in this paper we investigate sensing free spectrum sharing scenario for mobile CR ad hoc networks to improve the frequency reuse by incorporating the location awareness capability in CR networks We propose an optimal power control algorithm for the CR transmitter to maximize the con current transmission region of CR users especially in mobile scenarios Under the proposed power control algorithm the mobile CR network achieves maximized throughput without causing harmful interference to primary users in the legacy network Simulation results show that the proposed optimal power control algorithm outperforms the algorithm with hexed power policy in terms of increasing the packet delivery ratio in the network

International Journal of Wireless Mobile Networks JWM Vol No April QUIRE MENT ERT ICAL AND OFF ECH AN IS IRE LESS ET WORKS Man deep Kaur Gonda ra and Dr Sanjay adam Ph Student Computer Science Department University of Pune Pune cs uni pune ac in Research Guide Computer Science Department University of Pune Pune sk adam cd ac in ABSTRACT The importance of wireless communication is increasing day by day throughout the world due to cellular and broadband technologies Everyone around the world would like to be connected seamlessly anytime anywhere through the best network The wireless system must have the capability to provide high data transfer rates quality of services and seamless mobility In there are large variety of heterogeneous networks The users for variety of applications would like to utilize heterogeneous networks on the basis of their preferences such as real time high availability and high bandwidth When connections have to switch between heterogeneous networks for performance and high availability reasons seamless vertical hand off is necessary The requirements like capability of the network hand off latency network cost network conditions power consumption and users preferences must be taken into consideration during vertical hand off In this paper we have extracted the requirements of vertical hand off from the literature surveyed The evaluation of the existing work is also being done on the basis of required parameters for vertical hand off sophisticated adaptive and intelligent approach is required to implement the vertical hand off mechanism in wireless networks to produce an effective service for the user by considering dynamic and non dynamic parameters KEYWORDS wireless networks HO Requirements RSS Parameters Performance

International Journal of Wireless Mobile Networks JWM Vol No April IMPROVE PERFORMANCE OF TCP NEW RENO ABRA OVER BILE HOC ET WORK USING hanan jay is en and San jeev Sharma Tech School Of Information Technology RG PV BHOPAL INDIA is en it gmail com Reader Head School Of Information Technology RG PV BHOPAL INDIA san jeev rg tu net ABSTRACT In mobile ad hoc network temporary link failures and route changes occur frequently With the assumption that all packet losses are due to congestion TCP performs poorly in such an environment There are many versions of TCP which modified time to time as per need In this paper modifications introduced on TCP New Reno over mobile ad hoc networks using calculation of New Retransmission Time out TO to improve performance in term of congestion control To calculate New TO adaptive back off response approach ABRA in TCP New Reno was applied which suggest ABRA New Reno It utilizes an ABRA by which congestion window and slow start threshold values were decreased whenever an acknowledgement is received and new back off value calculate from smoothed round trip time Evaluation based on comparative study of ABRA New Reno with other TCP Variants like New Reno and Reno was done using realistic parameters like TCP Packet Received Packet Drop Packets Re transmitted Throughput and Packet Delivery Ratio calculated by varying attributes of Node Speed Number of Nodes and Pause Time Implementation and simulations were performed in Qu al Net simulator KEYWORDS Mobile ad hoc network TO TCP New Reno TCP Tahoe ABRA New Reno Congestion control TCP Timer

International Journal of Wireless Mobile Networks JWM Vol No April Wi MAX Based GHz Millimeter Wave Communication for Intelligent Transport System Applications Ber Rabindranath Sarkar Sub ir Kumar Sharma Bi kash Sur Sam are ndra Nath Bh askar De basis Ber So my as ree Sikkim Mani pal Institute of Technology Sikkim Mani pal University Maj it ar Ran gpo East Sikkim adav pur University Kolkata rb era samar sur de basis hb has kar so my as ree ber gmail com Abstract With the successful worldwide deployment of rd generation mobile communication security aspects are ensured partly Researchers are now looking for mobile for its deployment with high data rate enhanced security and reliability so that world should look for CALM Continuous Air interface for Long and Medium range communication This CALM will be reliable high data rate secured mobile communication to be deployed for car to car communication for safety application This paper reviewed the Wi MAX GHz RF carrier for The system is tested at SMIT laboratory with multimedia transmission and reception With proper deployment of this GHz system on vehicles the existing commercial products for will be required to be replaced or updated soon Key words CALM Wi MAX Wi Fi VS RTS

STiC MAC MAC Protocol for Robust Space Time Coding in Cooperative Wireless LANs Pei Liu Chun Nie Than as is Korak is Elz Er kip hive ndra Pan war Francesco Verde Anna Sc agli one Polytechnic Institute of New York University Brooklyn NY USA University of Naples Federico II Italy University of California Davis USA Abstract Relay assisted cooperative wireless communication has been shown to have sign cant performance gains over the legacy direct transmission scheme Compared with single relay based cooperation schemes utilizing multiple relays further improves the reliability and rate of transmissions Distributed space time coding DST as one of the schemes to utilize multiple relays requires tight coordination between relays and does not perform well in distributed environment with mobility In this paper cooperative medium access control MAC layer protocol called STiC MAC is designed to allow multiple relays to transmit at the same time in an IEEE network The transmission is based on novel DST scheme called randomized distributed space time coding DST which requires minimum coordination Unlike conventional cooperation schemes that pick nodes with good links STiC MAC picks transmission mode that could most improve the end to end data rate Any station that correctly receives from the source can act as relay and participate in forwarding The MAC protocol is implemented in fully decentralized manner and is able to opportunistic ally recruit relays on the thus making it robust to channel variations and user mobility Simulation results show that the network capacity and delay performance are greatly improved especially in mobile environment Index Terms Space Time Code MAC STiC MAC Randomized Distributed Space Time Coding DST cooperative communications medium access control protocol design IEEE This paper is revised version of paper with the same name submitted to IEEE Transaction on Wireless Communications STiC MAC protocol with RTS CT turned off is presented in the appendix of this draft July DRAFT

International Journal of Computer Networks Communications JC NC Vol No May SD DW CA SIGN ND NA LYSIS OF OBILI TY SED LUSTER ING OF MANET OMO GENE US Jan akira man and Sent hil Thi lak Department of Mathematics National Institute of Technology Tiruchirapalli Tamil Nadu India jan aki it edu tn raman yahoo com as thi lak gmail com ABSTRACT This paper deals with the design and analysis of the distributed weighted clustering algorithm SD DW CA proposed for homogeneous mobile ad hoc networks It is connectivity mobility and energy based clustering algorithm which is suitable for scalable ad hoc networks The algorithm uses new graph parameter called strong degree defined based on the quality of neighbours of node The parameters are so chosen to ensure high connectivity cluster stability and energy efficient communication among nodes of high dynamic nature This paper also includes the experimental results of the algorithm implemented using the network simulator NS The experimental results show that the algorithm is suitable for high speed networks and generate stable clusters with less maintenance overhead KEYWORDS Mobile ad hoc networks SD DW CA Connectivity Strong degree Cluster Stability

International Journal of Computer Networks Communications JC NC Vol No May ON TEXT WARE BILE IT TED AND OFF IEEE FOR ER FORM ANCE PROVE MENT IN ET WORKS Abhij it arma Shan tan Joshi and Su kumar and abhij it gu yahoo com joshi it ac in su kumar it ac in Department of Computer Science and Engineering Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati India ABSTRACT IEEE is widely used wireless LAN standard which offers good bandwidth at low cost In an ESS multiple APs can co exist with overlapping coverage area mobile node connects to the AP from which it receives the best signal Changes in traffic to and from different MN occur over time Load imbalance may develop on different APs Throughput and delay of the different flows passing through the APs where the load has increased beyond certain limit may degrade Different MN associated to the overloaded APs will experience performance degradation Overall performance of the ESS will also drop In this paper we propose scheme where MN experiencing degraded performance will initiate action and with assistance from the associate AP perform hand off to less loaded AP within its range to improve performance KEYWORDS Load Balancing Context Aware Hand off IEEE

JOURNAL OF COMPUTING VOLUME ISSUE JANUARY ISSN HTTPS SITES GOOGLE COM SITE JOURNAL OF COMPUTING WWW JOURNAL OF COMPUTING ORG Survey of Routing Attacks and Security Measures in Mobile Ad Hoc Networks Sud hi Agra wal San jeev Jain San jeev Sharma Abstract Mobile ad hoc networks MANET are set of mobile nodes which are self configuring and connected by wireless links automatically as per the defined routing protocol The absence of central management agency or fixed infrastructure is key feature of MANET These nodes communicate with each other by interchange of packets which for those nodes not in wireless range goes hop by hop Due to lack of defined central authority se curit zing the routing process becomes challenging task there by leaving MANET vulnerable to attacks which results in deterioration in the performance characteristics as well as raises serious question mark about the reliability of such networks In this paper we have attempted to present an overview of the routing protocols the known routing attacks and the proposed countermeasures to these attacks in various works

Opportunistic Information Dissemination in Mobile Ad hoc Networks adaptive ness vs obliviousness and random iz ation vs determinism Mart Far ach Colt on Antonio Fernandez Anta less Milan Miguel Most eir Shmuel Zak sk Abstract In this paper the problem of information dissemination in Mobile Ad hoc Networks MANET is studied The problem is to disseminate piece of information initially held by distinguished source node to all nodes in set de ned by some predicate We use model of MANET that is well suited for dynamic networks and opportunistic communication In this model nodes are placed in plane in which they can move with bounded speed and communication between nodes occurs over collision prone single channel In this setup informed and uninformed nodes can be disconnected for sometime bounded by parameter but eventually some uninformed node must become neighbor of an informed node and remain so for some time bounded by parameter In addition nodes can start at die rent times and they can crash and recover Under the above framework we show negative and positive results for die rent types of randomized proto cols and we put those results in perspective with respect to previous deterministic results Department of Computer Science Rutgers University is cat away NJ USA far ach cs rutgers edu Institute IM DE Networks Madrid Spain antonio fernandez im de org LA BRI Universit Bordeaux ENSE IRB Talence France milan la bri fr Department of Computer Science Rutgers University is cat away NJ USA most eir cs rutgers edu LADy Sy Universidad Rey Juan Carlos Most ole Madrid Spain Department of Computer Science Tech ni on Israel Institute of Technology Haifa Israel zak cs tech ni on ac il

Recurrent host mobility in spatial epidemics beyond reaction diffusion Vitaly Beli Max Planck Institute for Dynamics and Self Organization ttingen Germany and Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering Massachusetts Institute of Technology Cambridge MA USA The Geisel Max Planck Institute for Dynamics and Self Organization ttingen Germany and Department of Physics University of ttingen ttingen Germany Dirk Brockman Northwestern Institute on Complex Systems and Department of Engineering Sciences and Applied Mathematics Northwestern University Evanston IL USA Abstract Human mobility is key factor in spatial disease dynamics and related phenomena In computational models host mobility is typically modeled by diffusion in space or on meta pol ul ation networks Alternatively an effective force of infection across distance has been introduced to capture spatial dispersal implicitly Both approaches do not account for important aspects of natural human mobility diffusion does not capture the high degree of pre dic ability in natural human mobility patters the high percentage of return movements to individuals base location the effective force of infection approach assumes immediate equilibrium with respect to dispersal These conditions are typically not met in natural scenarios We investigate an epidemiological model that explicitly cap ture natural individual mobility patterns We systematically investigate generic dynamical features of the model on regular lattices as well as meta population networks and show that generally the model exhibits sign can td nam ical differences in comparison to ordinary diffusion and effective force of infection models For instance the natural human mobility model exhibits saturation of wavefront speeds and novel type of invasion threshold that is function of the return rate in mobility patterns In the light of these new dings and with the availability of precise and pervasive data on human mobility our approach provides framework for more sophisticated modeling of spatial disease dynamics

Consensus vs Broadcast in Communication Networks with Arbitrary Mobile Omission Faults Emmanuel God ard and Joseph Peters cid Pac ic Institute for Mathematical Sciences CNRS UMI School of Computing Science Simon Fraser University Abstract We compare the so lv ability of the Consensus and Broadcast problems in synchronous communication networks in which the delivery of messages is not reliable The failure model is the mobile omission faults model During each round some messages can be lost and the set of possible simultaneous losses is the same for each round We investigate these problems for the rst time for arbitrary sets of possible failures Previously these sets were de ned by bounding the numbers of failures In this setting we present new necessary condition for the so lv ability of Consensus that unies previous impossibility results in this area This condition is expressed using Broadcast ability properties As very important application we show that when the sets of omissions that can occur are de ned by bounding the numbers of failures counted in any way locally globally etc then the Consensus problem is actually equivalent to the Broadcast problem

On the Dynamics of Human Proximity for Data Diu sion in Ad Hoc Networks Andre Panis son Alain Barr atc Ciro Cat tu to Wouter Vanden Broeck Giancarlo Ru ob Rossa no Sch if an ella Complex Networks and Systems Group Institute for Sci en tic Interchange IS Foundation Via leS etti mio Sever Torino Italy Di parti men to di In format ica Universit di Torino Cor so Sv izz era Torino Italy Centre de Physique The rique CNRS MR Marseille France Abstract We report on data driven investigation aimed at understanding the dynamics of message spreading in real world dynamical network of human proximity We use data collected by means of proximity sensing network of wearable sensors that we deployed at three die rent social gatherings simultaneously involving several hundred individuals We simulate message spreading process over the recorded proximity network focusing on both the topological and the temporal properties We show that by using an appropriate technique to deal with the temporal he ero gene it of proximity events universal statistical pattern emerges for the de liv ry times of messages robust across all the data sets Our results are useful to set constraints for generic processes of data dissemination as well as to validate established models of human mobility and proximity that are frequently used to simulate realistic behaviors Keywords Mobile Networks Opportunistic Delay Tolerant Protocols Data Diu sion RFID

IMPROVING AO DV PERFORMANCE USING DYNAMIC DENSITY DRIVEN ROUTE REQUEST FORWARDING Venet is Ka nakar is David Nd zi Ky ria kos Oval ad is Department of Electronic and Computer Engineering University of Portsmouth Angle sea Road Portsmouth PO DJ United Kingdom www port ac uk Email venet is ka nakar is david nd zi ky ria kos oval ad is port ac uk ABSTRACT Ad hoc routing protocols use number of algorithms for route discovery Some use flooding in which route request packet RR EQ is broadcasted from source node to other nodes in the network This often leads to unnecessary retransmission causing congestion and packet collisions in the network phenomenon called broadcast storm This paper presents RR EQ message forwarding scheme for AO DV that reduces routing overheads This has been called AO DV EXT Its performance is compared to that of AO DV DS DV SR and OL SR protocols Simulation results show that AO DV EXT achieves energy efficiency improvement in data throughput and reduction in the number of dropped packets for network of nodes Greater efficiency is achieved in high density network and marginal improvement in networks with small number of nodes KEYWORDS Mobile Ad hoc Network Routing Message Overhead Route Discovery Broadcast flooding Power Aware Routing Routing Protocols AO DV EXT AO DV DS DV SR OL SR

Leveraging Bus Mobility to Enable Communications in Urban Areas Sabrina Gai to Dario Mag gi or in Gian Paolo Rossi Universit degli Studi di Milano Via Come li co Milano Italy Email rst name lastname uni mi it Abstract This paper shows that the deployment of an opp or wide infrastructure free and provider less wireless network tunis tic network on any public transportation system leads to platform with loose Qo guarantees We call this platform obtain scalable and efc ent urban communication platform Bus Switched Network BSN We use the term Bus Switched Networks BSN to indicate this urban backbone that complements the services of networks Within multi channel communication context mobile and enables to meet the application level requirements for device is supposed to select the proper wireless technology large class of applications by ensuring high delivery ratio and according to service availability cost and Qo constraints In acceptable delays under different conditions of packet load We Fig we show simple heterogeneous architecture where sustain these arguments by providing three contributions The BSN is integrated with wired Distribution Network DN that rst contribution is novel and lightweight probabilistic routing could complement the services of the network in urban protocol for BSN which we prove to be highly effective in satisfying the loose Qo required by urban wide delay tolerant area The endpoints of the communications over BSN include information services The second contribution is the proposal of URBe an analysis platform that given spec ic city served Source Destination by public transportation produces real bus mobility traces end to end and tr afc analysis for any given routing protocol The last communication contribution is an extensive benchmark analysis on three real cities which have been selected to explore geo and structural diversity last hop multi hop last hop connection connection connection

Optimal Selective Feedback Policies for Opportunistic Beam forming Thar aka Samara sing he Student Member IEEE Haze In ltek in Member IEEE and Jamie Evans Member IEEE Abstract This paper studies the structure of down link sum rate maximizing selective decentralized feedback policies for opportunistic beam forming under nite feedback constraints on the average number of mobile users feeding back Firstly it is shown that any sum rate maximizing selective decentralized feedback policy must be threshold feedback policy This result holds for all fading channel models with continuous distribution functions Secondly the resulting optimum threshold selection problem is analyzed in detail This is non convex optimization problem over nite dimensional Euclidean spaces By utilizing the theory of major iz ation an underlying chur concave structure in the sum rate function is den tied and the ufc ent conditions for the optimal it of homogenous threshold feedback policies are obtained Applications of these results are illustrated for well known fading channel models such as Rayleigh Na kagami and Ric ian fading channels along with various engineering and design insights Rather surprisingly it is shown that using the same threshold value at all mobile users is not always rate wise optimal feedback strategy even for network with identical mobile users experiencing statistically the same channel conditions For the Rayleigh fading channel model on the other hand homogenous threshold feedback policies are proven to be rate wise optimal if multiple ortho normal data carrying beams are used to communicate with multiple mobile users simultaneously Index Terms Opportunistic beam forming vector broadcast channels selective feedback sum rate major iz ation This research was supported by the Australian Research Council under Grant DP and Grant DP The material in this paper was presented in part at the International Symposium of Modeling and Optimization in Mobile Ad Hoc and Wireless Networks Princeton USA May and at the IEEE International Symposium on Information Theory St Petersburg Russia August The authors are with the Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering University of Melbourne Park ville VIC Australia mails ts uni mel edu au azeri uni mel edu au se uni mel edu au DRAFT

Flooding Time in Opportunistic Networks under Power Law and Exponential Inter Contact Times Luca Bec chet ti Andrea Clementi Francesco Pasquale Giovanni Resta Paolo Santi Riccardo Silvestri cid October Abstract Performance bounds for opportunistic networks have been derived in number of recent papers for several key quantities such as the expected delivery time of uni cast message or the oo ding time measure of how fast information spreads However to the best of our knowledge none of the existing results is derived under mobility model which is able to reproduce the power law exponential tail dichotomy of the pairwise node inter contact time distribution which has been observed in traces of several real opportunistic networks The contributions of this paper are two fold rst we present simple pairwise contact model called the Home MEG model for opportunistic networks based on the observation made in previous work that pairs of nodes in the network tend to meet in very few selected locations home locations this contact model is shown to be able to faithfully reproduce the power law exponential tail dichotomy of inter contact time Second we use the Home MEG model to analyze oo ding time in opportunistic networks presenting asymptotic bounds on oo ding time that assume die rent initial conditions for the existence of opportunistic links Finally our bounds provide some analytical evidences that the speed of information spreading in opportunistic networks can be much faster than that predicted by simple geo metric mobility models

Temporal motifs in time dependent networks Lauri Kova nen Marton Kars Kim mo Ka ski Jan os Kert es and Jari Sara maki Department of Biomedical Engineering and Computational Science Aalto University School of Science Box FI Finland ct Institute of Physics ME Budapest Buda oki ut Hungary mail lauri kova nen aalto fi Abstract Temporal networks are commonly used to represent systems where connections between elements are active only for restricted periods of time such as networks of telecommunication neural signal processing biochemical reactions and human social interactions We introduce the framework of temporal motifs to study the mesoscale topological temporal structure of temporal networks in which the events of nodes do not overlap in time Temporal motifs are classes of similar event sequences where the similarity refers not only to topology but also to the temporal order of the events We provide mapping from event sequences to colored directed graphs that enables nec ent algorithm for identifying temporal motifs We discuss some aspects of temporal motifs including causality and null models and present basic statistics of temporal motifs in large mobile call network PAC numbers Tp Hc

Co evolution of Content Popularity and Delivery in Mobile Networks Srinivasa Ven kat raman an and Anura Kumar Department of Electrical Communication Engineering Indian Institute of Science Bangalore India Email vs rini anura ece is er net in Abstract Mobile technology provides scalable approach to content delivery to large number of users on their mobile devices In this work we study the dissemination of single content an item of news song or video clip among population of mobile nodes Each node in the population is either destination interested in the content or potential relay not yet interested in the content There is an interest evolution process by which nodes not yet interested in the content relays can become interested become destinations on learning about the popularity of the content the number of already interested nodes In our work the interest in the content evolves under the linear threshold model The content is copied between nodes when they make random contact For this we employ controlled epidemic spread model We model the joint evolution of the copying process and the interest evolution process and derive the joint id limit ordinary differential equations We then study the selection of the parameters under the content providers control for the optimization of various objective functions that aim at maximizing content popularity and efc ent content delivery

On the Throughput Delay Trade in Geo routing Networks Philippe Jacquet Salman Malik Bernard Mans Alonso Silva Abstract We study the scaling properties of geo routing scheme in wireless multi hop network of mobile nodes Our aim is to increase the network capacity quasi linearly with while keeping the average delay bounded In our model mobile nodes move according to an random walk with velocity and transmit packets to randomly chosen destinations The average packet delivery delay of our scheme is of order and it achieves the network capacity of order This shows practical log log log throughput delay trade in particular when compared with the seminal result of Gupta and Kumar which shows network capacity of order log and negligible delay and the groundbreaking result of Gross glau ser and sep which achieves network capacity of order but with an average delay of order Wec on rm the generality of our analytical results using simulations under various interference models

International Journal of Computer Networks Communications JC NC Vol No July EY TABL ISH MENT CHE ME FOR BILE IRE LESS ENS OR ET WORKS USING OST PLOY MENT NOW LEDGE Ashok Kumar Das Center for Security Theory and Algorithmic Research International Institute of Information Technology Hyderabad India it kg ak das gmail com ashok das ii it ac in ABSTRACT Establishment of pairwise keys between sensor nodes in sensor network is difficult problem due to resource limitations of sensor nodes as well as vulnerability to physical captures of sensor nodes by the enemy Public key cryptosystems are not much suited for most resource constrained sensor networks Recently elliptic curve cryptographic techniques show that public key cryptosystem is also feasible for resource constrained sensor networks However most researchers accept that the symmetric key cryptosystems are viable options for resource constrained sensor networks In this paper we first develop basic principle to address the key pre distribution problem in mobile sensor networks Then using this developed basic principle we propose scheme which takes the advantage of the post deployment knowledge Our scheme is modified version of the key prior it iz ation technique proposed by Liu and Ning Our improved scheme provides reasonable network connectivity and security Moreover the proposed scheme works for any deployment topology KEYWORDS Security Key establishment Mobile sensor networks Key prior it iz ation Post deployment knowledge

International Journal of Computer Networks Communications JC NC Vol No July IP CURE AND BUST TO CONFIGURATION RO TO COL FOR BILE HOC ET WORKS UNDER TRON VERSA RIAL DEL Zo hra Slim ne Abdel ha fid Abdel malek Mohamed Fe ham and Abdel malik Tale Ahmed STIC Laboratory University of Tle mc en Algeria abdel malek mail un iv tle mc en dz LA MIH Laboratory University of Valenciennes and Hainaut Camb rs is France Abdel malik tale mail un iv valenciennes fr ABSTRACT Automatic IP address assignment in Mobile Ad hoc Networks MANET enables nodes to obtain rou table addresses without any infrastructure Different protocols have been developed throughout the last years to achieve this service However research primarily focused on correctness efficiency and cal ability much less attention has been given to the security issues The lack of security in the design of such protocols opens the possibility of many real threats leading to serious attacks in potentially hostile environments Recently few schemes have been proposed to solve this problem but none of them has brought satisfactory solutions Auto configuration security issues are still an open problem In this paper robust and secure state ful IP address allocation protocol for standalone MANET is specified and evaluated within NS Our solution is based on mutual authentication and fully distributed Auto configuration and CA model in conjunction with threshold cryptography By deploying new concept of joint IP address and public key certificate we show that instead of earlier approaches our solution solves the problem of all possible attacks associated with dynamic IP address assignment in MANET The resulting protocol incurs low latency and control overhead Keywords Mobile Ad hoc Networks Auto configuration IP address security Threshold Cryptography TC SAP NS

International Journal of Computer Networks Communications JC NC Vol No July ARI ABILITY OF CATION AN AGE MENT OST WITH FFE RENT OBILI TIES AND MER RIO DS TO DATE CATIONS Martin and Baj sy Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science University of California Berkeley California USA martin eec berkeley edu ABSTRACT In this article we examine the Location Management costs in mobile communication networks utilizing the timer based method From the study of the probabilities that mobile terminal changes number of Location Areas between two calls we identify threshold value of for the Call to Mobility Ratio MR below which the application of the timer based method is most appropriate We characterize the valley appearing in the evolution of the costs with the time out period showing that the time interval required to reach of the stabilized costs grows with the mobility index the paging cost per Location Area and the movement dimension in opposition to the behavior presented by the time interval that achieves the minimum of the costs The results obtained for MRs below the suggested threshold show that the valley appearing in the costs tends to disappear for MRs within in one dimensional movements and within in two dimensional ones and when the normalized paging cost per Location Area is below KEYWORDS Location Management Signaling Costs Timer Based Algorithm Wireless Networks

International Journal of Ub Comp JU Vol No July VING IN CATION AN AGE MENT OST EVER AGING SER TAT IS TICS Martin and Baj sy Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science University of California Berkeley California USA martin eec berkeley edu ABSTRACT The growth in the number of users in mobile communications networks and the rise in the traffic generated by each user are responsible for the increasing importance of Mobility Management Within Mobility Management the main objective of Location Management is to enable the roaming of the user in the coverage area In this paper we analyze the savings in Location Management costs obtained leveraging the users statistics in comparison with the classical strategy In particular we introduce two novel algorithms to obtain the parameters useful terms in the calculation of location update costs for different Location Management strategies utilizing geographical study of relative positions of the cells within the location areas Eventually we discuss the influence of the different network parameters on the total Location Management costs savings for both the radio interface and the fixed network part providing useful guidelines for the optimum design of the networks KEYWORDS Mobility Management Location Management User statistics Mobile Communications Networks
