MEASURES OF HUMAN MOBILITY USING MOBILE PHONE RECORDS ENHANCED WITH IS DATA NATHALIE WILLIAMS TIMOTHY THOMAS MATTHEW DUNBAR NATHAN EAGLE AND ADRIAN DO BRA Abstract In the past decade large scale mobile phone data have become available for the study of human movement patterns These data hold an immense promise for understanding human behavior on vast scale and with precision and accuracy never before possible with censuses surveys or other existing data collection techniques There is already sign cant body of literature that has made key inroads into understanding human mobility using this exciting new data source and there have been several die rent measures of mobility used However existing mobile phone based mobility measures are inconsistent inaccurate and con founded with social characteristics of local context New measures would best be developed immediately as they will in en ce future studies of mobility using mobile phone data In this article we do exactly this We discuss problems with existing mobile phone based measures of mobility and describe new methods for measuring mobility that address these concerns Our measures of mobility which incorporate both mobile phone records and detailed IS data are designed to address the spatial nature of human mobility to remain independent of social characteristics of context and to be comparable across geographic regions and time We also contribute discussion of the variety of uses for these new measures in developing better understanding of how human mobility in en ces micro level human behaviors and well being and macro level social organization and change KEYWORDS Big data call detail record human mobility migration Contents

Percolation and cooperation with mobile agents geometric and strategy clusters Mendel Vain stein Carolina Brito and Jef ers on Are nz on Instituto de sica Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul CP Porto Alegre RS Brazil Dated August We study the conditions for persistent cooperation in no lattice model of mobile agents playing the Prisoners Dilemma game with pure unconditional strategies Each agent has an exclusion radius rP that accounts for the population viscosity and an interaction radius in that de nes the instantaneous contact network for the game dynamics We show that die rent ly from the rP case the model with nite sized agents presents coexistence phase with both co operators and defectors besides the two absorbing phases in which either co operators or defectors dominate We provide in addition geometric interpretation of the transitions between phases In analogy with lattice models the geometric percolation of the contact network irrespective of the strategy enhances cooperation More importantly we show that the percolation of defectors is an essential condition for their survival Die rent ly from compact clusters of co operators isolated groups of defectors will eventually become extinct if not percolating independently of their size

No name manuscript No will be inserted by the editor Software De ned and Virtual zed Future Mobile and Wireless Networks Survey Mao Yang Yong Li De peng in Lie guang Zeng in Wu than as ios Vasil kos Received date Accepted date Abstract With the proliferation of mobile demands MW and sign cant ly be net the future mobile and and increasingly multifarious services and applications wireless network mobile Internet has been an irreversible trend Un for tu Keywords Software de ned network Network nat ely the current mobile and wireless network MW virtualization Network Architecture Future mobile faces series of pressing challenges caused by the in and wireless network he rent design In this paper we extend two latest and promising innovations of Internet software de ned net working and network virtualization to mobile and wire

Designing Path Planning Algorithms for Mobile Anchor towards Range Free Localization Kau hik Mon dal Ar in dam Karma kar Parth Sara thi Mandala Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati India Tez pur University India Abstract Localization is one of the most important factor in wireless sensor networks as many app li cations demand position information of sensors Recently there is an increasing interest on the use of mobile anchors for localizing sensors Most of the works available in the literature either looks into the aspect of reducing path length of mobile anchor or tries to increase lo aliz ation accuracy The challenge is to design movement strategy for mobile anchor that reduces path length while meeting the requirements of good range free localization tech ni que In this paper we propose two cost eec ti ve movement strategies path planning for mobile anchor so that localization can be done using the localization scheme In one strategy we use hexagonal movement pattern for the mobile anchor to localize all sensors inside bounded rectangular region with lesser movement compared to the existing works in literature In other strategy we consider connected network in an unbounded region where the mobile anchor moves in the hexagonal pattern to localize the sensors In this approach we guarantee localization of all sensors within error bound where is the communication range of the mobile anchor and sensors Our simulation results support theoretical results along with localization accuracy Keywords Localization Range free Beacon point Path planning Mobile anchor Wireless Sensor Networks

WARDS RE EN EDI ELI VERY CATION WARE PORT UNITIES AND PP ROACHES HATE ABOU EID AND HOSSAM HAS SANE IN QUEENS UNIVERSITY ABSTRACT Mobile media has undoubtedly become the predominant source of traffic in wireless networks The result is not only congestion and poor Quality of Experience but also an unprecedented energy drain at both the network and user devices In order to sustain this continued growth novel disruptive paradigms of media delivery are urgently needed We envision that two key contemporary advancements can be leveraged to develop greener media delivery platforms the proliferation of navigation hardware and software in mobile devices has created an era of location awareness where both the current and future user locations can be predicted and the rise of context aware network architectures and self organizing functionalities is enabling context signaling and in network adaptation With these developments in mind this article investigates the opportunities of exploiting location awareness to enable green end to end media delivery In particular we discuss and propose approaches for location based adaptive video quality planning in network caching content pre fetching and long term radio resource management To provide insights on the energy savings we then present cross layer framework that jointly optimizes resource allocation and multi user video quality using location predictions Finally we highlight some of the future research directions for location aware media delivery in the conclusion

Once Upon Crime Towards Crime Prediction from Demographics and Mobile Data Andrey Bogo mol ov Bruno Le pri Jacopo tai no Nuri Oliver Fabio Pian es Alex Pent land cid University of Trento Italy Telefonica Research Barcellona Spain Fond azione Bruno Kessler Trento Italy cid MIT Media Lab Cambridge MA United States Abstract In this paper we present novel approach to predict crime in geographic space from multiple data sources in particular mobile phone and demographic data The main contribution of the proposed approach lies in using ag greg ted and an ony miz ed human behavioral data derived from mobile network activity to tackle the crime prediction problem While previous research or ts have used either background historical knowledge or ender pro ling our dings support the hypothesis that aggregated human behavioral data captured from the mobile network infra tru ture in combination with basic demographic information can be used to predict crime In our experimental results with real crime data from London we obtain an accuracy of almost when predicting whether spec ic area in the city will be crime hotspot or not Moreover we provide discussion of the implications of our dings for data driven crime analysis

International Journal of Ad hoc Sensor Ubiquitous Computing IJ AS UC Vol No August DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF INTELLIGENT COMMUNITY SYSTEM BASED ON THIN CLIENT AND CLOUD COMPUTING Wei tao Xu Dong feng Yuan and Liang fei Xue School of Information Science and Engineering Shandong University Jinan China ABSTRACT With the continuous development of science and technology the intelligent development of community system becomes trend Meanwhile smart mobile devices and cloud computing technology are increasingly used in intelligent information systems however smart mobile devices such as smartphone and smart pad also known as thin clients limited by either their capacities CPU memory or battery or their network resources do not always meet users satisfaction in using mobile services Mobile cloud computing in which resource rich virtual machines of smart mobile device are provided to customer as service can be terrific solution for expanding the limitation of real smart mobile device but the resources utilization rate is low and the information cannot be shared easily To address the problems above this paper proposes an information system for intelligent community which is composed of thin clients wide band network and cloud computing servers On one hand the thin clients with the characteristics of energy efficiency high robustness and high computing capacity can efficiently avoid the problems encountered in the PC architecture and mobile devices On the other hand the cloud computing servers in the proposed information system solve the problems of resource sharing barriers Finally the system is built in real environments to evaluate the performance We deploy the proposed system in community with more than residents and it is demonstrated that the proposed system is robust and efficient KEYWORDS Intelligent Community System Thin client Cloud Computing Virtualization Distributed File System

Communication aware algorithms for target tracking in wireless sensor networks Bart omi ej Pl cz ek Institute of Computer Science University of Silesia Be dz in ska So snow iec Poland plac ek bart lo mie gmail com Abstract This paper introduces algorithms for target tracking in wire less sensor networks SNs that enable reduction of data com mu nica tion cost The objective of the considered problem is to control movement of mobile sink which has to reach moving target in the shortest ossi ble time Consumption of the WS energy resources is reduced by trans fer ring only necessary data readings target positions to the mobile sink Simulations were performed to evaluate the proposed algorithms against existing methods The experimental results con rm that the introduced tracking algorithms allow the data communication cost to be consider ably reduced without sign cant increase in the amount of time that the sink needs to catch the target Keywords wireless sensor networks data collection object tracking

Modelling Correlated Mobility Mikael Asp lund Sim in Nad Tehran Department of Computer and Information Science Link ping University mikael asp lund sim in nad tehran liu se Abstract When nodes in mobile network cluster together or move according to common external factors cars that follow the road network the resulting contact patterns become correlated In this work we address the question of modelling such correlated mobility movements for the analysis of intermittently connected networks We propose to use the concept of node colouring time to characterise dynamic node contact patterns We analyse how this model compares to existing work and demonstrate how to extract the relevant data from actual trace les Moreover we show how this information can be used to derive the latency distribution of TN routing protocols Our model achieves very good to simulated results based on real vehicular mobility traces whereas models which assumes independent contacts do not

The vis co elastic properties of chromatin and the nu cleo plasm revealed by scale dependent protein mobility Fabian Er del Michael Baum Kars ten Rip pe Deutsches Krebs for chung zentrum DK and Bio Quant Research Group Genome Organization Function Im Neue he mer Fe ld Heidelberg Germany mail Er del dk de or Kars ten Rip pe dk de Abstract The eukaryotic cell nucleus harbors the DNA genome that is organized in dynamic chromatin network and embedded in viscous crowded fluid This environment directly affects enzymatic reactions and target search processes that access the DNA sequence information However its physical properties as reaction medium are poorly understood Here we exploit mobility measurements of differently sized inert green fluorescent tracer proteins to characterize the vis co elastic properties of the nuclear interior of living human cell We find that it resembles viscous fluid on small and large scales but appears vis co elastic on intermediate scales that change with protein size Our results are consistent with simulations of diffusion through polymers and suggest that chromatin forms random obstacle network rather than self similar structure with fixed fractal dimension By calculating how long molecules remember their previous position in dependence on their size we evaluate how the nuclear environment affects search processes of chromatin targets

Security Architecture for Mobile Wireless Sensor Networks Stefan Schmidt Holger rahn Stefan Fischer and Dietmar Wat jen TU Braunschweig Institute of Operating Systems and Computer Networks Mu hlen for dt str Braunschweig Germany schmidt fischer br cs tu bs de TU Braunschweig Institute of Software Systems Engineering Mu hlen for dt str Braunschweig Germany rahn sse cs tu bs de TU Braunschweig Institute of Theoretical Computer Science Mu hlen for dt str Braunschweig Germany wae jen it cs tu bs de Abstract Wireless sensor networks increasingly become viable so lu ions to many challenging problems and will successively be deployed in many areas in the future However deploying new technology without security in mind has often proved to be unreasonably dangerous We propose security architecture for self organizing mobile wireless sensor networks that prevents many attacks these networks are exposed to Fur the more it limits the security impact of some attacks that cannot be prevented We analyse our security arch it cure and show that it provides the desired security aspects while still being lightweight solution and thus being applicable for self organizing mobile wireless sensor networks

CONCERT Cloud Based Architecture for Next generation Cellular Systems Jing chu Liu Tao Zhao Sheng Zhou Yu Cheng and Zhi sheng Niu Abstract Cellular networks are one of the corner stones of our information driven society However existing cellular systems have been seriously challenged by the explosion of mobile data traffic the emergence of machine type communications and the flourish of mobile Internet services In this article we propose CONCERT CONvergence of Cloud and cEllulaR sysTems converged edge infrastructure for future cellular communications and mobile computing services The proposed architecture is constructed based on the concept of control data plane decoupling The data plane includes heterogeneous physical resources such as radio interfacing equipment computational resources and software defined switches The control plane jointly coordinates physical resources to present them as virtual resources over which software defined services including communications computing and management can be deployed in flexible manner Moreover we introduce new designs for physical resources placement and task scheduling so that CONCERT can overcome the drawbacks of the existing base band up centralization approach and better facilitate innovations in next generation cellular networks These advantages are demonstrated with application examples on the radio access networks RAN with decoupled air interface delay sensitive machine type communications and real time mobile cloud gaming We also discuss some fundamental research issues arising with the proposed architecture to illuminate future research directions Index Terms cellular architecture efficiency flexibility cloud

Energy Ec ent Resource Allocation and User Scheduling for Collaborative Mobile Clouds with Hybrid Receivers Zheng Chang Member IEEE Jie Gong Member IEEE Tap ani Ri st niemi Senior Member IEEE Zhi sheng Niu Fellow IEEE Department of Mathematical Information Technology University of Jyv skyl Box Agora FIN Jyv skyl Finland mail zheng chang tap ani ri st niemi yu Department of Electronic Engineering Tsinghua National Laboratory for Information Science and Technology Tsinghua University Beijing China mail gong mail tsinghua edu cn niu zh tsinghua edu cn Abstract In this paper we study the resource allocation and user scheduling algorithm for minimizing the energy cost of data transmission in the context of OF DMA collaborative mobile cloud CM with simultaneous wireless information and power transfer SWI PT receivers The CM which consists of several collaborating MTs ers one potential so lu tion for down link content distribution and for the energy consumption reduction at the terminal side Meanwhile as RF signal can carry both information and energy sim ul ta neo us ly the induced SWI PT has gained much attention for energy ec ien cy design of mobile nodes Previous work on the design of CM system mainly focused on the cloud formulation or energy ec ien cy investigation while how to allocate the radio re source and schedule user transmission lacks attention With the objective to minimize the system energy consumption an optimization problem which jointly considers sub channel assignment power allocation and user scheduling for group of SWI PT receivers has been presented The formulated problem is addressed through the convex optimization technique Simulation results demonstrate that the proposed user scheduling and resource allocation algorithms can achieve sign cant energy saving performance Keywords content distribution content sharing resource all oca tion sub channel allocation power allocation user scheduling colla or at ive mobile clouds user cooperation

Online Social Networks and Terrorism in Developing Countries Fredrick Romanus Is heng oma College of Informatics and Virtual Education The University of Dodoma Dodoma Tanzania is heng oma gmail com Abstract The advancement in technology has brought new era in terrorism where Online Social Networks SNs have become major platform of communication with wide range of usage from message channeling to propaganda and recruitment of new followers in terrorist groups Meanwhile during the terrorist attacks people use SNs for information exchange mobilizing and uniting and raising money for the victims This paper critically analyses the specific usage of SNs in the times of terrorism attacks in developing countries We crawled and used Twitters data during West gate shopping mall terrorist attack in Nairobi Kenya We then analyzed the number of tweets geo location of tweets demographics of the users and whether users in developing countries tend to tweet re tweet or reply during the event of terrorist attack We define new metrics reach and impression of the tweet and present the models for calculating them The study findings show that users from developing countries tend to tweet more at the first and critical times of the terrorist occurrence Moreover large number of tweets originated from the attacked country Kenya with from men and from women where original posts had most number of tweets followed by replies and re tweets Keywords Developing Countries Online Social Networks Terrorism Twitter and West gate

Two dimensional conn ment of electrons in nano wall network of GaN leading to high mobility and phase coherence Bh asker Va run Thakur Shiva prasad and har Physics Department Indian Institute of Technology Bombay Pow Mumbai India and International Centre for Material Science Jawaharlal Nehru Centre for Advanced Sci en tic Research Bangalore India Abstract Here were port an alternative route to achieve two dimensional electron gas DEG in semiconductor structure It has been shown that charge accumulation on the side facets can lead to the formation of DEG in network of axis oriented wedge shaped GaN nano walls grown on plane sapphire substrate Our study reveals that negative charges on the side facets pushes the electron cloud inward resulting in the formation of DEG in the central plane parallel to the wall height This conn ment is evidenced from several orders of magnitude enhancement of electron mobility as compared to bulk observation of weak localization effect in low temperature magneto transport studies as well as the reduction of both the elastic and inelastic scattering rates with the average width of the walls Importantly the phase coherence length has been found to be as high as which makes the system potentially interesting for spintronics Schrod in ger and the Poisson equations are solved self consistently taking into account the surface charge accumulation effect The result indeed shows the quantum conn ment of electrons even for nm of wall width PAC numbers ag Rn Ey Hs

HYBRID MOBILITY PREDICTION OF INFRASTRUCTURE NODES BY LOCATION TRACKING AND DATA MINING Bi ju Issac Kha rudd in Ab Hamid Tan Faculty of Engineering University Malaysia Sarawak Kota Samara han Sarawak Malaysia issac swinburne edu my hair can uni mas my Faculty of CS and IT University Malaysia Sarawak Kota Samara han Sarawak Malaysia cet an fit uni mas my Abstract In an IEEE Infrastructure network as the mobile node is moving from one access point to another the resource allocation and smooth hand off may be problem If some reliable prediction is done on mobile nodes next move then resources can be allocated optimal ly as the mobile node moves around This would increase the performance throughput of wireless network We plan to investigate on hybrid mobility prediction scheme that uses location tracking and data mining to predict the future path of the mobile node We also propose secure version of the same scheme Through simulation and analysis we present the prediction accuracy of our proposal Keywords Mobility prediction mobility management mobility patterns location tracking data mining

Analysis of Demand Driven Ad Hoc Routing Protocols on Performance and Mobility Bi ju Issac Kha rudd in Ab Hamid and Tan University Malaysia Sarawak UNI MAS Malaysia Abstract Mobile ad hoc networking MANET is growing considerable overhead Reactive protocols or demand technology that can support the operation of adaptive wireless driven protocols trade off this overhead with increased networks With the increased demand rate of wireless delay route to destination is established when it is needed applications it is useful to have more adaptive and self organizing technologies that adapt to changes within network based on an initial discovery between the source and region In this paper we initially present brief listing of table destination In our paper we analyze the different driven ad hoc routing protocols and eventually analyze in demand driven ad hoc routing protocols performance and detail the behavior of demand driven ad hoc routing protocols other behavior The paper is organized as follows Section II like Ad Hoc On Demand Distance Vector Routing AO DV Dynamic Source Routing SR Temporally Ordered Routing gives brief analysis of mobile ad hoc table driven Algorithm TORA in terms of throughput traffic dropped protocols Section III gives comparison of mobile ad hoc routing traffic and mobility The output graphs are eventually demand driven protocols Section IV shows the simulation discussed thus enabling us to understand the routing technology better result with demand driven protocols Section gives the comparison summary on demand driven protocols Section Index Terms ad hoc network routing protocol demand VI is related work and Section VII is the conclusion driven and routing traffic II TABLE DRIVEN PROTOCOLS

Mobile Agents Rendezvous in spite of Malicious Agent Shan tan uD as Flaminia Lucci and Euripides Marko IF Aix Marseille University Marseille France DAIS Universit CaF oscar Venezia Venezia Italy Department of Computer Science and Biomedical Informatics University of Thessaly Lamia Greece Abstract We examine the problem of rendezvous having multiple mobile agents gather in single node of the network Unlike previous studies we need to achieve rendezvous in presence of very powerful adversary malicious agent that moves through the network and tries to block the honest agents and prevents them from gathering The malicious agent can be thought of as mobile fault in the network The malicious agent is assumed to be arbitrarily fast has full knowledge of the network and it cannot be exterminated by the honest agents On the other hand the honest agents are assumed to be quite weak They are asynchronous and anonymous they have only nite memory they have no prior knowledge of the network and they can communicate with the other agents only when they meet at anode Can the honest agents achieve rendezvous starting from an arbitrary cong ration in spite of the malicious agent We present some nec es ary conditions for solving rendezvous in spite of the malicious agent in arbitrary networks We then focus on the ring and mesh topologies and provide algorithms to solve rendezvous For ring networks our algorithms solve rendezvous in all feasible instances of the problem while we show that rendezvous is impossible for an even number of agents in un oriented rings For the oriented mesh networks we prove that the problem can be solved when the honest agents initially form connected cong ration without holes if and only if they can see which are the occupied nodes within two hops distance To the best of our knowledge this is the rst attempt to study such powerful and mobile fault model in the con text of mobile agents Our model lies between the more powerful but static fault model of black holes which can even destroy the agents and the less powerful but mobile fault model of Byzantine agents which can only imitate the honest agents but can neither harm nor stop them Keywords Asynchronous mobile agents rendezvous problem malicious agent

Predicting commuter ow in spatial networks using radiation model based on temporal ranges Yi hui Ren Maria Er sey Rava sz Pu Wang Marta Gonzalez and Zoltan Toro czk Physics Department and the Interdisciplinary Center for Network Science and Applications University of Notre Dame Notre Dame IN USA Faculty of Physics Babes Bolyai University RO Cluj Napoca Romania School of Tra and Transportation Engineering Central South University Shao shan South Road Changsha Hunan China Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering Massachusetts Institute of Technology Massachusetts Avenue Cambridge Massachusetts USA Dated October Abstract Understanding network ow such as commuter tra in large transportation networks is an ongoing challenge due to the complex nature of the transportation infrastructure and of human mobility Here we show rst principles based method for tra prediction using cost based generalization of the radiation model for human mobility coupled with cost minimizing algorithm for ec ent distribution of the mobility ux es through the network Using US census and highway tra data we show that tra can cie ntl and accurately be computed from range limited network betweenness type calculation The model based on travel time costs captures the log normal distribution of the tra and attains high Pearson correlation coe cie nt when compared to real tra Due to its principled nature this method can in form many applications related to human mobility driven ow in spatial networks ranging from transportation through urban planning to mitigation of the eec ts of catastrophic events Electronic address toro nd edu

Design issues for distributed mobile social networks all erg is ou karak is Prez era kos pt of Electronic Computer Systems Technological Educational Institute TEI of Piraeus iga leo Greece mail all erg is prez era tei pir gr pt of Telecommunications Science and Technology University of Peloponnese Tripoli Greece mail if uk op gr ABSTRACT Social networks and their applications have become extremely popular during the last years mostly targeting users via the web However it has been recently observed an interest to offer social network services to mobile users Telecom operators attempt to integrate existing social networks to their systems or develop new ones in order to offer new services to their subscribers Subsequently emphasis is given to the user context modeling as well as to the integration of sources that leads to the summarized collection of information anchored to the user such as its location or its mobile device type etc In this paper we discuss the most important factors and challenges encountered during the design of such system on architectural technological and tool level Keywords user context distributed social networking context aware platform social graphs mobile networks

Adaptive Synchronization of Robotic Sensor Networks as Sinan YI LDI RIM On der GUR CAN Department of Computer Engineering ge University CEA LIST Laboratory of Model driven Universit cad desi Born ova Izmir Turkey engineering for embedded systems Email sinan yi ldi rim ge edu tr Point Courrier Gif sur Yvette France Email on der gur can cea fr Abstract The main focus of recent time synchronization re search is developing power efc ent synchronization methods that meet pre de ned accuracy requirements However an aspect that has been often overlooked is the high dynamics of the network topology due to the mobility of the nodes Employing existing oo ding based and peer to peer synchronization methods are networked robots still be able to adapt themselves and self adjust their logical clocks under mobile network dynamics In this paper we present the application and the evaluation of the existing synchronization methods on robotic sensor networks We show through simulations that Adaptive Value Tracking synchronization is robust and efc ent under mobility Hence deducing the time synchronization problem in robotic sensor networks into dynamic value searching problem is preferable to existing synchronization methods in the literature Fig In time synchronization each robot may synchronize to the neighboring robots inside its communication range peer to peer or to reference robot which ood the stable time information periodically oo ding

Human mobility patterns at the smallest scales Pedro Lind Adriano Moreira For Wind Center for Wind Energy Research Institute of Physics Carl von Ossietzky University of Oldenburg DE Oldenburg Germany Centro Al gori tmi Escola de En gen hari Universidade do Minho Campus de Azure Guimar aes Portugal Abstract We present study on human mobility at small spatial scales Differently from large scale mobility recently studied through dollar bill tracking and mobile phone data sets within one big country or continent were port Brownian features of human mobility at smaller scales In particular the scaling exponents found at the smallest scales is typically close to one half differently from the larger values for the exponent characterizing mobility at larger scales We carefully analyze month data of the Edu roam database within the Portuguese university of Minho full procedure is introduced with the aim of properly characterizing the human mobility within the network of access points composing the wireless system of the university In particular measures of ux are introduced for estimating distance between access points This distance is typically non euclidean since the spatial constraints at such small scales distort the continuum space on which human mobility occurs Since two different exponents are found depending on the scale human motion takes place we raise the question at which scale the transition from Brownian to non Brownian motion takes place In this context we discuss how the numerical approach can be extended to larger scales using the full Edu roam in Europe and in Asia for uncovering the transition between both dynamical regimes PAC Da Fb Hc Keywords Networks Data Analysis Human mobility Motivation and Scope Understanding human motion from small scales such as buildings and streets up to larger ones comprising cities countries and continents has been proven to be important for variety of ap pli cation areas such as spread of diseases opinion dynamics and any other phenomena occur in gon social networks as well as in optimization of telecommunication networks urban planning or tourism management With these aims several groups have been modeling human motion during the past few years Corresponding author Email address pedro lind for wind de Lind adriano dsi minho pt Moreira http www global sci com Global Science Pre print

International Journal of Managing Public Sector Information and Communication Technologies IJ MP ICT Vol No September EXAMINATION AND REPORT ON POTENTIAL METHODS OF STRATEGIC LOCATION BASED SERVICE APPLICATIONS ON MOBILE NETWORKS AND DEVICES as ra Mad dip ou ya Department of Computing and Science Asia Pacific University of Technology Innovation ABSTRACT Mobile technologies are growing significantly in past few years Many new features and enhancement have implemented in mobile technologies in both software and hardware aspects Nowadays cell phones are not just only use for making calls or sending text messages however technologies behind mobile phones expanded vastly which facilitate them to offer various types of services Location based service is one of the most popular mobile technologies which equipped in new generation of hand phones The main focus of this paper is to review various strategic location based applications on mobile networks and devices KEYWORDS Location based services Tracking services Information services Navigation services Global positioning system

FG PGA An Ec ent Genetic Approach for Producing Feasible Graph Partitions Md Li sul Islam Novi Nur in Sw ak khar Shat abd and So hel Rahman Department of Computer Science and Engineering United International University Department of Computer Science and Engineering Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology Department of Informatics Kings College London Email li sul novi sw ak khar se ui ac bd ms rahman se bu et ac bd October Abstract Graph partitioning well studied problem of parallel computing has many applications in divers ed lds such as distributed computing social network analysis data mining and many other domains In this paper we introduce FG PGA an ec ent genetic approach for producing feasible graph partitions Our method takes into account the heterogeneity and capacity constraints of the partitions to ensure balanced partitioning Such approach has various applications in mobile cloud computing that include feasible deployment of software app li cations on the more resourceful infrastructure in the cloud instead of mobile hand set Our proposed approach is light weight and hence suitable for use in cloud architecture We ensure feasibility of the partitions generated by not allowing over sized partitions to be generated during the initialization and search Our proposed method tested on standard benchmark datasets sign cant ly outperforms the state of the art methods in terms of quality of partitions and feasibility of the solutions

Survey of End to End Mobile Network Measurement Test beds Tools and Services Ut kars Go el Mike Wit tie Kimberly laffy and Andrew Le Abstract Mobile cellular networks enable innovation but can also tie it and lead to user frustration when network performance falls below expectations As mobile networks become the predominant method of Internet access developer research network operator and regulatory communities have taken an increased interest in measuring end to end mobile network performance to among other goals minimize negative impact on application responsiveness In this survey we examine current approaches to end to end mobile network performance measurement diagnosis and application prototyping We compare available tools and their shortcomings with respect to the needs of researchers developers regulators and the public We intend for this survey to provide comprehensive view of currently active efforts and some auspicious directions for future work in mobile network measurement and mobile application performance evaluation Index Terms Mobile network measurement test beds

PATIO TEMPORAL DETECTION OF UNUSUAL HUMAN POPULATION BEHAVIOR USING MOBILE PHONE DATA ADRIAN DO BRA NATHALIE WILLIAMS AND NATHAN EAGLE Abstract With the aim to contribute to humanitarian response to disasters and violent events scientists have proposed the development of analytical tools that could identify emer gen cy events in real time using mobile phone data The assumption is that dramatic and discrete changes in behavior measured with mobile phone data will indicate extreme events In this study we propose an ec ent system for patio temporal detection of behavioral nom lies from mobile phone data and compare sites with behavioral anomalies to an extensive database of emergency and non emergency events in Rwanda Our methodology successfully captures anomalous behavioral patterns associated with abroad range of events from religious and oc al holidays to earthquakes ood violence against civilians and protests Our results suggest that human behavioral responses to extreme events are complex and multi dimensional including extreme increases and decreases in both calling and movement behaviors We also nd sign cant temporal and spatial variance in responses to extreme events Our behavioral anomaly detection system and extensive discussion of results are sign cant contribution to the long term project of creating an eec ti ve real time event detection system with mobile phone data and we discuss the implications of our dings for future research to this end KEYWORDS Big data call detail record emergency events human mobility Contents

SACR Social Aware Crowd sourcing with Reputation Management in Mobile Sensing JuRe na Yao xue Zhang Kuan Zhang Xue min Sherman She nb School of Information Science and Engineering Central South University Changsha China Dept of Electrical and Computer Engineering University of Waterloo Waterloo Ontario Canada Abstract Mobile sensing has become promising paradigm for mobile users to obtain information by task crowd sourcing However due to the social preferences of mobile users the quality of sensing reports may be impacted by the underlying social attributes and sel sh ness of individuals Therefore it is crucial to consider the social impacts and trustworthiness of mobile users when selecting task participants in mobile sensing In this paper we propose Social Aware Crowd sourcing with Reputation Management SACR scheme to select the well suited participants and allocate the task rewards in mobile sensing Spec ic ally we consider the social attributes task delay and reputation in crowd sourcing and propose participant selection scheme to choose the well suited participants for the sensing task under axed task budget report assessment and rewarding scheme is also introduced to measure the quality of the sensing reports and allocate the task rewards based the assessed report quality In addition we develop reputation management scheme to evaluate the trustworthiness and cost performance ratio of mobile users for participants election Theoretical analysis and extensive simulations demonstrate that SACR can cie ntl improve the crowd sourcing utility and eec iv ely stimulate the participants to improve the quality of their sensing reports Keywords Mobile sensing crowd sensing social impact reputation participants election crowd sourcing

In en ce of socio demographic characteristics on human mobility Maxime Le normand Thomas Lou ail Oliva Can tu Ros Miguel Pi cornell Ricardo Herr anz Juan Murillo Arias Marc Barthelemy Maxi San Miguel and Jose Ram asco Instituto de sica Inter disc ipl in ar Sistema Comp le jos IF IS SIC IB Campus IB Palma de Mallorca Spain Institut de Physique The rique CEA CNRS URA Gif sur Yvette France Geo graph ie Cites CNRS Paris Paris MR rue du four FR Paris France No mm on Solutions and Technologies calle Can as Madrid Spain BBV Data Analytics Avenida de Burgos Madrid Spain Centre Analyse et de Ma the mati que Social es HESS CNRS MR avenue de France FR Paris France Human mobility has been traditionally studied using surveys that deliver snapshots of population displacement patterns The growing accessibility to ICT information from portable digital media has recently opened the possibility of exploring human behavior thighs patio temporal resolutions Mobile phone records geo located tweets check in from Foursquare or geo tagged photos have contributed to this purpose at die rent scales from cities to countries indie rent world areas Many previous works lacked however details on the individuals attributes such as age or gender In this work we analyze credit card records from Barcelona and Madrid and by examining the geo located credit card transactions of individuals living in the two provinces wend that the mobility patterns vary according to gender age and occupation Dieren ces in distance traveled and travel purpose are observed between younger and older people but curiously either between males and females of similar age While mobility displays some generic features here we show that socio demographic characteristics play relevant role and must betaken into account for mobility and epidemiological model iz ation

Microscopic theory for negative dieren ti al mobility in crowded environments Be ni chou Ill ien shan in arra cino and Vo it riez Sorbonne Universit es UP MC Un iv Paris MR LP MC Paris France and CNRS MR Labor to ire de Physique The rique de la Mati ere Condense Paris France We study the behavior of the stationary velocity of driven particle in an environment of mobile hard core obstacles Based on lattice gas model we demonstrate analytically that the drift velocity can exhibit non monotonic dependence on the applied force and show quantitatively that such negative dieren ti al mobility ND observed in various physical contexts is controlled by both the density and diu sion time scale of obstacles Our study unies recent numerical and analytical results obtained in spec ic regimes and makes it possible to determine analytically the region of the full parameter space where ND occurs These results suggest that ND could be generic feature of biased or active transport in crowded environments PAC numbers Fb Pp

Two layer Architecture of Mobile Sinks and Static Sensors Nat rajan Meghan than Gordon Skelton Department of Computer Science Department of Computer Engineering Jackson State University Jackson State University Jackson MS Jackson MS Abstract We propose two layer mobile sink and static sensor network MS SN architecture for large scale wireless sensor networks The top layer is mobile ad hoc network of resource rich sink nodes while the bottom layer is network of static resource constrained sensor nodes The MS SN architecture can be implemented at lower cost with the currently available IEEE devices that only use single half duplex transceiver Each sink node is assigned particular region to monitor and collect data sink node moves to the vicinity of the sensor nodes within few hops to collect data The collected data is exchanged with peer mobile sinks Thus the MS SN architecture provides cal ability extends sensor lifetime by letting them operate with limited transmission range and provides connectivity between isolated regions of sensor nodes In order to provide fault tolerance more than one mobile sink could be collecting data from given region or mobile sink could collect data from more than one region In the later half of the paper we discuss several open research issues that need to be addressed while implementing the MS SN architecture Key Words Sensors Sinks Mobility Network architecture

Pattern formation in multiplex networks Nikos Kou var is hig ef umi Hat and Albert Daz Guile ra Department of Physics University of Barcelona Mart Fran que Barcelona Spain Department of Mathematical Science and Advanced Technology Japan Agency for Marine Earth Science and Technology Kanagawa Japan Dated October Abstract The advances in understanding complex networks have generated increasing interest in dyna mi cal processes occurring on them Pattern formation in activator inhibitor systems has been studied in networks revealing dieren ces from the classical continuous media Here we study pattern for mati on in new framework namely multiplex networks These are systems where activator and inhibitor species occupy separate nodes in die rent layers Species react across layers but di use only within their own layer of distinct network topology This multiplicity generates heterogeneous patterns with sign cant dieren ces from those observed in single layer networks Remarkably diu sion induced instability can occur even if the two species have the same mobility rates cond tion which can never destabilize single layer networks The instability condition is revealed using perturbation theory and expressed by combination of degrees in the die rent layers Our the or demonstrates that the existence of such topology driven instabilities is generic in multiplex networks providing new mechanism of pattern formation nikos kou var is ub edu

Handover Management in Highly Dense Fem to cellular Networks Most afa Zaman Chowdhury and Yeong Min Jang Department of Electronics Engineering Koo km in University Seoul Korea mail mz eee yahoo com jang koo km in ac kr Corresponding author Abstract Fem to cell technology is envisioned to be widely deployed in subscribers homes to provide high data rate communications with quality of service Dense deployment of fem to cells will offload large amounts of traffic from the macro cellular network to the fem to cellular network by the successful integration of macro cellular and fem to cellular networks Efficient handling of handover calls is the key for successful fem to cell macro cell integration For dense fem to cells intelligent integrated fem to cell macro cell network architecture neighbor cell list with minimum number of fem to cells effective call admission control CAC and handover processes with proper signaling are the open research issues An appropriate traffic model for the integrated fem to cell macro cell network is also not yet developed In this paper we present the major issue of mobility management for the integrated fem to cell macro cell network We propose novel algorithm to create neighbor cell list with minimum but appropriate number of cells for handover We also propose detailed handover procedures and novel traffic model for the integrated fem to cell macro cell network The proposed CAC effectively handles various calls The numerical and simulation results show the importance of the integrated fem to cell macro cell network and the performance improvement of the proposed schemes Our proposed schemes for dense fem to cells will be very effective for those in research and industry to implement Keywords Fem to cell dense fem to cell handover SON neighbor cell list fem to cell to fem to cell handover macro cell to fem to cell handover fem to cell to macro cell handover traffic model and CAC

Handover Call Admission Control for Mobile Fem to cells with Free Space Optical and Macro cellular Backbone Networks Most afa Zaman Chowdhury Nir zha Saha Sung Hun Cha and Yeong Min Jang Department of Electronics Engineering Koo km in University Korea Abstract The deployment of mobile fem to cellular networks can enhance the service quality for the users inside the vehicles The deployment of mobile fem to cells generates lot of handover calls Also numbers of group handover scenarios are found in mobile fem to cellular network deployment The ability to seamlessly switch between the fem to cells and the macro cell networks is key concern for fem to cell network deployment However until now there is no effective and complete handover scheme for the mobile fem to cell network deployment Also handover between the back haul networks is major concern for the mobile fem to cellular network deployment In this paper we propose handover control between the access networks for the individual handover cases Call flows for the handover between the back haul networks of the macro cell to macro cell case are proposed in this paper We also propose the link switching for the SO based back haul networks The proposed resource allocation scheme ensures the negligible handover call dropping probability as well as higher bandwidth utilization Key words Mobile fem to cell resource allocation handover group handover and call dropping probability quality signal Repeater or signal booster can also solve the

SELECTIVE WATCHDOG TECHNIQUE FOR INTRUSION DETECTION IN MOBILE AD HOC NETWORK DEEPIKA DU AND ATUL MISHRA Department of Computer Engineering YMCA University of Science Technology Haryana India deepika du gmail com Department of Computer Engineering YMCA University of Science Technology Haryana India ish atul gmail com ABSTRACT Mobile ad hoc networks MANET is the collection of mobile nodes which are self organizing and are connected by wireless links where nodes which are not in the direct range communicate with each other relying on the intermediate nodes As result of trusting other nodes in the route malicious node can easily compromise the security of the network black hole node is the malicious node which drops the entire packet coming to it and always shows the fresh route to the destination even if the route to destination doesn't exist This paper describes scheme that will detect the intrusion in the network in the presence of black hole node and its performance is compared with the previous technique This novel technique helps to increase the network performance by reducing the overhead in the network KEYWORDS MANET Intrusion Intrusion Detection System Attacks

Load Balancing Optimization in LTE LTE Cellular Networks Review Sum it Mishra Corresponding author Nid hi Math ur Electronics and Communication Engineering Department Amity school of Engineering and Technology Amity University Lucknow Campus mail mishra sum it gmail com Abstract During the past few decades wireless technology has seen tremendous growth The recent introduction of high end mobile devices has further increased subscribers demand for high bandwidth Current cellular systems require manual configuration and management of networks which is now costly time consuming and error prone due to exponentially increasing rate of mobile users and nodes This leads to introduction of self organizing capabilities for network management with minimum human involvement It is expected to permit higher end user Quality of Service Qo along with less operational and maintenance cost for telecom service providers Self organized cellular networks incorporate collection of functions for automatic configuration optimization and maintenance of cellular networks As mobile end users continue to use network resources while moving from cell boundary to other traffic load within cell does not remain constant Thus Load balancing as part of self organized network solution has become one of the most active and emerging fields of research in Cellular Network It involves transfer of load from overloaded cells to the neighbouring cells with free resources for more balanced load distribution in order to maintain appropriate end user experience and network performance In this paper review of various load balancing techniques currently used in mobile networks is presented with special emphasis on techniques that are suitable for self optimization feature in future cellular networks Keywords Self Optimization Load Balancing eN LTE Advanced

Regular Issue An Effective Approach for Mobile ad hoc Network via Watchdog Protocol Nid hi Lal Indian Institute of Information Technology destination node with the help of intermediate nodes Abstract Mobile ad hoc network MANET is now days become very famous due to their fixed infrastructure less quality and dynamic nature They contain large number of nodes which are connected and communicated to each other in wireless nature Mobile ad hoc network is wireless technology that contains high mobility of nodes and does not depend on the background administrator for central authority because they do not contain any infrastructure Nodes of the MANET use radio wave for communication and having limited resources and limited computational power The Topology of this network is changing very frequently because they are distributed in nature and self configurable Due to its wireless nature and lack of any central authority in the background Mobile ad hoc networks are always vulnerable to some security issues and performance issues The security imposes huge impact on the performance of any network Some of the security issues are black hole attack flooding wormhole attack etc In this paper we will discuss issues regarding low performance of Watchdog protocol used in the MANET and proposed an improved Watchdog mechanism which is called by Watchdog protocol that overcomes the limitations of Watchdog protocol and gives high performance in Fig The sketch out of MANET terms of throughput delay In the above figure many numbers of nodes are in the network Keywords MANET Watchdog AO DV Black hole REP in which one is acting as sender node and another one is the RR EQ RER Malicious node DR Watchdog Sequence receiving node Sender wishes to propel data packet to his number subsequent receiving node For initiating this communication the sender can send these data packets via the help of intermediate nodes which are within the communication range of the sender

Performance Comparison of Minimum Hop vs Minimum Edge Based Multi cast Routing under Different Mobility Models for Mobile Ad hoc Networks Nat rajan Meghan than Associate Professor Department of Computer Science Jackson State University Jackson MS USA Phone Fax mail nat rajan meghan than sums edu Abstract The high level contribution of this paper is to establish benchmarks for the minimum hop count per source receiver path and the minimum number of edges per tree for multi cast routing in mobile ad hoc networks MANET under different mobility models In this pursuit we explore the tradeoffs between these two routing strategies with respect to hop count number of edges and lifetime per multi cast tree with respect to the Random Waypoint City Section and Manhattan mobility models We employ the Breadth First Search algorithm and the Minimum Steiner Tree heuristic for determining sequence of minimum hop and minimum edge trees respectively While both the minimum hop and minimum edge trees exist for relatively longer time under the Manhattan mobility model the number of edges per tree and the hop count per source receiver path are relatively low under the Random Waypoint model For all the three mobility models the minimum edge trees have longer lifetime compared to the minimum hop trees and the difference in lifetime increases with increase in network density and or the multi cast group size Multi cast trees determined under the City Section model incur fewer edges and lower hop count compared to the Manhattan mobility model Keywords Minimum Hop Minimum Edge Multi cast Routing Mobile Ad hoc Networks Simulations Steiner Trees Mobility Models Tree Lifetime

Sensors manuscripts doi OPEN ACCESS sensors ISSN www dpi com journal sensors Article Color Filtering Localization for Three Dimensional Underwater Acoustic Sensor Networks Zhi hua Liu Han Gao Wu ling Wang Shuai Chang and Jia xing Chen College of Information Technology Hebei Normal University Shiji zhuang Hebei China Mail he btu liu zhi hua com qq com College of Mathematics and Information Science Hebei Normal University Shiji zhuang Hebei China Mails gao han com qq com Author to whom correspondence should be addressed Mail com Tel Fax External Editor Received Accepted Published Abstract Accurate localization for mobile nodes has been an important and fundamental problem in underwater acoustic sensor networks AS Ns The detection information returned from mobile node is meaningful only if its location is known In this paper we propose two localization algorithms based on color filtering technology called CFL and CFL CFL and CFL aim at collaborative ly accomplishing accurate localization of underwater mobile nodes with minimum energy expenditure They both adopt the overlapping signal region of task anchors which can communicate with the mobile node directly as the current sampling area CFL employs the projected distances between each of the task projections and the mobile node while CFL adopts the direct distance between each of the task anchors and the mobile node Also the proportion factor of distance is proposed to weight the RGB values By comparing the nearness degrees of the RGB sequences between the samples and the mobile node samples can be filtered out And the normalized nearness degrees are considered as the weighted standards to calculate coordinates of the mobile nodes The simulation results show that the proposed methods have excellent localization performance and can timely localize the mobile node The average localization error of CFL can decline by about than the AFL method Keywords underwater acoustic sensor networks AS Ns self localization color

Hand off Rate and Coverage Analysis in Multi tier Heterogeneous Networks Sanam Sadr and Ravi raj Ad ve University of Toronto Dept of Ele and Comp Eng Kings College Road Toronto Ontario Canada sadr rsa ve com toronto ca Abstract This paper analyzes the impact of user mobility in multi tier heterogeneous networks We begin by obtaining the hand off rate for mobile user in an irregular cellular network with the access point locations modeled as homogeneous Poisson point process The received signal to interference ratio SIR distribution along with chosen SIR threshold is then used to obtain the probability of coverage To capture potential connection failures due to mobility we assume that fraction of hand offs result in such failures Considering multi tier network with orthogonal spectrum allocation among tiers and the maximum biased average received power as the tier association metric we derive the probability of coverage for two cases the user is stationary hand offs do not occur or the system is not sensitive to hand offs the user is mobile and the system is sensitive to hand offs We derive the optimal bias factors to maximize the coverage We show that when the user is mobile and the network is sensitive to hand offs both the optimum tier association and the probability of coverage depend on the users speed speed dependent bias factor can then adjust the tier association to effectively improve the coverage and hence system performance in fully loaded network Index Terms Heterogeneous cellular networks Poisson point processes range expansion user association hand off rate down link coverage analysis DRAFT

Quantifying Potential Energy Efc ien cy Gain in Green Cellular Wireless Networks Kemal Dav as lio lu Student Member IEEE and Ender Ayano lu Fellow IEEE Center for Pervasive Communications and Computing Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science University of California Irvine Abstract Conventional cellular wireless networks were designed with the purpose of providing high throughput for the user and high capacity for the service provider without any provisions of energy efc ien cy As result these networks have an enormous Carbon footprint In this paper we describe the sources of the in efc ien cie in such networks First we present results of the studies on how much Carbon footprint such networks generate We also discuss how much more mobile tr afc is expected to increase so that this Carbon footprint will even increase tremendously more We then discuss spec ic sources of in efc ien cy and potential sources of improvement at the physical layer as well as at higher layers of the communication protocol hierarchy In particular considering that most of the energy in efc ien cy in cellular wireless networks is at the base stations we discuss multi tier networks and point to the potential of exploiting mobility patterns in order to use base station energy judiciously We then investigate potential methods to reduce this in efc ien cy and quantify their individual contributions By consideration of the combination of all potential gains we conclude that an improvement in energy consumption in cellular wireless networks by two orders of magnitude or even more is possible

Energy cie nt Broadcast in Mobile Networks Subject to Channel Randomness Zi jie Zhang Member IEEE Guo qiang Mao Senior Member IEEE and Brian Anderson Life Fellow IEEE Abstract Wireless communication in network of mobile devices is challenging and resource demanding task due to the highly dynamic network topology and the wireless channel randomness This paper investigates information broadcast schemes in mobile ad hoc networks where nodes are initially randomly distributed and then move following random direction mobility model Based on an in depth analysis of the popular Susceptible Infectious Recovered epidemic broadcast scheme this paper proposes novel energy and bandwidth ec ent broadcast scheme named the energy ec ent broadcast scheme which is able to adapt to fast changing network topology and channel randomness Analytical results are provided to characterize the performance of the proposed scheme including the fraction of nodes that can receive the information and the delay of the information dissemination process The accuracy of analytical results is ve ried using simulations driven by both the random direction mobility model and real world trace Index Terms mobile ad hoc networks shadowing fading connectivity epidemic broadcast This work was mainly undertaken while Zhang was associated with the School of Electrical and Information Engineering University of Sydney and National ICT Australia mail zi jie zhang sydney edu au Mao is with the School of Computing and Communications The University of Technology Sydney and National ICT Australia mail mao ieee org Anderson is with the Research School of Engineering Australian National University and National ICT Australia mail brian anderson anu edu au This research is supported by Australian Research Council ARC Discovery projects DP and DP

Daily rhythms in mobile telephone communication Tal yeh led av ood Eduardo Lopez Sam Roberts Felix Reed Tso chas Esteban Moro Robin Dunbar and Jari Sara maki Aalto University School of Science Box FI Finland CAB Dy Complexity Center Sad Business School University of Oxford Oxford OX HP United Kingdom Department of Psychology University of Chester Chester CH BJ United Kingdom Department of Sociology University of Oxford Oxford OX United Kingdom Depart men to de Mate mati cas IS Universidad Carlos III de Madrid Legan es Spain Department of Experimental Psychology University of Oxford Oxford OX UD United Kingdom Dated October Circadian rhythms are known to be important drivers of human activity and the recent avail bil it of electronic records of human behaviour has provided ne grained data of temporal patterns of activity on large scale Further questionnaire studies have den tied important individual dieren ces in circadian rhythms with people broadly categorised into morning like or evening like individuals However little is known about the social aspects of these circadian rhythms or how they vary across individuals In this study we use unique month data set that combines mo bile phone calls and questionnaire data to examine individual dieren ces in the daily rhythms of mobile phone activity We demonstrate clear individual dieren ces in daily patterns of phone calls and show that these individual dieren ces are persistent despite high degree of turnover in the individuals social networks Further womens calls were longer than mens calls especially during the evening and at night and these calls were typically focused on small number of emotionally intense relationships These results demonstrate that individual dieren ces in circadian rhythms are not just related to broad patterns of morning ness and evening ness but have strong social component in directing phone calls to spec ic individuals at spec ic times of day

JOURNAL OF INFORMATION SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING XX XXX XXX Barrier Coverage in Mobile Camera Sensor Networks with Grid Based Deployment XIAO LAN LIU BIN YANG AND GUI LIN CHEN School of Computer and Information Engineering Chu zhou University Chu zhou China mail xl gl chen ch zu edu cn yang inchi gmail com Barrier coverage is critical issue in wireless sensor networks for many practical applications national border monitoring security surveillance and intruder detection etc Its aim is to detect intruders that attempt to cross the protected region Available works mainly focused on the barrier coverage of directional sensors cameras which have limited coverage area and sensing angles In this paper we study how to efficiently improve barrier coverage using mobile camera sensors where camera sensors are deployed by grid based strategy We first propose novel full view covered model of mobile camera sensors With this model we divide the target field into connected grids and deploy mobile camera sensors for each grid Then we construct weighted directed graph to model the full view covered grids and their relationship Based on the graph we employ Dijkstra algorithm to obtain shortest camera barrier which is connected full view covered zone across the target field and contains minimum number of camera sensors Finally extensive simulation results are provided to illustrate that our proposed solution outperforms others in terms of coverage probability and minimum number of camera sensors Keywords mobile camera sensors barrier coverage full view coverage grid based deployment

Abstract The service provided by mobile networks operated today is not adapted to patio temporal uc tua ions in tr afc demand although such uc tu at ions offer opportunities for energy savings In particular sign cant gains in energy efc ien cy are realizable by disengaging temporarily redundant hardware components of base stations We therefore propose novel optimization framework that considers both the load dependent energy radiated by the antennas and the remaining forms of energy needed for operating the base stations The objective is to reduce the energy consumption of mobile networks while ensuring that the data rate requirements of the users are met throughout the coverage area Building upon sparse optimization techniques we develop major iz ation minimization algorithm with the ability to identify energy efc ent network cong rations The iterative algorithm is load aware has low computational complexity and can be implemented in an online fashion to exploit loa duct at ions on short time scale Simulations show that the algorithm can nd network cong rations with the energy consumption similar to that obtained with global optimization tools which cannot be applied to real large networks Although we consider only one currently deployed cellular technology the optimization framework is general potentially applicable to large class of access technologies Index Prog mos is Evaluating Risky Individual Behavior During Epidemics Using Mobile Network Data Antonio Lima eljko Pe jovi Massa chu sets Institute of Technology MIT University of Birmingham UK University of Birmingham UK Luca Rossi Mir coM soles University of Birmingham UK University of Birmingham UK Marta Gonzalez Massachusetts Institute of Technology MIT Abstract The possibility to analyze quantify and forecast epidemic outbreaks is fund mental when devising effective disease containment strategies Policymakers are faced with the intricate task of drafting realistically implementable policies that strike balance between risk management and cost Two major techniques policy makers have at their disposal are epidemic modeling and contact tracing Models are used to forecast the evolution of the epidemic both globally and regionally while contact tracing is used to reconstruct the chain of people who have been potentially infected so that they can be tested isolated and treated immediately However both techniques might provide limited information especially during an already advanced crisis when the need for action is urgent In this paper we propose an alternative approach that goes beyond epidemic mod eling and contact tracing and leverages behavioral data generated by mobile car rie networks to evaluate contagion risk on per user basis The individual risk Xi represents the loss incurred by not isolating or treating spec ic person both in terms of how likely it is for this person to spread the disease as well as how many secondary infections it will cause To this aim we develop model named Prog mos is which quan ties this risk based on movement and regional aggregated statistics about infection rates We develop and release an open source tool that calculates this risk based on cellular network events We simulate realistic epi demi scenarios based on an Ebola virus outbreak wend that gradually restrict ing the mobility of subset of individuals reduces the number of infected people after days by While these results are promising it is important to underline the fact that this is only an initial foundational work and to stress some key points First this paper focuses on theoretical model rather than on its actual translation into real world system In particular centralized deployments of this model would pose several ethical questions as they would require access to user data Decentralized deployments for which user mobility data never leaves the mobile device of user are possible and should be preferred as they fully protect user privacy Second results are generated from computer based simulations under spec ic as sump ions Social factors and technical if cul ties might greatly affect results obtained in the real world Third this risk assessment tool is not designed spec ic ally for

The Eec of Rec en cy to Human Mobility Hugo Barbosa Fernando de Lima Neto Alexandre Ev suk and Ronaldo Menezes Bio Complex Lab Department of Computer Sciences Florida Institute of Technology USA Computational Intelligence Research Group Polytechnic School University of Pernambuco Brazil COPP Federal University of Rio de Janeiro Brazil barbosa bio complex lab org Abstract In recent years we have seen scientists attempt to model and explain human dynamics and in particular human movement Many aspects of our complex life are aec ted by human movement such as disease spread and epidemics modeling city planning wireless network development and disaster relief to name few Given the myriad of applications it is clear that complete understanding of how people move in space can lead to huge be nets to our society In most of the recent works scientists have focused on the idea that people movements are biased towards frequently visited locations According to them human movement is based on exploration exploitation dichotomy in which individuals choose new locations exploration or return to frequently visited locations exploitation In this work we focus on the concept of rec en cy We propose model in which exploitation in human movement also considers recently visited locations and not solely frequently visited locations We test our hypothesis against die rent empirical data of human mobility and show that our proposed model is able to better explain the human trajectories in these datasets Keywords Human Mobility Regularities in Human Dynamics Mobility Data Analysis

From seconds to months multi scale dynamics of mobile telephone calls Jari Sara maki and Esteban Moro Complex Networks Group Aalto University School of Science Box FI Finland Depart men to de Mate mati cas IS Universidad Carlos III de Madrid Legan es Spain Dated October Big Data on electronic records of social interactions allow approaching human behaviour and sociality from quantitative point of view with unforeseen statistical power Mobile telephone Call Detail Records CDR automatically collected by telecom operators for billing purposes have proven especially fruitful for understanding one to one communication patterns as well as the dynamics of social networks that are ree ted in such patterns We present an overview of empirical results on the multi scale dynamics of social dynamics and networks inferred from mobile telephone calls We begin with the shortest timescales and fastest dynamics such as burst in ess of call sequences between individuals and zoom out towards longer temporal and larger structural scales from temporal motifs formed by correlated calls between multiple individuals to long term dynamics of social groups We conclude this overview with future outlook

Wide area Wireless Communication Challenges for the Internet of Things Harp re et hill on Howard Huang Hari sh Viswanathan Virginia Tech Email hd hill on vt edu Bell Labs Alca tel Lucent Email howard huang hari sh viswanathan alca tel lucent com April ABSTRACT Aided by the ubiquitous wireless connectivity declining communication costs and the emergence of cloud platforms the deployment of Internet of Things oT devices and services is accelerating Most major mobile network operators view machine to machine communication networks for supporting oT as significant source of new revenue In this paper we motivate the need for wide area wireless networks especially for short data packet communication to support very large number of oT devices We first present brief overview of current and emerging technologies for supporting wide area and then using communication theory principles discuss the fundamental challenges and potential solutions for these networks highlighting tradeoffs and strategies for random and scheduled access We conclude with recommendations for how future networks should be designed for efficient wide area communications

Inferring Unusual Crowd Events From Mobile Phone Call Detail Records Yu xiao Dong Fabio Pine lli Yi ann is kou as Zub air Nabi Francesco Cala bres Nites Ch awl Interdisciplinary Center for Network Science and Applications Department of Computer Science and Engineering University of Notre Dame Notre Dame IN United States of America IBM Research Ireland dong nd edu fabio pin yi ann is zub air cala bre ie ibm com nch awl nd edu Abstract The pervasive ness and availability of mobile phone data er the opportunity of is covering usable knowledge about crowd behaviors in urban environments Cities can leverage such knowledge in order to provide better services public transport planning optimized resource allocation and safer cities Call Detail Record CDR data represents practical data source to detect and monitor unusual events con side ring the high level of mobile phone penetration compared with GPS equipped and open devices In this paper we provide methodology that is able to detect unusual events from CDR data that typically has low accuracy in terms of space and time resolution Moreover we introduce concept of unusual event that involves large amount of people who expose an unusual mobility behavior Our careful con side ration of the issues that come from coarse grained CDR data ultimately leads to completely general framework that can detect unusual crowd events from CDR data eec iv ely and cie ntl Through extensive experiments on real world CDR data for large city in Africa we demonstrate that our method can detect unusual events with higher recall and over times higher precision compared to state of the art methods We implement visual analytics prototype system to help end users analyze detected unusual crowd events to best suit die rent application sc enar ios To the best of our knowledge this is the rst work on the detection of unusual events from CDR data with considerations of its temporal and spatial sparseness and distinction between user unusual activities and daily routines

Cooperative Interference Mitigation and Handover Management for Heterogeneous Cloud Small Cell Networks Hai jun Zhang Member IEEE Chun xiao Jiang Member IEEE Julian Cheng Senior Member IEEE and Victor Leung Fellow IEEE Abstract Heterogeneous small cell network has attracted much attention to satisfy users explosive data tr afc requirements Heterogeneous cloud small cell network HC Net which combines cloud computing and heterogeneous small cell network will likely play an important role in mobile communication networks However with massive deployment of small cells co channel interference and handover management are two important problems in HC Net especially for cell edge users In this article we examine the problems of cooperative interference mitigation and handover management in HC Net network architecture is described to combine cloud radio access network with small cells An effective coordinated multi point CoMP clustering scheme using afn it propagation is adopted to mitigate cell edge users interference low complexity handover management scheme is presented and its signaling procedure is analyzed in HC Net Numerical results show that the proposed network architecture CoMP clustering scheme and handover management scheme can sign cant ly increase the capacity of HC Net while maintaining users quality of service Hai jun Zhang and Victor Leung are with the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering The University of British Columbia Vancouver BC Canada mail hai jun zhang ece bc ca leung ece bc ca Chun xiao Jiang is with the Department of Electronic Engineering Tsinghua University Beijing China mail jc hx tsinghua edu cn corresponding author Julian Cheng is with the School of Engineering The University of British Columbia Kelowna BC Canada mail julian cheng bc ca May DRAFT
