Tra dynamics on dynamical networks The connection between network lifetime and tra congestion Xian xia Yang un lai Pu Mei chen Yan Rajput Ra miz Sh arafat and Jian Yang Department of Computer Science and Engineering Nanjing University of Science and Technology Nanjing China Dated April For many power limited networks such as wireless sensor networks and mobile ad hoc networks maximizing the network lifetime is the rst concern in the related designing and maintaining ac ti vi ties We study the network lifetime from the perspective of network science In our dynamic network nodes are assigned ed amount of energy initially and consume the energy in the de livery of packets We divided the network tra ow into four states no slow fast and absolute congestion states We derive the network lifetime by considering the state of the tra ow We nd that the network lifetime is generally opposite to tra congestion in that the more congested tra the less network lifetime We also nd the impacts of factors such as packet generation rate communication radius node moving speed etc on network lifetime and tra congestion PAC numbers Hc

Mobile Converged Networks Framework Optimization and Challenges Tao Han Member IEEE Yang Yang Senior Member IEEE Xiao hu Ge Senior Member IEEE Guo qiang Mao Senior Member IEEE Department of Electronics and Information Engineering Hua zhong University of Science and Technology China School of Information Science and Technology Shanghai Tech University China School of Computing and Communications University of Technology Sydney Australia National ICT Australia NIC TA Australia Email han tao xh ge hust edu cn yang yang shanghai tech edu cn mao ieee org Abstract In this paper new framework of mobile converged networks is proposed for ex ble resource optimization over multi tier wireless heterogeneous networks Design principles and advantages of this new framework of mobile converged networks are discussed Moreover mobile converged network models based on interference coordination and energy efc ien cy are presented and the corresponding optimization algorithms are developed Furthermore future challenges of mobile converged networks are den tied to promote the study in modeling and performance analysis of mobile converged networks

Magneto oscillations of the mobility edge in Coulomb frustrated bosons and fermions Thu ong Nguyen and Markus Muller International School for Advanced Studies IS Trieste Italy The Abdus Salam International Center for Theoretical Physics Trieste Italy Is it to Nazionale di Fi sica Nuclear IN FN Se zi one di Trieste Trieste Italy Condensed matter theory group Paul cher rer Institute CH Villi gen PSI Switzerland Department of Physics University of Basel Kling el bergstra sse CH Basel Switzerland Dated September We study the crossover from strong to weak localization of hard core bosons on two dimensional honeycomb lattice in magnetic el as motivated by recent experiments on structured lms Taking into account long range Coulomb interactions among the bosons an eec ti ve mobility edge in the excitation spectrum of the insulating Bose glass is den tied as the intensive energy scale at which excitation become nearly delocalized Within the forward scattering approximation in the boson chopping wend the eec ti ve mobility edge to oscillate periodically with the magnetic ux per plaque tte We nd non analytic cusps in at integer or half integer ux The bo sonic magneto oscillations start with an increase of the mobility edge and thus of resistance with applied ux in contrast to the equivalent fermionic problem The amplitude of the oscillations is much more substantial in bosons than in fermions Bosons exhibit single hump peru period while fermion characteristics undergo two humps Those are identical for non interacting fermions but Coulomb correlations are shown to lead to systematic deviations from this statistical period doubling Our theory reproduces several key features observed in the activated magneto transport in structured lms PAC numbers Ee Qt Jp Fk

Zhi yuan Liu Tsinghua University China Edward Chang HTC Research Innovation The accelerated growth of mobile trajectories in location based services brings valuable data resources to understand users moving behaviors Apart from recording the trajectory data another major characteristic of these location based services is that they also allow the users to connect whomever they like or are interested in combination of social networking and location based services is called as location based social networks LBS As shown in Cho et al locations that are frequently visited by socially related persons tend to be correlated which indicates the close association between social connections and trajectory behaviors of users in LBS Ns In order to better analyze and mine LBS data we need to have ul comprehensive view to analyze and mine the information from the two aspects the social network and mobile trajectory data Spec ic ally we present novel neural network model which can jointly model both social networks and mobile trajectories Our model consists of two components the construction of social networks and the gen ration of mobile trajectories First we adopt network embedding method for the construction of social networks networking representation can be derived for user The key of our model lies in the component of generating mobile trajectories Secondly we consider four factors that in en ce the generation process of mobile trajectories namely user visit preference in en ce of friends short term sequential contexts and long term sequential contexts To characterize the last two contexts we employ the RN and GRU models to capture the sequential relatedness in mobile trajectories at different levels short term or long term Finally the two components are tied by sharing the user network representations Experimental results on two important applications demonstrate the effectiveness of our model Especially the improvement over baselines is more Multilayer perspective for the analysis of urban transportation systems Alberto let Sandro Melon and amir Moreno Department of Theoretical Physics Universidad de Zaragoza Zaragoza Spain Institute for Bio computation and Physics of Complex Systems BIF Universidad de Zaragoza Zaragoza Spain Institute for Sci en tic Interchange IS Foundation Turin Italy alberto let gmail com amir moreno gmail com ABSTRACT Public urban mobility systems are composed by several transportation modes connected together Most studies in urban mobility and planning often ignore the multi layer nature of transportation systems considering only aggregated versions of this complex scenario In this work we present model for the representation of the transportation system of an entire city as multiplex network Using two different perspectives one in which each line is layer and one in which lines of the same transportation mode are grouped together we study the interconnected structure of different cities in Europe raging from small towns to mega cities like London and Berlin highlighting their vulnerabilities and possible improvements Finally for the city of Zaragoza in Spain we also consider data about service schedule and waiting times which allow us to create simple yet realistic model for urban mobility able to reproduce real world facts and to test for network improvements

ES SAGE OUTING IRE LESS AND BILE TDMA ET WORKS SING ECH NO LOGY Timo the os Aslan id is and Leonidas Tse pen ek as National Technical University of Athens Athens Greece aslan gr gmail com National Technical University of Athens Athens Greece lts epe nek as core lab ntu gr ABSTRACT In an era where communication has most important role in modern societies designing efficient algorithms for data transmission is of the out most importance TDMA is technology used in many communication systems such as satellite cell phone as well as other wireless or mobile networks Most cellular systems as well as some are TDMA based In order to transmit data in such systems we need to cluster them in packages To achieve faster transmission we are allowed to preempt the transmission of any packet in order to resume at later time Preemption can be used to reduce idleness of some stations Such preemption though come with reconfiguration cost in order to setup for the next transmission In this paper we propose two algorithms which yield improved transmission scheduling These two algorithms we call MGA and IMG Improved MGA We have proven an approximation ratio for MGA and ran experiments to establish that it works even better in practice In order to conclude that MGA will be very helpful tool in constructing an improved schedule for packet routing using pre emt ion with setup cost we compare its results to two other efficient algorithms designed by researchers in the past PBS and GWA To establish the efficiency of IMG we ran experiments in comparison to MGA as well as PBS and GWA IMG has proven to produce the most efficient schedule on all counts KEYWORDS Wireless mobile networks reconfiguration cost preemption scheduling

Re trotting mutual authentication to GSM using RAND hijacking Mohammed haul Alam Khan and Chris Mitchell Information Security Group Royal Holloway University of London shafi ul alam gmail com me chris mitchell net July Abstract As has been widely discussed the GSM mobile telephony system only ers unilateral authentication of the mobile phone to the network this limitation permits range of attacks While adding support for mutual authentication would be highly bene cia changing the way GSM serving networks operate is not practical This paper proposes novel mo dication to the relationship between Subscriber Identity Module SIM and its home network which allows mutual authentication without changing any of the existing mobile infrastructure including the phones the only necessary changes are to the authentication centres and the SIMs This enhancement which could be deployed piecemeal in completely transparent way not only addresses number of serious vulnerabilities in GSM but is also the rst proposal for enhancing GSM authentication that possesses such transparency properties

Preventing Malware Pandemics in Mobile Devices by Establishing Response time Bounds Stavro Niko lo poul os Iosif Pole nak is Department of Computer Science Engineering University of Ioannina GR Ioannina Greece stavro pole nak cs oi gr Abstract We study the propagation of malicious software in network of mobile devices which are moving in spec ic city area and establish time bounds for the activation of counter measure an antivirus or cleaner in order to prevent pandemic More precisely given an initial infected population mobile devices we establish upper bounds on the time needed for counter measure to take eec after infection response time in order to prevent the rest susceptible devices to get infected Thus within period of time we guarantee that not all the susceptible devices in the city get infected and the infected ones get sanitized In our work we rst propose malware propagation model along with device mobility model and then utilizing these models we develop simulator that we use to study the spread of malware in such networks Finally we provide experimental results for the pandemic prevention taken by our simulator for various response time intervals Keywords Epidemics Malicious software Mobility models Mobile devices Graphs Al go rit hms Simulation Experimentation

Sci Post Physics Submission Detecting many body mobility edge with quantum quenches Pie roNald es Elisa Ercole ssi and Tommaso Ros il de Di parti men tod iF is ica eAst ron omi adell Universit di Bologna Vi aIr ne rio Bologna Italy IN FN Se zion edi Bologna Vi aIr ne rio Bologna Italy Labor to rede Physique CNRS MR Ecole Normale Superieure de Lyon Universit de Lyon Allee Italie Lyon France Institut Universitaire de France boulevard Saint Michel Paris France tommaso ros il de ens lyon fr Abstract The many body localization MBL transition is quantum phase transition involving highly excited ei gen states of disordered quantum many body Hamiltonian which evolve from ex tended ergo dic exhibiting extensive entanglement entr opie san duct at ions to localized ex hi biting area law scaling of entanglement an duct at ions The MBL transition can be driven by the strength of disorder in given spectral range or by the energy density at ed disorder if the system possesses many body mobility edge Here we propose to explore the latter mecha is by using quantum quench spectroscopy namely via quantum quenches of variable width which prepare the state of the system in superposition of ei gen states of the Hamiltonian within controllable spectral region Studying numerically chain of interacting spin less fermions in quasi periodic potential we argue that this system has many body mobility edge and we show that its existence translates into clear dynamical transition in the time evolution immediately fol lowing quench in the strength of the quasi periodic potential as well as transition in the scaling properties of the quasi stationary state at long times Our results suggest practical scheme for the experimental observation of many body mobility edges using cold atom setups

Can mobile usage predict illiteracy in developing country Pl Sun ds Telenor Group Research Big Data Analytics nary ve ien For ebu Norway Abstract The present study provides the first evidence that illiteracy can be reliably predicted from standard mobile phone logs By deriving broad set of mobile phone indicators reflecting users financial social and mobility patterns we show how supervised machine learning can be used to predict individual illiteracy in an Asian developing country externally validated against large scale survey On average the model performs times better than random guessing with accuracy Further we show how individual illiteracy can be aggregated and mapped geographically at cell tower resolution Geographical mapping of illiteracy is crucial to know where the illiterate people are and where to put in resources In underdeveloped countries such mappings are often based on out dated household surveys with low spatial and temporal resolution One in five people worldwide struggle with illiteracy and it is estimated that illiteracy costs the global economy more than trillion dollars each year These results potentially enable cost effective questionnaire free investigation of illiteracy related questions on an unprecedented scale

What Happens After You Both Swipe Right Statistical Description of Mobile Dating Communications Jennie Zhang and Tah Yasser Oxford Internet Institute University of Oxford St Giles OX JS Oxford UK Abstract Mobile dating applications MD As have skyrocketed in popularity in the last few years with popular MD Tinder alone matching million pairs of users per day In addition to becoming an influential part of modern dating culture MD As facilitate unique form of mediated communication dyadic mobile text messages between pairs of users who are not already acquainted Furthermore mobile dating has paved the way for analysis of these digital interactions via massive sets of data generated by the instant matching and messaging functions of its many platform satan unprecedented scale This paper looks at one of these sets of data metadata of approximately two million conversations containing million messages exchanged between heterosexual users on nMDA Through computational analysis methods this study offers the very first large scale quantitative depiction of mobile dating as whole Were port on differences in how heterosexual male and female users communicate with each other on MD As differences in behaviors of dy ads of varying degrees of social separation and factors leading to success operational zed by the exchange of phone numbers between match For instance were port that men initiate of conversations and while about half of the initial messages are responded to conversations initiated by men are more likely to be reciprocated We also report that the length of conversations the waiting times and the length of messages have fat tailed distributions That said the majority of reciprocated conversations lead to phone number exchange within the first messages

Distributed Event Localization via Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers Chun lei Zhang and Yong qiang Wang Abstract This paper addresses the problem of distributed event localization using noisy range measurements with respect to sensors with known positions Event localization is fundamental in many wireless sensor network applications such as homeland security law enforcement and environmental studies However most existing distributed algorithms require the target event to be within the convex hull of the deployed sensors Based on the alternating direction method of multipliers AD MM we propose two scalable distributed algorithms named GS AD MM and AD MM which do not require the target event to be within the convex hull of the deployed sensors More spec ic ally the two algorithms can be implemented in scenario in which the entire sensor network is divided into several clusters with cluster heads collecting measurements within each cluster and exchanging intermediate computation information to achieve localization consistency consensus across all clusters This scenario is important in many applications such as homeland security and law enforcement Simulation results con rm effectiveness of the proposed algorithms Index Terms Event localization wireless sensor network distributed algorithm

BC MP Network Approach to Modeling and Controlling Autonomous Mobility on Demand Systems Ramon Iglesias Federico Rossi Rick Zhang and Marco Pavone Abstract In this paper we present queuing network approach to the problem of routing and rebalancing eet of self driving vehicles providing on demand mobil it within capac it ted road network We refer to such systems as autonomous mobility on demand systems or MoD We rst cast an MoD system into closed multi class BC MP queuing network model Second we present analysis tools that allow the characterization of performance metrics for given routing pol icy in terms of vehicle avail abilities and rst and second order moments of vehicle throughput Third we propose scalable method for the synthesis of rout ing policies with performance guarantees in the limit of large eet sizes Finally we validate the theoretical results on case study of New York City Collectively this paper provides unifying framework for the analysis and control of MoD systems which subsumes earlier Jackson and network ow models provides quite large set of modeling options the inclusion of road capacities and general travel time distributions and allows the analysis of second and higher order moments for the performance metrics

Almost mobility edges and existence of critical regions in one dimensional quasi periodic lattices Yu cheng Wang Gao Xian long and Shu Chen Beijing National Laboratory for Condensed Matter Physics Institute of Physics Chinese Academy of Sciences Beijing China Department of Physics Zhejiang Normal University in hua China School of Physical Sciences University of Chinese Academy of Sciences Beijing China Collaborative Innovation Center of Quantum Matter Beijing China We study one dimensional quasi periodic system described by the Aubry Andre model in the small wavevector limit and demonstrate the existence of almost mobility edges and critical regions in the system It is well known that the ei gen states of the Aubry And remodel are either extended or localized depending on the strength of incommensurate potential being less or bigger than ul critical valueV and thus no mobility edge exists However it was shown in recent work that this conclusion does not hold true when the wavevector of the incommensurate potential is small and for the system with Vc there exist almost mobility edges at the energy Ec which separate the robustly delocalized states from almost localized states We nd that besides Ec there exist additionally another energy edges Ec at which abrupt change of inverse participation ratio occurs By using the inverse participation ratio and carrying out multi fractal analyses we identify the existence of critical regions among Ec Ec with the almost mobility edge sEc and Ec separating the critical region from the extended and localized regions respectively We also study the system with Vc for which all ei gen states are localized states but can be divided into extended critical and localized states in their dual space by utilizing the self duality property of the Aubry And remodel PAC numbers An Ft Jk

Front hauling for LTE Ultra Dense Cloud Small Cell Networks Hai jun Zhang Member IEEE Yan jie Dong Student Member IEEE Julian Cheng Senior Member IEEE Md Jahangir Hossain Member IEEE and Victor Leung Fellow IEEE Abstract Ultra dense cloud small cell network DC Net which combines cloud computing and massive deployment of small cells is promising technology for the th generation LTE mobile communications because it can accommodate the anticipated explosive growth of mobile users data tr afc As result front hauling becomes challenging problem in LTE DC Net In this article we present an overview of the challenges and requirements of the front haul technology in LTE DC Nets We survey the advantages and challenges for various candidate front haul technologies such as optical ber millimeter wave based unlicensed spectrum Wi Fi based unlicensed spectrum sub GHz based licensed spectrum and free space optical based unlicensed spectrum Index Terms Cloud small cell networks front haul LTE millimeter wave ultra dense network unlicensed spectrum Hai jun Zhang is with the Engineering and Technology Research Center for Convergence Networks University of Science and Technology Beijing Beijing China and also with The State Key Laboratory of Integrated Services Networks Xi dian University mail dr hai jun zhang ieee org Yan jie Dong Julian Cheng and Md Jahangir Hossain are with the School of Engineering The University of British Columbia Kelowna BC Canada mail yan jie dong alumni bc ca julian cheng bc ca jahangir hossain bc ca Victor Leung is with the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering The University of British Columbia Vancouver BC Canada mail leung ece bc ca July DRAFT

Mapping mobility patterns to public spaces in medium sized city using geo located tweets Mara He nar Sal as Olm edo Depart men to de Geo graf Human Fa cult ad de Geo graf Historia Universidad Complutense Madrid Calle Profesor Aran gur en Ciudad Universit aria Madrid Spain Email msa las cm es Carolina Rojas Quezada Depart men to de Geo graf Fa cult ad de Ar quite tura Urbanism Geo graf Universidad de Concepci Centro de De sar rollo Urban Sus ten table CEDE US Calle Victoria Barrio Universitario Concepci Reg in del Bobo Chile Email rojas dec cl Keywords mobility public space big data Twitter medium sized city Chile Abstract This research evidences the usefulness of open big data to map mobility patterns in medium sized city Motivated by the novel analysis that big data allow worldwide and in large metropolitan areas we developed methodology aiming to complement origin destination surveys with la carte spatial boundaries and updated data at minimum cost This paper validates the use of Twitter data to map the impact of public spaces on the different parts of the metropolitan area of Concepci Chile Results have been validated by local experts and evidence the main mobility patterns towards spaces of social interaction like malls leisure areas parks and so on The map represents the mobility patterns from census districts to different categories of public spaces with schematic lines at the metropolitan scale and it is centred in the city of Concepci Chile and its surroundings kilometres

Temporal Correlation of Interference and Outage in Mobile Networks over One Dimensional Finite Regions Konstantino Ko ufos and Carl De tt mann Abstract In practice wireless networks are deployed over nite domains the level of mobility is different at different locations and user mobility is correlated overtime All these features have an impact on the temporal properties of interference which is often neglected In this paper we show how to incorporate correlated user mobility into the interference and outage correlation models We use the random waypoint mobility model over abounded one dimensional domain as an example model inducing correlation and we calculate its displacement law at different locations Based on that we illustrate that the temporal correlations of interference and outage are location dependent being lower close to the centre of the domain where the level of mobility is higher than near the boundary Close to the boundary more time is also needed to see uncorrelated interference Our dings suggest that an accurate description of the mobility pattern is important because it leads to more accurate understanding modeling of interference and receiver performance Index Terms Correlation Interference Mobility Stochastic geometry Wireless networks

Multi View Product Image Search Using Deep Con Nets Representations Mu ham met Bast an Oz gur Yl maz Abstract Multi view product image queries can improve retrieval performance over single view queries sign cant ly In this paper we investigated the per for man ce of deep convolutional neural networks Con Nets on multi view product image search First we trained VG like network to learn deep Con Nets rep resent at ions of product images Then we computed the deep Con Nets re pre sent at ions of database and query images and performed single view queries and multi view queries using several early and late fusion approaches We performed extensive experiments on the publicly available Multi View Ob ect Image Data set MV OD with both clean background queries from the Internet and cluttered background queries from mobile phone We compared the performance of Con Nets to the classical bag of visual words BoWs We con clude that multi view queries with deep Con Nets representations perform sign cant ly better than single view queries Con Nets perform much better than BoWs and have room for further improvement pre training of Con Nets on die rent image data set with background clutter is needed to obtain good performance on cluttered product image queries obtained with mobile phone

Accurate and Efficient Measurements of IP Level Performance to Drive Interface Selection in Heterogeneous Wireless Networks Salsa no Patria rca Lo Pre sti Ventre Gentile Abstract Optimal interface selection is key mobility management issue in heterogeneous wireless networks Measuring the physical or link level performance on given wireless access networks does not provide reliable indication of the IP connectivity delay and loss on the bidirectional paths from the Mobile Host to the node that is handling the mobility over different heterogeneous networks In this paper we propose implement and analyze mechanisms for connectivity check and performance network delay and packet loss monitoring over IP access networks We evaluate the accuracy and timeliness of the performance estimates and provide guidelines for tuning up the parameters From the implementation perspective we show that using application level measurements is highly CPU intensive while kernel based implementation has comparably very low CPU usage The Linux kernel implementation results in an efficient use of batteries in Mobile Hosts and intermediate Mobility Management Nodes can scale up to monitoring thousands of flows The proposed solutions have been implemented in the context of specific mobility management solution but the results are of general applicability The Linux implementation is available as Open Source Index Terms Network monitoring wireless networking mobility management vertical handover January Accepted for publication in IEEE Transaction on Mobile Computing should the network flows be handed over that wireless access

Dynamic Network Surgery for Efc ent DN Ns Yi wen Guo An bang Yao Yu rong Chen Intel Labs China Intel Labs China Intel Labs China yi wen guo intel com an bang yao intel com yu rong chen intel com Abstract Deep learning has become ubiquitous technology to improve machine intelligence However most of the existing deep models are structurally very complex making them if cult to be deployed on the mobile platforms with limited computational power In this paper we propose novel network compression method called dynamic network surgery which can remarkably reduce the network complexity by making on the connection pruning Unlike the previous methods which accomplish this task in greedy way we properly incorporate connection splicing into the whole process to avoid incorrect pruning and make it as continual network maintenance The effectiveness of our method is proved with experiments Without any accuracy loss our method cane fci ent ly compress the number of parameters in Le Net and Alex Net by factor of and respectively proving that it outperforms the recent pruning method by considerable margins Code and some models are available at https it hub com yi wen guo Dynamic Network Surgery

DE BH Detecting and Eliminating Black Holes in Mobile Ad Hoc Network Ali Dor ri So roush Vase hi Omid Ghar ib Department of Computer Department of Computer Department of Computer Engineering Science Faculty of Engineering Engineering Mashhad Branch Islamic Azad University of Bo nord Mashhad Branch Islamic Azad University Mashhad IRAN Bo nord Iran University Mashhad IRAN lid or ri ce gmail com So rou ush gmail com omid ghar ib gmail com Abstract Security in Mobile Ad hoc Network MANET is one of the key challenges due to its special features hop by hop communications dynamic topology and open network boundary that received tremendous attention by scholars Traditional security methods are not applicable in MANET due to its special properties In this paper novel approach called Detecting and Eliminating Black Holes DE BH is proposed that uses data control packet and an additional Black hole Check BCh table for detecting and eliminating malicious nodes Benefiting from trust able nodes the processing overhead of the security method decreases by passing time Ad hoc On demand Distance Vector AO DV routing protocol is used as the routing protocol in our design After finding the freshest path using AO DV our design checks the safety of selected path In case of detecting any malicious node it is isolated from the entire network by broadcasting packet that contains the ID of malicious nodes Simulation results show that DE BH increases network throughput and decreases packet overhead and delay in comparison with other studied approaches Moreover DE BH is able to detect all active malicious nodes which generates fault routing information Keywords Black hole Attack Malicious Node Routing Attack Security Challenges

Optimizing Content Caching to Maximize the Density of Successful Receptions in Device to Device Networking De rya Malak Maz in Al Sha lash and Jeffrey Andrews Abstract Device to device communication is promising approach to optimize the utilization of air interface resources in networks since it allows decentralized opportunistic short range communication For to be useful mobile nodes must possess content that other mobiles want Thus intelligent caching techniques are essential forD In this paper we use results from stochastic geometry to derive the probability of successful content delivery in the presence of interference and noise We employ general transmission strategy where multiple les are cached at the users and different les can be transmitted simultaneously throughout the network We then formulate an optimization problem and nd the caching distribution that maximizes the density of successful receptions SR under simple transmission strategy where single le is transmitted at time throughout the network We model le requests by Zipf distribution with exponent which results in an optimal caching distribution that is also Zipf distribution with exponent which is related to through simple expression involving the path loss exponent We solve the optimal content placement problem for more general demand roles under Rayleigh Rice an and Na kagami small scale fading distributions Our results suggest that it is required to at ten the request distribution to optimize the caching performance We also develop strategies to optimize content caching for the more general case with multiple les and bound the SR for that scenario Parts of the manuscript were presented at the IEEE Globe com Workshops and at the IEEE ICC Workshops Malak and Andrews are with the Wireless and Networking Communications Group NCG The University of Texas at Austin Austin TX USA email de rya malak texas edu andrews ece texas edu Al halas his with Hua wei Technologies Plano TX USA Non stochastic Learning Approach to Energy Efc ent Mobility Management Cong Shen Senior Member IEEE Cem Tek in Member IEEE and Mi hae la van der Sch aar Fellow IEEE Abstract Energy efc ent mobility management is an important problem in modern wireless networks with he ero gene us cell sizes and increased nodes densities We show that optimization based mobility protocols cannot achieve long term optimal energy consumption particularly for ultra dense networks UD To address the complex dynamics of UD we propose an on stochastic online learning approach which does not make any assumption on the statistical behavior of the small base station SBS activities In addition we introduce handover cost to the overall energy consumption which forces the resulting solution to explicitly minimize frequent handover The proposed Batched Random iz ation with Exponential Weighting BREW algorithm relies on batching to explore in bulk and hence reduces unnecessary handover We prove that the regret of BREW is sub linear in time thus guaranteeing its convergence to the optimal SBS selection We further study the robustness of the BREW algorithm to delayed or missing feedback Moreover we study the setting where SBS can be dynamically turned on and off We prove that sub linear regret is impossible with respect to arbitrary SBS on off and then develop novel learning strategy called ranking expert RE that simultaneously takes into account the handover cost and the availability of SBS To address the high complexity of RE we propose contextual ranking expert RE algorithm that only assigns experts in given context Rigorous regret bounds are proved for both RE and RE with respect to the best expert Simulations show that not only do the proposed mobility algorithms greatly reduce the system energy consumption but they are also robust to various dynamics which are common in practical ultra dense wireless networks Shen is with the Department of Electronic Engineering and Information Science University of Science and Technology of China mail cong shen us tc edu cn Tek in is with the Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering Bil kent University Ankara Turkey mail cem tek Velocity Aware Handover Management in Two Tier Cellular Networks Rabe Arshad He sham ElSa wy Same or our are Al Naf four and Mohamed Slim lou in Abstract While network dens cation is considered an important solution to cater the ever increasing capacity demand its effect on the handover HO rate is overlooked In dense networks HO delays may neutralize or even negate the gains offered by network dens cation Hence user mobility imposes nontrivial challenge to harvest capacity gains via network dens cation In this paper we propose velocity aware HO management scheme for two tier down link cellular network to mitigate the HO effect on the foreseen dens cation throughput gains The proposed HO scheme sac rices the best BS connectivity by skipping HO to some BS along the users trajectory to maintain longer connection durations and reduce HO rates Furthermore the proposed scheme enables cooperative BS service and strongest interference cancellation to compensate for skipping the best connectivity To this end we consider different HO skipping scenarios and develop velocity aware mathematical model via stochastic geometry to quantify the performance of the proposed HO scheme in terms of the coverage probability and user throughput The results highlight the HO rate problem in dense cellular environments and show the importance of the proposed HO schemes Finally the value of BS cooperation along with handover skipping is quan tied for different user mobility roles Index Terms Multi tier Dense Cellular Networks Handover Management Stochastic Geometry CoMP Through put Rabe International Journal of Wireless Mobile Networks JWM Vol No August UT TING DOWN ENERGY USAGE IN WIRELESS SENSOR NETWORKS USING TY CLE TECHNIQUE AND MULTI HOP ROUTING Ali Se dig him an es Mohammad Se dig him an es and Java aq eri Department of Electrical Computer and It Engineering Islamic Azad University of Qazvin Abstract wireless sensor network is composed of many sensor nodes that have been given out in specific zone and each of them had an ability of collecting information from the environment and sending collected data to the sink The most significant issues in wireless sensor networks despite the recent progress is the trouble of the severe limitations of energy resources Since that in different applications of sensor nets we could throw static or mobile sink then all aspects of such networks should be planned with an awareness of energy One of the most significant topics related to these networks is routing One of the most widely used and efficient methods of routing is hierarchy based on clustering method In The present study with the objective of cutting down energy consumption and persistence of network coverage we have offered novel algorithm based on clustering algorithms and multi hop routing To achieve this goal first we layer the network environment based on the size of the network We will identify the optimal number of cluster heads and every cluster head based on the mechanism of topology control will start to accept members Likewise we set the first layer as gate layer and subsequently identifying the gates nodes wed turn away half of the sensors and then stop using energy and the remaining nodes in this layer will join the gates nodes because they hold critical part in bettering the functioning of the system Cluster heads off following layers send the information to cluster heads in the above layer until sent data will be sent to gates nodes and finally will be sent to sink We have tested the proposed algorithm in two situations when the sink is off and when sink is on and simulation data shows that proposed algorithm has better performance in terms of the life span of network than LEACH and EL EACH protocols Keywords Wireless sensor networks Lifetime Hierarchical clustering Hierarchical Routing Cluster Topology DOI jwm

Correlation between social proximity and mobility similarity Chao Fan Yi ding Liu Jun ming Huang Zhi hai Rong Tao Zhou CompleX Lab Web Sciences Center University of Electronic Science and Technology of China Chengdu China College of Arts and Sciences Shanxi Agricultural University Tai gu China Center for Complex Network Research Department of Physics Northeastern University Boston MA USA Big Data Research Center University of Electronic Science and Technology of China Chengdu China mail mail jun ming huang com Human behaviors exhibit ubiquitous correlations in many aspects such as individual and collective levels temporal and spatial dimensions content social and geographical layers With rich Internet data of online behaviors becoming available it attracts academic interests to explore human mobility similarity from the perspective of social network proximity Existent analysis shows strong correlation between online social proximity and of in mobility similar it namely mobile records between friends are sign cant ly more similar than between strangers and those between friends with common neighbors are even more similar We argue the importance of the number and diversity of com mon friends with counter intuit vending that the number of common friends has no positive impact on mobility similarity while the diversity plays key role disagreeing with previous studies Our analysis provides novel view for better understanding the coupling between human online and of in behaviors and will help model and predict human behaviors based on social proximity

International Journal of Wireless Mobile Networks JWM Vol No August CREASING IRE LESS ENS OR ET WORKS IF TIME WITH EW ET HOD Mohammad Se dig him an es Java aq eri and Ali Se dig him an es Department of Electrical Computer and It Engineering Islamic Azad University of Qazvin Qom Iran Abstract One of the most important issues in Wireless Sensor Networks SNs is severe energy restrictions As the performance of Sensor Networks is strongly dependence to the network lifetime researchers seek way to use node energy supply effectively and increasing network lifetime As consequence it is crucial to use routing algorithms result in decrease energy consumption and better bandwidth utilization The purpose of this paper is to increase Wireless Sensor Networks lifetime using LEACH algorithm So before clustering Network environment it is divided into two virtual layers using distance between sensor nodes and base station and then regarding to sensors position in each of two layers residual energy of sensor and distance from base station is used in clustering In this article we compare proposed algorithm with well known LEACH and EL EACH algorithms in homogenous environment with equal energy for all sensors and heterogeneous one energy of half of sensors get doubled also for static and dynamic situation of base station Results show that our proposed algorithm delivers improved performance Keywords Wireless Sensor Networks SNs Routing protocols Clustering in Wireless Sensor Networks

Evidence for Conserved Quantity in Human Mobility Laura less andretti Piotr Sapi ez yn ski Vedra Sek arab Sun Lehmann and Andrea Baron chell City University of London London EC HB United Kingdom Technical University of Denmark DK Kgs Lyngby Denmark Niels Bohr Institute University of Copenhagen DK Kbe nh avn Denmark Sony Mobile Communications Mobil agen Lund Sweden Corresponding authors sun lehmann gmail com Andrea Baron chell city ac uk Recent seminal works on human mobility have shown that individuals constantly exploit small set of repeatedly visited locations concurrent literature has emphasized the exp lor at ive nature of human behavior showing that the number of visited places grows steadily overtime How to reconcile these seemingly contradicting facts remains an open question Here we analyze high resolution multi year traces of individuals from datasets and show that this tension vanishes when the long term evolution of mobility patterns is considered We reveal that mobility patterns evolve sign cant ly yet smoothly and that the number of familiar locations an individual visits at any point is conserved quantity with typical size of locations We use this ding to improve state of the art modeling of human mobility Furthermore shifting the attention from aggregated quantities to individual behavior we show that the size of an individuals set of preferred locations correlates with the number of her social interactions This result suggests connection between the conserved quantity we identify which as we show can not be understood purely on the basis of time constraints and the Dunbar number describing cognitive upper limit to an individuals number of social relations We anticipate that our work will spark further research linking the study of Human Mobility and the Cognitive and Behavioral Sciences There is disagreement between the current sci en tic understanding of human mobility as highly predictable and stable over time and the fact that individual lives are constantly evolving due to changing needs and circumstances The role of cultural social and legal constraints on the space time xi ty of daily activities has long been recognized Recent studies based on the analysis of human digital traces including mobile phone records online location based social networks and Global Positioning System GPS location data of vehicles have shown that individuals universally exhibit markedly regular pattern characterized by few locations or points of interest where

On Demand Routing Algorithm with Mobility Prediction in the Mobile Ad hoc Networks Trung Ki en Vu Sung oh Kwon School of Electrical Engineering University of Ulsan Ulsan Korea Abstract In this paper we propose an ad hoc on demand distance vector routing algorithm for mobile ad hoc networks taking into account node mobility Changeable topology of such mobile ad hoc networks provokes overhead messages in order to search available routes and maintain found routes The overhead messages impede data delivery from sources to destination and deteriorate network performance To overcome such challenge our proposed algorithm estimates link duration based neighboring node mobility and chooses the most reliable route The proposed algorithm also applies the estimate for route maintenance to lessen the number of overhead messages Via simulations the proposed algorithm is ve ried in various mobile environments In the low mobility environment by reducing route maintenance messages the proposed algorithm sign cant ly improves network performance such as packet data rate and end to end delay In the high mobility environment the reduction of route discovery message enhances network performance since the proposed algorithm provides more reliable routes Keywords Mobility Prediction Longest and Stable Route Link Duration Probability End to End Delay Low Latency

Novel Collaborative Cognitive Dynamic Network Architecture Be atri Lorenzo Javier Gonzalez Casta no Yu guang Fang Abstract Increasing mobile data demands in current cellular networks and proliferation of advanced handheld devices have given rise to new generation of dynamic network architectures DNA In DNA users share their connect iv ties and act as access points providing Internet connections for others without additional network infrastructure cost large number of users and their dynamic connections make DNA highly adaptive to variations in the network and suitable for low cost ubiquitous Internet connectivity In this article we propose novel collaborative cognitive dynamic network architecture DNA which incorporates cognitive capabilities to exploit under utilized spectrum in more flexible and intelligent way The design principles of DNA are perfectly aligned to the functionality requirements of future wireless networks such as energy and spectrum efficiency cal ability dynamic re config ur ability support for multi hop communications infrastructure sharing and multi operator cooperation case study with new resource allocation problem enabled by DNA is conducted using matching theory with pricing to illustrate the potential benefits of DNA for users and operators tackle user associations for data and spectrum trading with low complexity and enable self organizing capabilities Finally possible challenges and future research directions are given Keywords Future network architecture cognitive radio network re config ur ability matching theory data and spectrum trading Qo

hot Recharge and the hot Internet Studying the Indian mobile Internet networks Siddha rth Rao and iran Kumar Abstract Uniform and affordable Internet is emerging as one of the fundamental civil rights in developing countries However in India the connectivity is far from uniform across the regions where the disparity is evident in the infrastructure the cost of access and telecommunication services to provide Internet facilities among different economic classes In spite of having large mobile user base the mobile Internet are still remarkably slower in some of the developing countries Especially in India it falls below even in comparison with the performance of its developing counterparts This essay presents study of connectivity and performance trends based on an exploratory analysis of mobile Internet measurement data from India In order to assess the state of mobile networks and its readiness in adopting the different mobile standards and for commercial use we discuss the spread penetration interoperability and the congestion trends Based on our analysis we argue that the network operators have taken negligible measures to scale the mobile Internet Affordable Internet is definitely for everyone But the afford ability of the Internet in terms of cost does not necessarily imply the rightful access to Internet services hot recharge is possibly leading us to hot shrunken Internet Keywords Mobile Internet Measurements Performance Exploratory data analysis

IEEE Privacy preserving schemes for Ad Hoc Social Networks survey Mohamed Amine Fer rag Leandro Mag lar as Senior Member IEEE and Ahmed Ah mim Abstract In this paper we review the state of the art of privacy preserving schemes for ad hoc social networks including mobile social networks MSN and vehicular social networks SNs Spec ic ally we select and in detail examine thirty three privacy preserving schemes developed for or applied in the context of ad hoc social networks These schemes are published between and Based on this existing privacy preservation schemes we survey privacy preservation models including location privacy identity privacy anonymity trace ability interest privacy backward privacy and content oriented privacy The recent important attacks of leaking privacy countermeasures and game theoretic approaches in SNs and MSN are summarized in form of tables In addition an overview of recommendations for further research is also provided With this survey readers can have more thorough understanding of research trends in privacy preserving schemes for ad hoc social networks Index Terms Security Privacy preservation Ad hoc social network Mobile social network Vehicular social network

Choice Rank Identifying Preferences from Node Tra in Networks Lucas May tre Matthias Gross gla user lucas may tre ep fl ch matthias gross gla user ep fl ch June Abstract Understanding how users navigate in network is of high interest in many applications We consider setting where only aggregate node level tra is observed and tackle the task of learning edge transition probabilities We cast it as preference learning problem and we study model where choices follow Luce axiom In this case the marginal counts of node visits are uci ent statistic for the transition probabilities We show how to make the inference problem well posed regardless of the networks structure and we present Choice Rank an iterative algorithm that scales to networks that contains billions of nodes and edges We apply the model to two click stream datasets and show that it successfully recovers the transition probabilities using only the network structure and marginal node level tra data Finally we also consider an application to mobility networks and apply the model to one year of rides on New York City bicycle sharing system

JOURNAL OF LATEX CLASS FILES VOL NO SEPTEMBER Deep Space An Online Deep Learning Framework for Mobile Big Data to Understand Human Mobility Patterns Xi Ou yang Student Member IEEE Chao yun Zhang Student Member IEEE Pan Zhou Member IEEE and Hao Jiang Member IEEE Abstract In the recent years the rapid spread of mobile device has create the vast amount of mobile data However some shallow structure algorithms such as support vector machine SV has if cult dealing with high dimensional data with the development of mobile network In this paper we analyze the mobile big data to predict human trajectories in order to understand human mobility pattern via deep structure model called Deep Space To the best of out knowledge it is the rst time that the deep learning approach is applied to predict human trajectories Furthermore we develop the vanilla convolutional neural network CNN to bean online learning system which can deal with the continuous mobile data stream Meanwhile Deep Space consists of two different prediction models corresponding to different scales in space the coarse prediction model and ne prediction models The two prediction models constitute our model hierarchically so our model can run in parr el Finally we test our model using the data usage detail records DR from the mobile cellular network in city of southeastern China rather the call detail records CDR widely used by others as usual The experiment results show that Deep Space is promising in human trajectories prediction Index Terms Mobile big data deep learning CNN online learning spatial data cid

Anchor Free IP Mobility Mohammed Al Khalid Nikolaos homos Martin Reed May AL Na day and Dirk Tros sen Abstract Efc ent mobility management techniques are critical in providing seamless connectivity and session continuity between mobile node and the network during its movement Current mobility management solutions generally require central entity in the network core tracking IP address movement and anchoring tr afc from source to destination through point to point tunnels Intuitively this approach suffers from cal ability limitations as it creates bottlenecks in the network due to sub optimal routing via the anchor point Meanwhile alternative anchor less solutions are not feasible due to the current limitations of the IP semantics which strongly ties addressing information to location In contrast novel path based forwarding solutions maybe exploited for feasible anchor less solutions In this paper we propose novel network based mobility management solution that facilitates IP mobility over such path based forwarding substrate Our solution exploits the advantages of such substrates in decoupling path calculation from data transfer to eliminate the need for anchoring tr afc through the network core there by allowing ex ble path calculation and service provisioning Furthermore by eliminating the limitation of routing via the anchor point our approach reduces the network cost compared to anchored solution through bandwidth saving while maintaining comparable handover delay We evaluate our solution through analytical and simulation models and compare it with the IETF standardized solution Proxy Mobile IPv PM IPv Evaluation results illustrate sign cant saving in the total network cost when using our proposed solution compared to its counterpart Index Terms IP over CN Mobile IP Proxy IPv LTE GPRS Handover cid

Resource Management in Non orthogonal Multiple Access Networks for and Beyond Li ngyang Song Yong hui Li Zhi guo Ding and Vincent Poor School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science Peking University China School of Electrical and Information Engineering The University of Sydney Australia School of Computing and Communications Lancaster University UK Department of Electrical Engineering Princeton University Princeton US Abstract Non orthogonal multiple access NOMA techniques have been recently proposed for the small cell networks in to improve access efc ien cy by allowing many users to share the same spectrum in non orthogonal way Due to the strong co channel interference among mobile users introduced by NOMA it poses sign cant challenges for system design and resource management This article reviews resource management issues in NOMA systems The main taxonomy of NOMA is presented by focusing on the following categories of resources reuse power domain and code domain NOMA Then novel radio resource management framework is presented based on game theoretic models for uplink and down link transmissions Finally potential applications and open research directions in the area of resource management for NOMA are provided

Context Awareness in Next Generation of Mobile Core Networks Clarissa Cas sales Marque zan Hua wei Technologies Kash if Mahmood Telenor Dirk Tros sen Inter digital Anastasio Za fei ro poul os bite ch Ren an Krishna Inter digital Xiao feng Huang Orange Xue li An Hua wei Technologies Daniel Coru jo IT Ave ro Filipe Lei to NEC Laboratories Maria Lem Rosa Tok tam Mahmood King's College London Hans in si edler Deutsche Telecom Abstract Context awareness is an important enable for next generation of Mobile Core Networks MC However there exist number of challenges in this regard For example how to develop framework which is able to generate context richer than what is available today allows re usability of context across the network provides mechanism for exposing context to third parties and can bring together big data for mobile core network optimization In this work we introduce context awareness framework addressing the aforementioned challenges but also taking into account the GP standardization activities related to context awareness in MC Within this framework we propose Context Generation and Handling Function CG HF which generates rich context by processing information from various sources and then handles its distribution through an efficient publish subscribe mechanism In addition we provide examples where context can be used to optimize control plane decision making While the focus of this work is on the use of context for MC we still believe such context can be also used by applications at the edge as well as in data centers and third party services to improve their operations and providing new unforeseen services

Full Duplex IMO Small Cell Networks with Interference Cancellation Italo tzen Member IEEE and Mario Kou tour is Senior Member IEEE Abstract Full duplex FD technology is envisaged as key component for future mobile broadband networks due to its ability to boost the spectral efc ien cy FD systems can transmit and receive simultaneously on the same frequency at the expense of residual self interference SI and additional interference to the network compared with half duplex HD transmission This paper analyzes the performance of wireless networks with FD multi antenna base stations BS and HD user equipments Es using stochastic geometry Our analytical results quantify the success probability and the achievable spectral efc ien cy and indicate the amount of SI cancellation needed for bene cia FD operation The advantages of multi antenna BS Es are shown and the performance gains achieved by balancing desired signal power increase and interference cancellation are derived The proposed framework aims at shedding light on the system level gains of FD mode with respect to HD mode in terms of network throughput and provides design guidelines for the practical implementation of FD technology in large small cell networks Index Terms Full duplex interference cancellation multiple antennas performance analysis small cells stochastic geometry ultra dense networks

Proactive Qo Provisioning in Heterogeneous Access Networks using Hidden Markov Models and Reinforcement Learning Karan Mitra Christ er lund Arkady Za slav sky and gun Abstract Quality of Experience Qo provisioning in heterogeneous access networks HANs can be achieved via hand offs The current approaches for Qo aware hand offs either lack the availability of network path probing method or lack the availability of efc ent methods for Qo prediction Further the current approaches do not explore the be nets of proactive Qo aware hand offs such that users Qo is maximized by learning from past network conditions and by actions taken by the mobile device regarding hand offs In this paper our con tri but ions are two fold First we propose develop and validate novel method for Qo prediction based on passive probing Our method is based on hidden Markov models and Multi homed Mobility Management Protocol which eli mi nate the need for additional probe packets for Qo prediction It achieves the average Qo prediction accuracy of Second we propose develop and validate novel reinforcement learning based method for proactive Qo aware hand offs We show that our method outperforms existing approaches by re duc ing the number of vertical hand offs by while maintaining high Qo levels and by extending crucial functionality such as passive probing mecha isms Keywords hand off hidden Markov models multi homing probing Reinforcement Learning Quality of Experience Mitra Corresponding author is with Lu le University of Technology LTU Sweden lund is with LTU Sweden Za slav sky is with CSIRO Australia gun is with LTU Sweden

International Journal of Wireless Mobile Networks JWM Vol No December DN PP ROACH OR NE RGY FF ICI ENT ET ERO GENE US OM MUNI CATION ET WORK IS ASTER CENA RIOS To an Nguyen Duc and Eiji Kami oka Graduate School of Engineering and Science Shiba ura Institute of Technology ABSTRACT Wireless access technologies have been extensively developed aiming to give users the ability to connect to their expected networks anytime anywhere This leads to an increment of the number of wireless interfaces integrated into single mobile device hence it allows the device to be able to connect to multiple access networks However in some specific cases such as natural disasters having an uncorrupted and timely information exchanging means is critical for affected victims to survive or to connect to the outside world This is because the essential network infrastructures in these cases could be destroyed causing large number of systems to stop working In that cases the victims need heterogeneous communications network in which they can communicate without doubt by using different wireless access technologies Bluetooth or Wi Fi The network must also be able to smoothly change the access technologies or called vertical handover to ensure Qo for ongoing applications In addition the network must have mechanism to save energy For these reasons an DN approach which has been proposed in previous work is considered The performance of the system has been validated by set of experiments in real test bed The obtained results show that the proposed vertical handover can save at least per cent of the energy consumed by the wireless communication The handover delay with different UDP traffic is less than ms Moreover the network allows device using Bluetooth to talk with another one using Wi Fi over heterogeneous connection where the end to end it ter is mainly below ms and the packet loss rate is as small as per cent KEYWORDS Energy efficient Vertical handover Heterogeneous communications network Bluetooth Wi Fi Extended DN controller Disaster

gris on line Papers in Economics and Informatics Volume VIII Number Measurement and Analysis of Quality of Service of Mobile Networks in Afghanistan End User Perspective Habib Ulm an Van Pav lk Faculty of Economics and Management Czech University of Life Sciences Prague Czech Republic Abstract Enhanced Quality of Service Qo and satisfaction of mobile phone user are major concerns of service provider In order to manage network efficiently and to provide enhanced end to end Quality of Experience Qo operator is expected to measure and analyze Qo from various perspectives and at different relevant points of network The scope of this paper is measurement and statistically analysis of Qo of mobile networks from end user perspective in Afghanistan The study is based on primary data collected on random basis from mobile phone users of five cellular operators The paper furthermore proposes adequate technical solutions to mobile operators in order to address existing challenges in the area of Qo and to remain competitive in the market Based on the result of processed data considering geographical locations population and telecom regulations of the government authors recommend deployment of small cells SC increasing number of regular performance tests optimal placement of base stations increasing number of carriers and high order sectorization as proposed technical solutions Keywords Quality of service quality of experience quality of service parameters mobile network end user data measurement statistical analysis Afghanistan Habib Ulm an Van and Pav lk Measurement and Analysis of Quality of Service of Mobile Networks in Afghanistan End User Perspective GRIS on line Papers in Economics and Informatics Vol No pp ISSN DOI aol

Identifying Key Cyber Physical Terrain Extended Version Brian Thompson The MITRE Corporation Army Research Lab Col shire Dr McLean VA thompson mitre org Richard Hara ng In vince Inc Army Research Lab University Dr Fairfax VA rich hara ng gmail com Tuesday th November Abstract The high mobility of Army tactical networks combined with their close proximity to hostile actors elevates the risks associated with short range network attacks The connectivity model for such short range connections under active operations is extremely id and highly dependent upon the physical space within which the element is operating as well as the patterns of movement within that space To handle these dependencies we introduce the notion of key cyber physical terrain locations within an area of operations that allow for effective control over the spread of proximity dependent malware in mobile tactical network even as the elements of that network are in constant motion with an unpredictable pattern of node to node connectivity We provide an analysis of movement models and approximation strategies for ding such critical nodes and demonstrate via simulation that we can identify such key cyber physical terrain quickly and effectively

Energy Efc ent Mobility Management in Dense Small Cells with Mobile Edge Computing Jie Xu Yu xuan Sun Li xing Chen Sheng Zhou Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering University of Miami USA Department of Electronic Engineering Tsinghua University China Abstract Merging mobile edge computing with the dense deployment of small cell base stations promises enormous be nets such as real proximity ultra low latency access to cloud functionalities However the envisioned integration creates many new challenges and one of the most sign cant is mobility management which is becoming key bottleneck to the overall system performance Simply applying existing solutions leads to poor performance due to the highly overlapped coverage areas of multiple base stations in the proximity of the user and the co provisioning of radio access and computing services In this paper we develop novel user centric mobility management scheme leveraging Lyapunov opt miz ation and multi armed bandits theories in order to maximize the edge computation performance for the user while keeping the users communication energy consumption below constraint The proposed scheme effectively handles the uncertainties present at multiple levels in the system and provides both short term and long term performance guarantee Simulation results show that our proposed scheme can sign cant ly improve the computation performance compared to state of the art while satisfying the communication energy constraint

Energy Efc ent Mobile Edge Computing in Dense Cellular Networks Li xing Chen Sheng Zhou Jie Xu Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering University of Miami USA Department of Electronic Engineering Tsinghua University China Abstract Merging Mobile Edge Computing ME which is an emerging paradigm to meet the increasing computation demands from mobile devices with the dense deployment of Base Stations BS is foreseen as key step towards the next generation mobile networks However new challenges arise for designing energy efc ent networks since radio access resources and computing resources of BS have to be jointly managed and yet they are complex ly coupled with tr afc in both spatial and temporal domains In this paper we address the challenge of incorporating ME into dense cellular networks and propose an efc ent online algorithm called ENGINE ENErgy constrained of dINg and slEeping which makes joint computation of ding and BS sleeping decisions in order to maximize the quality of service while keeping the energy consumption low Our algorithm leverages Lyapunov optimization technique works online and achieves close to optimal performance without using future information Our simulation results show that our algorithm can effectively reduce energy consumption without sacr icing the user quality of service

How to Cache in Mobile Hybrid oT Networks Trung An Do Sang Woon Jeon Member IEEE and Won Yong Shin Senior Member IEEE Abstract Content centric mobile hybrid Internet of Things oT networks consisting of mobile devices and static fem to access points FAPs are studied where each device moves according to the random walk mobility model and requests content object from the library independently at random according to Zipf popularity distribution Instead of allowing access to content objects at macro base stations via costly back haul providing connection to the core network we consider more practical scenario where mobile devices and static FAPs each having nite size cache space are able to cache subset of content objects so that each request is served by other mobile devices or static FAPs Under general multi hop based content delivery protocol we analyze the order optimal throughput delay trade off by presenting new cache allocation strategy In particular under given caching strategy we rst characterize throughput delay trade off in terms of scaling laws along with the general content delivery multi hop routing protocol Then the order optimal throughput delay trade off is characterized by presenting the order optimal cache allocation strategy which jointly nds the replication sets at mobile devices and static FAPs via novel variable decoupling approach In our mobile oT network an interesting observation is that highly popular content objects are mainly served by mobile devices while the rest of content objects are served by static FAPs We perform numerical evaluation to validate our analytical results We also show that the order optimal strategy strictly outperforms baseline approach where the replication sets at mobile devices and static FAPs are optimized separately Index Terms Caching content centric network mobile oT network throughput delay trade off variable decoupling

Sensing and Modeling Human Behavior Using Social Media and Mobile Data Abhi nav Meh rot ra and Mir coM soles University College London and The Alan Turing Institute Abstract In the past years we have witnessed the emergence of the new discipline of computational social science which promotes new data driven and computation based approach to social sciences In this article wed is cus show the availability of new technologies such as online social media and mobile smartphones has allowed researchers to passively collect human behavioral data at scale and level of granularity that were just un think able some years ago We also discuss how these digital traces can then be used to prove or disprove existing theories and develop new models of human behavior Keywords human behavior mobile sensing social media computational social science social physics digital traces mobility models anticipatory mobile computing mental health monitoring smartphones

Understanding the Spatial and Temporal Activity Patterns of Subway Mobility Flows Zh an wei Du Bo Yang and Jim ing Liu Department of Computer Science HongKong Baptist University Kowloon Tong KL HongKong School of Computer Science and Technology Jilin University Changchun China jim ing comp hk bu edu hk ABSTRACT In urban transportation systems mobility ow in the subway system re ect the spatial and temporal dynamics of working days To investigate the variability of mobility ow we analyse the spatial community through series of snapshots of subway stations over sequential periods Using Shanghai as case study we nd that the spatial community snapshots reveal dynamic passenger activities Adopting dual perspective we apply spatial and temporal models separately to explore where and when individuals travel for entertainment In the two models micro blog topics and spatial facilities such as food venues and entertainment businesses are used to characterise the spatial popularity of each station and peoples travelling perceptions In the studied case the city centre is characterised by greater social in en ce and it is better described by the spatial model In the temporal model shorter travel distances motivate individuals to start their trips earlier Interestingly as the number of food related facilities near the starting station increases until it exceeds the speed of peoples journeys slows down This study provides method for modelling the effects of social features on mobility ow and for predicting the spatial temporal mobility ow of newly built subway stations

Art ici al Intelligence as an Enable for Cognitive Self Organizing Future Networks Siddi que Latif Far rukh Pervez Muhammad Usama Jun aid Qadir National University of Science and Technology Islamabad Information Technology University IT Lahore The explosive increase in number of smart devices hosting sophisticated applications is rapidly affecting the landscape of information communication technology industry Mobile subscriptions expected to reach billion by would drastically increase the demand of extra capacity with aggregate throughput anticipated to be enhanced by factor of In an already crowded radio spectrum it becomes increasingly if cult to meet ever growing application demands of wireless bandwidth It has been shown that the allocated spectrum is seldom utilized by the primary users and hence contains spectrum holes that may be exploited by the unlicensed users for their communication As we enter the Internet Of Things oT era in which appliances of common use will become smart digital devices with rigid performance requirements such as low latency energy efc ien cy etc current networks face the vexing problem of how to create ufc ent capacity for such applications The th generation of cellular networks envisioned to address these challenges are thus required to incorporate cognition and intelligence to resolve the aforementioned issues Cognitive radios CRs and self organizing wireless networks are two major technologies that are envisaged to meet the future needs of such next generation wireless networks CRs are intelligent and fully programmable radios that can dynamically adapt according to their prevalent environment In other words they sense the spectrum and dynamically select the clearer frequency bands for better communication in the most prevailing conditions In this way CRs can adaptively tune their internal parameters to optimize the spectrum usage transmission waveform channel access methods and modulation schemes with enhanced coverage However it is due to the recent advancements in machine learning software de ned radio SDR that CRis able to emerge from simulation environment to the real time applications The overwhelming tr afc growth coupled with the greedy approach towards high quality of service Qo has been major challenge for current wireless systems in terms of network resources and Qo new paradigm for wireless communication called has been envisioned to address these challenges The major component of the envisioned scheme is Self Organizing Network SON SON is relatively new concept in perspective of wireless cellular networks it refers to an intelligent network that learns from its immediate environment while autonomously adapting accordingly to ensure reliable communication In fact SON underlines new aspect for automation of future networks in era The sensing learning and reasoning behavior of both CRs and SON is achieved by extensively using art ici al intelligence and machine learning techniques The CRs are an evolved form of SDR realized by the embodiment of cognitive engine CE that exploits the techniques for the cognitive behavior to decide optimal ly The CR network CR follows the cognitive cycle for unparalleled resource management and better network performance Cognitive cycle as illustrated in gu re begins with sensing of dynamic radio environment parameters subsequently observing and learning recursively the sensed values for recon gu ration of the critical parameters in order to achieve the desired objectives

This article has been accepted for publication in future issue of International Journal of Communication Systems but has not been fully edited Content may change prior to final publication Citation information Pre print ar Xiv cs CR DOI dac Time Assisted Authentication Protocol Muhammad Bilal University of Science and Technology Korea Electronics and Telecommunication Research Institute Rep of Korea bilal tri re kr en gr bilal yahoo com Shin Gak Kang Electronics and Telecommunication Research Institute Rep of Korea sg kang tri re kr Abstract Authentication is the first step toward establishing service provider and customer association In mobile network environment lightweight and secure authentication protocol is one of the most significant factors to enhance the degree of service persistence This work presents secure and lightweight keying and authentication protocol suite termed TAP Time Assisted Authentication Protocol TAP improves the security of protocols with the assistance of time based encryption keys and scales down the authentication complexity by issuing re authentication ticket While moving across the network mobile customer node sends re authentication ticket to establish new sessions with service providing nodes Consequently this reduces the communication and computational complexity of the authentication process In the keying protocol suite key distributor controls the key generation arguments and time factors while other participants independently generate key chain based on key generation arguments We undertake rigorous security analysis and prove the security strength of TAP using CSP and rank function analysis Keywords authentication key distribution network security CSP rank functions
